title: New State and Deputy Ministers sworn in
content: Two new State Ministers and five Deputy Ministers were sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat, today.
The list of new ministers is as follows:

title: TV presenter arrested over assault
content: TV presenter and journalist Mahesh Nishshanka has been arrested by Kadawatha Police.

title: Workers’ strike disrupts postal service
content: Postal services have come to a standstill owing to the strike launched by postal workers based on several demands, the United Postal Trade Unions’ Front said.

title: Norochcholai CEB engineers threaten shutdown today
content: If the authorities fail to provide a favourable response, the CEB Engineers who are currently on a work to rule campaign will decide to suspend work at the Norochcholai coal power plant today, said the CEB Engineers’ Union President Athula Wanniarachchi.

title: U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met face-to-face
content: U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met face-to-face Tuesday morning for their highly anticipated summit.

title: SLFP should leave the UNP government – Former President
content: Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) cannot be build by just changing the positions, says former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Sri Lanka targets to reach mine-free status by 2020
content: Sri Lanka is making steady progress towards the goal of mine free status and remains hopeful of completing mine action by 2020, Sri Lanka’s Permanent Representative to the United Nations in Geneva Ambassador A.L.A. Azeez said.

title: Dayasiri arrives at CID
content: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department a while ago, to give a statement over accepting funds from a company affiliated to the Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) owned by Arjun Aloysius.

title: Sajith to build 2,500 model villages under ‘Udagam’ programme
content: Construction work on 724 new model villages have begun throughout the country under the ‘Udagam’ housing programme, Housing and Construction Minister Sajith Premadasa said.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa always a friend of Muslims – Gotabaya
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa participated in an Ifthar celebration on Friday (8) at a leading Colombo hotel.

title: President requests Britain to arrest or deport editor of LankaeNews
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday requested Britain to have London-based LankaeNews Editor Pradeep Sandaruwan Senadheera arrested or sent back to Sri Lanka. He made the request during a 30-minute a meeting with British High Commissioner James Dauris whom he summoned to his Paget Road residence.

title: Trump arrives in Singapore for historic summit with North Korea’s Kim
content: U.S. President Donald Trump arrived in Singapore on Sunday for a historic summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un that could lay the groundwork for ending a nuclear stand-off between the old foes and the transformation of the isolated state.

title: Trump Kim summit: North Korean leader arrives in Singapore
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has arrived in Singapore for his scheduled summit meeting with US President Donald Trump.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa pushed up Sri Lanka’s debt to Rs. 7,391 billion
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, who created a world record through unfettered borrowings, should tell the country how he proposes to make his claim to reduce taxes by 20% a reality, if he is returned to power.

title: Two underworld leaders shot dead
content: Two members of an underworld gang were killed during a shootout with the Police Special task Force.

title: Shocked to see charge sheeted VC appointed as MP – Minister
content: A former vice chancellor of the South Eastern University facing a list of charges currently being investigated by the University Grants Commission, has ironically taken oaths as an MP last morning, Higher Education and Cultural Affairs Minister Dr.Wijayadasa Rajapakshe told Parliament yesterday.

title: Veteran journalist Somaweera Senanayake passes away
content: Veteran teledrama, film script writer, novelist and journalist, Somaweera Senanayake has passed away at a private hospital in Colombo.

title: Will donate Aloysius money to charity: Sujeewa
content: State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe, who was accused of receiving monies from the W.M. Mendis Company affiliated to the Perpetual Treasuries Ltd. (PTL) said today that he would donate the three million rupees his campaign team had obtained to social welfare if Speaker Karu Jayasuriya or a Chief Prelate asked him to do so.

title: Kerosene price will be reduced from Monday – State Minister
content: The price of kerosene will be reduced by Rs. 25 to Rs. 30 per litre with effect from next Monday, State Minister Dilip Wedaarachchi said.

title: Facebook staff to learn Sinhala insults after Sri Lanka riots
content: Three months after Sri Lanka was rocked by deadly anti-Muslim riots fuelled by online vitriol, Facebook is training its staff to identify inflammatory content in the country’s local languages.

title: Treasury bond scams: Sujeewa gets Rs. 3 million from PTL subsidiary
content: State Minister for International Trade Sujeewa Senasinghe had received Rs. 3 mn from W. M. Mendis Company, a subsidiary of Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL), the Criminal Investigation department (CID) informed Fort Additional Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne, yesterday.

title: Range Bandara’s son arrested
content: Police have arrested Yasodha Range Bandara, the son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara, over the offences of drunk driving and misuse of public property.

title: ICT industry poised to attain us$ 5 billion status – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said Sri Lanka’s ICT sector can attain the status of a $5 bn industry effectively with the right funding and appropriate investment and support which are now adequately available.

title: JO SPLIT, CAUSE FOR SLFP TO LOSE POST – MINISTER
content: Co-cabinet spokesperson, Minister Rajitha Senaratne yesterday stated that the vote against Dr. Sudharshani Fernadopulle was not personal and that it was the split within the Joint Opposition that had led to her loss.

title: Singapore firm to draw up Chinese investment zone plan in Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka’s cabinet has approved a proposal for Singapore-based urban planning consultancy Surbana Jurong Pvt Ltd, owned by state investor Temasek Holdings Ltd, to draw up a plan for a Chinese investment zone in the country’s southern port city of Hambantota, a government spokesman said on Wednesday.

title: No undue ambition behind shutting down TNL transmission – TRC
content: Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) says that action was taken to shut down TNL’s illegal transmission in Polgahawela due it causing interference to other government channels and causing a loss to the government and that there is no other undue ambition behind the action.

title: Range Bandara’s son injured in accident
content: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara’s son has been hospitalized due to a motor accident in the Kottapitiya junction, on the Chilaw-Puttalam road.

title: CEB engineers threaten to shut down Norochcholai
content: The Ceylon Electricity Board Engineers’ Union (CEBEU) has warned that it will have to shut down the Lakvijaya Coal Power Station, Norochcholai if the environmental protection license (EPL) is not granted by next Tuesday.

title: Mangala promises probe on TNL repeater station shutdown
content: Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera yesterday in Parliament promised to investigate the Telecommunication Regulatory Commission’s action to shut down TNL’s repeater station at Polgahawela.

title: China has dragged Male into debt trap: Mohamed Nasheed
content: China has dragged the Maldives into a debt trap and any future government formed by the Opposition will be unable to repay the loans unless a review cuts them to real value, exiled former President Mohamed Nasheed told Reuters on Monday.

title: TNL TV transmission tower at Polgahawela sealed by TRC
content: The transmission tower of TNL TV at Polgahawela was sealed by the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) today.

title: Speaker says more unreleased sections of Bond Commission report expected
content: Speaker informs Parliament that since only a portion of the Bond Commission report has been received, he will table the full after other sections are also presented to him.

title: Hema Nalin Karunaratne passes away
content: Popular television presenter, compere and journalist Hema Nalin Karunaratne has passed away at the age of 55.

title: Unreleased sections of Bond Commission report handed over to Speaker
content: Sections C350 to C360 of the bond commission report which had not been made public thus far, was handed over to the speaker of parliament by the Presidential Secretariat a short while ago.

title: President’s former Chief of Staff & former STC Chairman further remanded
content: President’s former Chief of Staff I. H. K. Mahanama and former State Timber Corporation (STC) Chairman P. Dissanayaka who were arrested for  accepting a bribe of Rs.20 million from an Indian businessman, were further remanded till June 19 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Ranga Dassanayake today.

title: White House says ‘powerful’ sanctions to remain on North Korea
content: The White House said on Monday its policy of tough sanctions on North Korea has not changed, days after U.S. President Donald Trump said he no longer wanted to use the phrase “maximum pressure” to describe the campaign to press North Korea to give up its nuclear weapons.

title: Rs. 80 billion allocated for Gamperaliya project
content: Rs. 80 billion has been allocated to the “Gamperaliya project” which is focused on village development, Minister Mangala Samaraweera said yesterday.

title: ‘100-day’ prepared by those supported Maithri, not only UNP: Harin
content: The 100-day programme was not a part of the UNP manifesto but a policy document which was prepared and marketed by those who supported the common candidate Maithripala Sirisena for the presidency, UNP Spokesman and Publicity Unit Chief Harin Fernando said today.

title: Sri Lanka increases efforts to attract more Chinese tourists
content: Sri Lanka’s Tourism Minister John Amaratunga recently held talks with China’s tourism and airline officials to encourage more Chinese visitors to the country, local media reported Sunday.

title: Sri Lanka’s Silva joins West Indies tour after funeral
content: Sri Lanka all-rounder Dhananjaya de Silva rejoined the national team touring the West Indies after attending his father’s funeral, officials said on Monday.

title: Cause for the viral flu spreading across Southern Province identified
content: The Influenza A virus has been identified as the cause for the spreading virus flu in the South, the Medical Research Institute announced.

title: Keerthi asks Aloysius to name beneficiaries of PTL largesse
content: Director of the Campaign for Free and Fair Elections (CaFFE) Executive, Keerthi Tennakoon, yesterday handed over a letter to Perpetual Treasuries (Pvt) Ltd (PTL) owner Arjun Aloysius and its former CEO Kasun Palisena, through Welikada prison officials, requesting them to reveal the names of politicians who had received money from PTL.

title: Speaker to name MP’s who phoned Aloysius
content: The list of MPs who have had telephone conversations with former Perpetual Treasuries beneficiary owner Arjun Aloysius will be tabled in Parliament this week, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya said.

title: Prof. Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa appointed as SLFP General Secretary
content: Professor Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa has been temporarily appointed as Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) General Secretary by SLFP’s Central Committee a short while ago.

title: Postal workers to go on strike
content: The Joint Trade Unions of Postal Service Workers issued a statement that all Postal service employees will go on strike with effect from midnight today (03).

title: Sri Lanka-China FTA offers higher gains to Sri Lankan exports: study
content: The Sri Lanka-China Free Trade Agreement (FTA) would result in higher gains for Sri Lankan exports compared to products imported from China which are already entering the country duty free, local media reported Saturday, quoting a recent study.

title: Sri Lankan rupee hits fresh record low on dollar demand from banks, importers
content: The Sri Lankan rupee touched a fresh record low of 158.80 on Friday owing to dollar demand from foreign banks and importers but ended steady on late inflows from remittances, dealers said.

title: Malik, Wimal, Keerthi demand release of PTL payment list
content: Development Strategies and International Trade Minister Malik Samarawickrema has urged Speaker Karu Jayasuriya to release a list containing names of 118 recipients of funds from tainted primary dealer Perpetual Treasuries (PTL) or companies affiliated with it, if such a list existed.

title: IMF says sustaining Sri Lanka’s reform momentum ‘critical’
content: The International Monetary Fund late on Friday said Sri Lanka continues to make important progress on fiscal consolidation but needs to keep up the reform momentum to boost economic growth.

title: FOUR SC JUDGES DECLINE TO HEAR GOTA’s PLEA
content: Four Supreme Court Judges have declined to sit on the Bench to hear the Fundamental Rights petition filed by former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa, citing personal reasons.

title: CDB bags Sri Lanka mandate
content: China Development Bank has knocked out commercial lenders on a US$ 1 billion loan for the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, underscoring China’s ability to support the Belt and Road initiative with cheap financing.

title: AG’s advice sought to release full bond commission report – President’s Secretary
content: President’s Secretary Austin Fernando says that he has sought the Attorney General’s advice to release the full report of the Commission of Inquiry appointed to investigate the Central Bank treasury bond scam.

title: ‘Anyone in the Judicial sector to go behind politicians is bad’, President emphasized
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says it is not suitable to create an environment where anyone in the Judicial sector to go behind the politicians when the government is implementing the policy of upholding the rule of law.He made these remarks participating in an event to open the new court complex in Waththala, yesterday (May31th).

title: Loans of drought affected to be cancelled
content: The Government is taking measures to cancel the loans taken by the poor from the micro finance companies in the drought affected areas, Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka Cricket Chief Hits Back At Arjuna Ranatunga
content: Sri Lanka’s cricket chief on Thursday lambasted former skipper Arjuna Ranatunga for casting a corruption shadow over the country’s 2011 World Cup defeat and in turn questioned Ranatunga’s actions as a player.

title: Field Marshal ready to contest next prez poll
content: KANDY – Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has said in Kandy that he will contest the 2020 presidential election if his party gave him nomination.

title: China’s free trade talks with Sri Lanka hit major hurdles
content: Talks between China and Sri Lanka for a free trade agreement have hit major hurdles, mainly because Beijing will not agree to Colombo’s demand for a review of the deal after 10 years, Sri Lanka’s top negotiator said.

title: JO decides to oppose 20A
content: The hierarchy of the joint opposition unanimously decided yesterday to oppose the 20th Amendment to the Constitution proposed by the JVP to abolish the Executive Presidency, an official said.

title: President loses his cool
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said, the late Ven. Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera never intended to choose a common candidate, for the Presidential Election, with the aim of stealing from the Central Bank.

title: Sri Lanka signs deal with Schlumberger subsidiary for $50 million seismic study
content: Sri Lanka on Wednesday signed an agreement with a subsidiary of U.S. firm Schlumberger for a $50 million seismic study off the country’s east coast to evaluate any prospective oil resources, a senior government official said.

title: Railways goes to CID over sabotage
content: The Railway Department has registered a complaint with the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) that the railway workers on strike have caused damages train engines and compartments, Additional General Manager (Operations) Vijaya Samarasinghe said.

title: New Sri Lanka Map launch tomorrow
content: New Map of Sri Lanka which consists additional two square kilometer land due to image of Port City produced by the Survey Department will be launched tomorrow (31st May)

title: 118 people benefited from the Bond Scam – Dayasiri Jayasekara
content: It seems that are many individuals who had benefitted from the Bond Scam. Former Minister Dayasiri Jayasekera is the latest name to become embroiled in this incident after details came to light regarding a bank cheque

title: GMOA calls for more vaccines as flu death toll rises
content: Although a batch of flu vaccines is on the way, the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital in Galle is still under-equipped and underfunded to deal with the current flu epidemic, GMOA Co-Secretary Kanchika Samararatne said on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka begins clean-up campaign after monsoon rains killing 24
content: Sri Lanka’s Disaster Management Center (DMC) on Tuesday said the tri forces along with the police and relief teams had begun a massive clean-up campaign in several districts affected by the monsoonal rains as water levels receded.

title: Railway token strike launched
content: The 48-hour token strike of the Railway Technical Services Trade Union Committee (RTSTUC) was launched a short while ago, RTUSTSTS President P. Sampath Rajitha said.

title: Dayasiri says 118 other MPs took Rs.1.3 billion from Aloysius
content: Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara who admitted he had received a sum of Rs.1 million from a company affiliated to Arjun Allosius’s Perpetual Treasuries yesterday said 118 other Parliamentarians has taken a sum totaling Rs.1.3 billion for electioneering from the businessman.

title: Sri Lanka says pitch-fixing allegations hard to believe
content: Sri Lanka’s top cricket administrators say it is difficult to believe allegations of pitch-fixing in a 2016 test match against Australia which have triggered a probe by the International Cricket Council (ICC).

title: Actress Deepani Silva arrested over accident
content: Actress Deepani Silva has been arrested by the Bandaragama police this morning in connection with an accident in which her car collided with a three-wheeler in Bandaragama injuring a child.

title: Provide 3D spectacles for cinema goers
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe had informed the State Film Corporation Chairman to get the cinema hall owners to provide three dimensional spectacles to viewers who come to watch movies made using high technology.

title: Possibility of a snap presidential election anytime after 9 January 2019
content: As the month of June approaches, we realise that the incumbent President now has only 18 full months in office before the last date by which a presidential election should be held and a new president declared elected.

title: Rs. 300 million earned from recycled garbage
content: The government was able to earn Rs. 300 million from recycling garbage during the last six months, Megapolis and Western Development Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said.

title: Exclusive: Cricket match-fixers caught in the act in Sri Lanka
content: Al Jazeera’s Investigative Unit has revealed how criminals fixed two Test matches – the highest level of international cricket – and were planning to fix a third.

title: China delays Hambantota Port deal’s final tranche
content: The Chinese company-lessee of Hambantota Port is refusing to release the final lease rent of US$585 million to the Sri Lankan Government unless a man-made island – which has been built as an entertainment facility off Hambantota – is also given, as part of the deal.

title: ICC launches probe into ‘pitch-fixing’ in Sri Lanka
content: A Test match between India and Sri Lanka last year might have been played on a pitch doctored at the behest match-fixers, a sting operation has claimed, prompting the International Cricket Council (ICC) to launch an investigation into the matter on Saturday.

title: Dhananjaya De Silva quits West Indies tour after father’s murder
content: The father of Sri Lankan cricket allrounder Dhananjaya de Silva was shot dead by unidentified gunmen on the eve of the national team’s departure to the West Indies on Friday, police said.

title: Government to launch IT surveillance
content: A multi-stakeholder network involving law enforcement agencies and intelligence services was being trained to detect drug trafficking via social media (including Facebook), the deep web, dark web and dark nets, through information technology-based surveillance and infiltration of these modes of transfer.

title: At least 46,000 new tax files were ‘voluntarily’ opened in just a month: Finance Minister
content: At least 46,000 new tax files were opened within the first month after the new Inland Revenue Act was implemented, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera said on Wednesday.

title: Sri Lanka accepts $1 billion, 8-year syndicated loan from China Development Bank
content: Sri Lanka has accepted an eight-year China Development Bank $1 billion syndicated loan to repay loans maturing this year, two top Finance Ministry officials said on Friday.

title: Rain disaster affected nears126,000
content: The National Disaster Management Center (DMC) yesterday announced that more than 125,954 persons belonging to 32,136 families have been affected by the prevailing adverse weather condition in the country with 13 deaths reported so far.

title: Treasury bond scams: UPFA MP received Rs. 1 million from PTL subsidiary
content: Additional Solicitor General (ASG) Yasantha Kodagoda yesterday told Fort Magistrate that a member of parliament had received Rs. 1 mn in 2015 from Walt and Row Associates affiliated to primary dealer Perpetual Treasuries Limited involved in the Treasury bond scams perpetrated in 2015 and 2016.Although, Kodagoda didn’t name the MP in open court, a B report filed in respect of the magisterial inquiry identified the politician as Kurunegala District MP Dayasiri Jayasekera.

title: Sri Lankan rupee falls on importer dollar demand
content: The Sri Lankan rupee fell on Thursday on importer dollar demand, while exporters stayed on the sidelines on expectation the currency would weaken further in line with other emerging markets.

title: Dhananjaya de Silva’s father killed in shooting at Ratmalana
content: A member of the Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia Municipal Council, who is also the father of Sri Lankan cricketer Dhananjaya de Silva, has been killed in a shooting incident at Ratmalana last night, the Police Spokesman said.

title: INTERPOL confirms Arjuna Mahendran is in Singapore
content: INTERPOL has confirmed that the Former Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, Arjuna Mahendran, is in Singapore.

title: Navy alerted as water level of Diyawanna Oya rises
content: The Navy was being kept in readiness following a warning issued to Speaker Karu Jayasuriya by Minister of Western Development and Megapolis Patali Champika Ranawaka that the Parliamentary complex might go under water if the water levels of the Diyawanna Oya rises further.

title: Files on Tamil Tigers and MI5 in Sri Lanka erased at UK Foreign Office
content: Britain’s Foreign Office destroyed almost 200 files on Sri Lanka dating from the start of a Tamil Tiger uprising during which MI5 and the SAS secretly advised the country’s security forces, it has emerged.

title: RAINS WREAK HAVOC, OVER 100,000 AFFECTED
content: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said a total of 105,352 persons (18,542 families) were affected and eleven deaths have been reported so far due to the prevailing inclement weather.

title: Australian, UN to help Sri Lanka prepare to face natural disasters
content: The Australian Government, WFP and UNICEF have signed a 3-year partnership (2018-2020) with a funding of AUD750,000 (around 89 million Sri Lanka Rupees), to ensure stronger preparedness and faster, more integrated responses to natural disaster emergencies in Sri Lanka.

title: 10 dead, nearly 85,000 affected by severe weather
content: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) says that 84,943 persons in 14 districts have been affected due to the heavy monsoon rain and strong winds across Sri Lanka.

title: Petroleum Minister calls for new refinery system
content: Petroleum Resources Development Minister Arjuna Ranatunga yesterday stated that country could save US$ 400–450 million per year through a new and more efficient oil refinery system.

title: Sri Lanka hikes cricket wages by 34 percent
content: Sri Lanka’s cricket board on Tuesday increased wages for national players by more than a third after making record profits in 2017.

title: Tobacco kills 20,000 Sri Lankans every year: official
content: Around 20,000 Sri Lankans die every year due to the diseases caused by the use of tobacco, an official here said on Tuesday.

title: Cabinet approves 12.5 percent bus fare hike
content: The Cabinet has approved a 12.5% bus fare hike and to increase the minimum fare up to Rs 12 with effect from midnight, Deputy Minister of Transport Ashoka Abeysinghe said.

title: Johann Peries second Sri Lankan to summit Mt. Everest
content: Sri Lanka’s Johann Peries successfully summited the 29,030 feet of Mount Everest at 5.55 a.m in Nepal time today.

title: Rain havoc claims more lives
content: The Ratnapura, Galle, Matara, Kegalle, Kalutara, Anuradhapura, Mullaitivu, Trincomalee, Badulla, Nuwara Eliya and Matale districts were affected by the South-Western monsoonal rains.

title: Over 13,000 affected by adverse weather – 1,024 displaced
content: Due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, 1,024 persons have been displaced while a total of 13,314 have been affected, stated the Disaster Management Center (DMC). According to the DMC, 7 deaths have been confirmed so far due to the current weather condition.

title: Using taxpayers’ money to mislead the people – Rohan Welivita
content: A press release has been made to respond government’s recent clarification on fuel prices by media secretary of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Five dead in adverse weather
content: Five people were reported dead due to adverse weather conditions with the Meteorology Department predicting landslides and floods if the heavy rains persist in the country in the next few days.

title: NBRO issues a Level 3 Landslide warning
content: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO), issued a level 3 Landslide Early Warning at 7:30 PM on Saturday (May 20), requesting the public to evacuate to safer locations.

title: Rajapaksas trying to throw nation again into “Vipath Maga”: Mangala
content: Taking a swipe at former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera today said that both former leaders now seem to be engaged in an untiring effort to throw the country again into “Vipath Maga” (the destructive path).

title: The 16 SLFP MPs will meet with former President on the 23rd May
content: The 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) MPs who left the unity government will meet the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on the 23rd May.

title: SLFP Central Committee decides to appoint interim office bearers
content: Minister Mahinda Amarawera elaborated on the decision taken by the SLFP Central Committee to appoint an interim office bearer.

title: Colombo Mayor suspends parking meter fines
content: Colombo Mayor Rosy Senanayake yesterday instructed the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) Commissioner to suspend all fines charged from parking meters in the city.

title: JVP hits back at Rajitha
content: JVP MP Vijitha Herath yesterday rejected the statement made by Minister Rajitha Senaratne where he compared the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) with the LTTE and said it was surprising for the minister, who had led a terrorist outfit known as “Pra” to make such a statement.

title: Plane crashes in Cuba killing more than 100, investigation underway
content: More than 100 people were killed when a Boeing 737 crashed soon after taking off from Havana in what appeared to be Cuba’s worst air disaster in nearly 30 years, and there were only three survivors, officials and state media said on Friday.

title: Historic ‘Aaloka Pooja’ at Kelaniya Sets to Kindle 28,619 Lamps for Commemoration of Fallen War Heroes
content: Parallel arrangements have been finalized by the Army with the cooperation of sister services, Police and Civil Security Department to commemorate all fallen War Heroes who laid their precious lives against LTTE terrorism in a fitting mega ‘Aaloka Pooja’ (lighting) ceremony at Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya on Saturday (19) evening to coincide with the main ceremony on National War Heroes’ Day (May 19) at Battaramulla.

title: Country in a debt trap due to flaws of Rajapaksa regime – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday said that the country was trapped in a vicious cycle of debt due to flaws in the economic management and policies of the previous Mahinda Rajapaksa regime.

title: Man fined Rs.10,120 for not paying 30-rupee parking fee
content: A man who failed to pay a parking fee of Rs. 30 at a parking slot in Wellawatte, has been fined Rs. 10,120 after a lapse of 13 days.

title: Lankan Airlines passengers to arrive the airport 3 hours early
content: SriLankan Airlines wish to inform all passengers, to arrive at the airport three hours prior to the departure time effective today, 17th May 2018, 12.00pm onwards until further notice.

title: Bus owners get fare hike, call off strike
content: The All Ceylon Private Bus Association yesterday announced that it had called off the bus strike which was scheduled to commence today as the Transport Ministry had agreed to a 12.5 percent bus fare increase and a minimum fare of Rs.12. The bus operators demanded a 15 percent increase and a Rs.15 minimum fare.

title: Sri Lanka aims to control drought, floods through Chinese technology
content: Sri Lanka is looking at the possibility of controlling droughts and floods through the use of Chinese technology, local media quoting Minister of Primary Industries and Social Welfare Daya Gamage said on Wednesday.

title: Iran agrees to build new refinery for Sri Lanka -govt spokesman
content: Iran has agreed to build a new oil refinery for Sri Lanka in addition to upgrading its ageing 50,000 barrel per day (bpd) state-owned refinery, Sri Lankan cabinet spokesman Rajitha Senaratne said on Wednesday.

title: Prices of goods and services are rising due to fuel price hike – Mahinda Rajapaksa
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has made a press release on recent fuel price hike by stating “Following the recent increase in fuel prices, transport costs and the prices of goods and services have started rising.”

title: Keith Noyahr saved because of my intervention: Karu
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya said yesterday that senior journalist Keith Noyahr’s life was saved because of his intervention when Keith was abducted and he is prepared any moment to give a statement on this incident.

title: Anuruddha Polgampola arrested by CID
content: Former State Timber Corporation (STC) Chairman Anuruddha Polgampola was arrested last night by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID), Police said.

title: JVP comes out blazing against government
content: The JVP yesterday called on people to take to the streets against the exploitation by the government of the masses to cover the cost of its extravagance and frauds.

title: ‘Sri Lanka is the only country that has eradicated terrorism’
content: Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake took over as the 22nd Commander of the Sri Lankan Army in June 2017. The conduct of the army in the past, during the island’s civil war that it ended by defeating the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam in 2009, and its contentious presence and role in the country’s Tamil-majority north and east since then continue to dominate the discourse around post-war resettlement and reconciliation.

title: Cabinet approves 6.56% hike in bus fares
content: The Cabinet approval was granted today to increase bus fares by 6.56 per cent with effect from tomorrow.

title: Country recorded highest FDI, exports in 2017 – PM
content: Sri Lanka recorded its highest Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) of USD 1900 million in 2017, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday.

title: World Bank withdraws US$ 200M waste projects due to corruption
content: The World Bank (WB) last month withdrew US$ 200 million in funds, which were earmarked for a garbage disposal project and Kelani River Flood Protection work, alleging corrupt practice in the awarding of contracts, reliable sources told this reporter recently.

title: China approves USD 1 billion loan for Central Expressway
content: Chinese Ambassador in Colombo Cheng Xueyuan has informed Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe that the Chinese government has approved USD 1 billion as funding for the phase one of the Central Expressway project.

title: Rice imports fallen to 23.5 million US dollars in February
content: Rice imports fell 34.4 percent to 23.5 million US dollars in February 2018 from a year earlier, as harvest came in and domestic prices eased, official data showed. Sri Lanka’s rice imports surged from the second quarter of 2017 as the government cut import duties when a drought slashed the industry.

title: New state media heads appointed
content: Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera today appointed four Chairmen to state media institutions with immediate effect.

title: Rulers, officials should refrain from corruption
content: If Sri Lanka’s economy is to develop to the level expected, measures should be taken to keep corruption out of State institutions, former Defence Secretary and the Chairman of the “Viyath Maga” Organisation Gotabaya Rajapaksa said yesterday.

title: Iran-Sri Lanka leaders meet
content: President Maithripala Sirisena who is on a two day state visit to Iran met with President Hassan Rouhani of Iran yesterday (13).

title: There is no controversy between the Rajapaksa brothers – Mahinda Rajapaksa
content: There is no controversy between the Rajapaksa brothers as some say, said the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Free ambulance service for whole country under new foundation
content: The ’1990′ pre-hospital care free ambulance service will get a boost shortly with the introduction of legislation to expand the service to cover the whole island and ensure the smooth operation of the service in a sustainable manner.

title: SF says he did not apologise to President
content: Strongly denying that he had apologised to President Maithripala Sirisena for his recent criticism of the latter, Sustainable Development, Wildlife and Regional Development Minister Sarath Fonseka yesterday told…

title: NO PLAN TO TAKE OVER SAMURDHI BANK – GOVERNOR
content: There has been no decision to take over the Samurdhi Bank under the Central Bank, Central Bank Governor, Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy said.

title: Bus fare to increase by 10%: LPBOA
content: Bus fares for private busses are expected to be increased by a minimum of 10 percent with effect from next week, the Lanka Private Bus Owners Association (LPBOA) President Gemunu Wijeratne said today.

title: Fowzie sworn in as State Minister of National Unity and Reconciliation
content: UPFA MP A.H.M.Fowzie was sworn in as the National Unity and Reconciliation State Minister before President Maithripala Sirisena this morning.

title: Thel Kumara shot dead in Trincomalee
content: Hendavitharanage Selin Kumara alias ‘Thel Kumara’ has been shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Trincomalee this morning (11), police said.

title: Fuel prices will be reviewed every two months – Mangala
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera said the prices of fuel would be reviewed every two months and the prices would be changed accordingly.

title: Sri Lanka sharply raises fuel prices under IMF pressure
content: Sri Lanka hiked fuel prices Thursday by up to 130 percent following pressure from the International Monetary Fund and its central bank to reduce the burden of heavy subsidies on its struggling economy.

title: Fuel price hike from midnight today
content: The prices of fuel will be increased with effect from midnight today, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Rajitha Senaratne said a short while ago.

title: CID summons BBC journalist over tweet
content: BBC journalist Azzam Ameen has been asked to report to the Cyber Crimes unit of the Criminal Investigation Division (CID) this morning (10) so that a statement could be recorded from him.

title: Mahathir Mohamad, 92, to be sworn in as Malaysia’s PM after historic poll win
content: Malaysia’s Mahathir Mohamad will be sworn in as the world’s oldest elected leader on Thursday after his opposition alliance pulled off a stunning election win, ending six decades of rule by a coalition he once led.

title: Sri Lanka parliament backs special courts for bribery, corruption cases
content: Sri Lankan parliament on Wednesday approved a new law to establish courts to handle cases related to bribery and corruption to speed up cases that have dragged on for years.

title: Railway strike has been called off
content: The railway union strike which was launched at 12 noon today was called off a short while ago after the government agreed to meet their demands.

title: Railway strike from 12 noon today
content: The railway trade unions have decided to launch their strike action from 12 noon today (09), based on several demands including the failure by authorities to fulfill their promises on resolving railway workers’ issues.

title: COURT DIRECTS CABRAAL TO SUBMIT REPORT
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate yesterday issued an order directing former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal to submit a report in court within seven days. This is pertaining to the financial transactions regarding Sri Lanka’s bid to host the 2018 Commonwealth Games (CWG).

title: Sri Lanka leader calls for end to power struggle after defections
content: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Tuesday urged his own coalition government and the opposition to end a power struggle in order to achieve ambitious goals including anti-corruption measures.

title: Sengal Oya Irrigation Project to commence on May 10
content: The construction of the Sengal Oya Irrigation Project will commence on May 10, according to the State Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management, Palitha Range Bandara.

title: Two Sri Lankan women nabbed with gold jewellery worth Rs.10 million
content: Two Sri Lankan women have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for attempting to smuggle 1.1kg of gold worth Rs.10 million into the country.

title: $ 75 million EAP deal struck with $ 35 million initial infusion
content: The long-awaited and crucial deal on EAP Group, linked to the revival of ETI Finance and Swarnamahal Financial Services, has been struck with an investment commitment of $ 75 million (nearly Rs. 12 billion), of which around $ 35 million has been infused initially.

title: I will not retire in 2020 – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday expressed his desire to continue in politics beyond 2020. “I will not retire in 2020,” the President emphasised, addressing a mammoth May Day rally organised by the SLFP led UPFA at Chenkaladi in the Batticaloa district.

title: LG bodies: Government needs Rs.135 million monthly to upkeep 8689 members
content: According to local government ministry sources, Rs.135 million needs to be set aside monthly to pay the salaries of 8689 members elected to the local government bodies.

title: UNP will rule for next 20-30 years, promises PM
content: A UNP which will rule for the next 20-30 years and not just five, was the promise UNP Leader and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made to his supporters as the party commemorated May Day at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka approves $500 million LNG plant near Hambantota port
content: Sri Lanka’s state-run investment body has approved a $500 million liquefied natural gas plant by China Machinery Engineering Corp near a Chinese-controlled port and industrial zone.

title: Malaysia foils smuggling of 131 Sri Lankan immigrants
content: Malaysian police have intercepted a tanker with 131 Sri Lankans believed bound for Australia and New Zealand, smashing a large human smuggling ring that has been operating for a year.

title: Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) on digital innovations
content: Technology is gradually silencing people who are decrying the unwarranted delays when dealing with commercial banks and primary dealers in various legal and monetary transactions. Thanks to various system applications, such as the Blockchain Technology, that seems to be the way forward for many countries.

title: Leading gangster Dileepa killed in a shootout with STF
content: A leading underworld gangster Dilip Rohana Rodrigo alias Dileepa was killed in a shootout with the Special Task Force (STF) personnel at Mailapitiya in Kandy yesterday.

title: Lost medal of Dr. Lester James Peiris found inside private bus
content: The Lifetime Achievement Award presented to late Dr. Lester James Peries from India, which was reported missing from his residence few days ago, has been found on an overhead rack of a Kollupitiya-Kaduwela private bus, Police said.

title: I am ready to take on any challenge – Minister Fonseka
content: Minister Sarath Fonseka who took over the reins of the Ministry of Wildlife and Sustainable Development this week said he would not yield to political pressure when it came to wildlife policies.

title: Rs. 1 billion building rent for 5-year-period for use by parliament;  Speaker denies responsibility, points finger at government
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has rejected newly appointed Agriculture Minister Mahinda Amaaweea’s claim that the Agriculture Ministry, situated at Rajamalwatte, was shifted to a building at Rajagiriya on a request by parliament.

title: Sri Lanka to sign deals with Total, Schlumberger for seismic study
content: Sri Lanka will sign agreements with French oil and gas major Total and a subsidiary of U.S. firm Schlumberger for a seismic study off its east coast to evaluate any prospective oil resources, a top official said on Friday.

title: Milk powder prices to go up
content: The price of milk powder will increased by midnight today, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) said. Accordingly the price of 400 grams will be increased by Rs. 20 and 1 kilogram will increase by Rs. 50.

title: Sri Lanka targets more tourist arrivals from Middle East
content: Sri Lanka plans to attract more tourists from the Middle East by conducting promotion campaigns, a minister said on Thursday.

title: Twitter urges all users to change passwords after glitch
content: Twitter Inc urged its more than 330 million users to change their passwords after a glitch caused some to be stored in readable text on its internal computer system rather than disguised by a process known as “hashing”.

title: President orders to interdict his Chief of Staff and STC chairman
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has ordered to interdict his Chief of Staff Dr I.H.K. Mahanama and the Chairman of the State Timber Corporation P. Dissanayake, who were arrested by the Bribery Commission, with immediate effect.

title: Investigations continue into stolen awards of late Dr. Lester
content: The Golden Peacock Award & the Lifetime Achievement Silver Medal of Late Dr. Lester James Peries was stolen yesterday. These prestigious awards of the Late filmmaker were stolen while on display next to his mortal remains during his funeral service.

title: Cambridge Analytica: Facebook data-harvest firm to shut
content: Cambridge Analytica, the political consultancy at the centre of the Facebook data-sharing scandal, is shutting down.

title: JVP questions science behind reshuffle
content: The JVP yesterday demanded to know from the President and the government on what scientific basis the ministries had been allocated at Tuesday’s cabinet reshuffle.

title: Milk powder shortage in fortnight: Importers
content: Milk powder importers said yesterday they stopped importing milk powder from last week following its increase in the world market.

title: Over 32 kg gold smuggled from Sri Lanka seized in Chennai
content: In a span of less than 24 hours, officers of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI), Chennai Zonal Unit, seized a total of 32.249 kg of gold valued at Indian rupees 102.15 million. It was smuggled into India by sea and being transported to Chennai for sale.

title: Sri Lanka’s China-backed Port City sees up to $4 billion investment interest
content: A Chinese-backed real estate project near Sri Lanka’s main port is in discussion with investors for up to $4 billion in investments in its first phase, the developer said on Wednesday.

title: New State Ministers and Deputy Ministers sworn in
content: Eight State Ministers and ten Deputy Ministers were sworn in by President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat this morning.

title: Wild animals fleeing with the advent of new Minister: MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa quipped yesterday that in the reshuffle of the Cabinet, the only Ministry that underwent a scientific transformation was the Wildlife Ministry.

title: Dr. Lester James Peries’ State funeral today
content: The funeral of world renowned film producer Dr. Lester James Peries will be held at 3 pm today at Independence Square with full State patronage.

title: Sri Lanka, citing violence and dengue, cuts 2018 tourist arrivals target
content: Anti-Muslim violence and an outbreak of dengue fever in Sri Lanka have led the government to slash its target for tourist arrivals this year after a record 2017.

title: New Cabinet sworn in
content: The new Cabinet of Ministers was sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo today (1).

title: New Cabinet to be appointed today
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will appoint a new Cabinet of Ministers today (1), at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo. The Government yesterday (30 April), announced that all current Cabinet Members had been summoned to participate in the ceremony.

title: Over 600,000 people affected by drought in northern Sri Lanka
content: The number of people affected by drought in Sri Lanka has increased to 613,326, the Sri Lankan Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said in its situation report on Monday.

title: SB: 10 more SLFP MPs to leave government today
content: Former Minister S. B. Dissanayake yesterday said that 16 SLFP MPs who quit the government would join the Opposition on May 8, when the new session of Parliament is scheduled to be inaugurated.

title: PM promises further UNP reforms
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday promised further reforms to the United National Party (UNP) structure.

title: Veteran film director Dr. Lester James Peiris passes away
content: Internationally acclaimed Sri Lankan film producer and film director Dr. Lester James Peiris has passed away at the age of 99.

title: Sri Lanka Prime Minister’s Vesak Day message
content: Dhamma or the teachings of Buddha is a purifying factor for the human mind propelled by lust, hate and violence. The pious festival of Vesak reminds us the virtues of practising four focuses of mindfulness in order to dwell with Dhamma as no other refuge.

title: Sri Lanka President’s Vesak Day message
content: Buddhists all over the world celebrate the Vesak Festival with much religious fervour and enthusiasm to commemorate the important events that took place in the life of Gauthama Buddha on this day, namely the birth of Siddhartha Gauthama, Siddharta Gauthama’s supreme attainment of Buddhahood and the Mahaparinibbana.

title: School is the best medium to carry forward the message of national reconciliation – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the school is the best medium to carry forward the message of national reconciliation to the society.

title: Harsha says government won’t meddle with exchange rate
content: State Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs Dr. Harsha de Silva yesterday ruled out the possibility of introducing measures to contain the devaluation of the rupee, in the wake of the local currency hitting record lows against the U.S. dollar.

title: CB for tightening noose on tax evaders
content: Improved monitoring of high-end transactions, including car and property sales, would reduce tax evasion, the Central Bank said in its latest Annual Report, recommending that such transactions be matched with income declarations.

title: Ravi, Wijeyadasa tipped to receive Cabinet posts
content: Speculation is rife in political circles that the government is planning to accommodate former finance/foreign and justice ministers, Ravi Karunanayake and Wijeyadasa Rajapakse, respectively, in the Cabinet.

title: Gas cylinder price increased
content: The price of Litro and Laugfs domestic gas cylinders (12.5kg) will be increased by Rs. 245 with effect from midnight today (27).

title: Private bank in Wattala, robbed
content: The Wattala branch of a bank has been robbed by an individual who arrived on a motorcycle at around 2.30 PM today (27).

title: Sri Lanka up 10 places in world press freedom index
content: Sri Lanka has climbed 10 spots to 131 in the 2018 World Press Freedom Index compiled by Reporters Without Borders (RSF). The island nation has a score of 41.37.

title: “There is a lack of logic in the IMF stance” – CBSL Governor
content: The Central Bank projects Sri Lanka’s economy to pick up to 5.5 percent in 2019 from an estimated 5 percent this year.

title: The JVP’s 20th Amendment: A constitutional Trojan horse?
content: The JVP has stated that they will be presenting the motion to abolish the executive presidency as a private member’s Bill next month. Even though they have said that they will agree to electoral reform, too, if that is deemed to be a prerequisite for the abolition of the executive presidency, they have not given any indication that they will be including provisions for electoral reform as well in their draft 20th Amendment.

title: Etisalat and CK Hutchison to merge mobile operations in Sri Lanka
content: Etisalat and Hong Kong-based CK Hutchison have agreed to merge their mobile telecommunications operations in Sri Lanka on Thursday, the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange said.

title: New SLFP District & Electorate Organizers appointed
content: Mr. Ajith Basnayake has been appointed as the organizer of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party for Gampaha Electorate and he received his appointment letter  from the President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence today (26).

title: UPFA’s Eraj Fernando elected Mayor of Hambantota
content: Beliatta SLFP organizer Eraj Ravindra Fernando, who was involved in the “toy pistol’ case two years ago, was appointed as the Mayor of the UNP-led Hambantota Municipal Council with a majority of two votes this morning.

title: India’s ICF to construct 70 coaches for Sri Lanka Railways
content: The Integral Coach Factory (ICF), which is owned and operated by the Indian Railways, will begin work on 70 coaches commissioned by Sri Lanka in May.

title: President discusses problems of Sri Lankan Airlines
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that the Presidential Commission appointed to look into the alleged frauds and malpractices in SriLankan Airlines will commence recording of evidence within the next two weeks.

title: SLFP to undergo party reforms
content: Ports and Shipping Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe said SLFPers within the government will wholeheartedly support any move to bring the 16 SLFPers back into government.

title: UNP appoints new office bearers
content: The UNP politburo today nominated Akila Viraj Kariyawasam for the post of General Secretary, He was formerly the Deputy General Secretary.

title: Sri Lankan woman among the 10 dead in Toronto van attack
content: It has come to light that a Sri Lankan woman was among the 10 people killed in Toronto, Canada, when a man plowed a rental van into pedestrians on a crowded Toronto sidewalk.

title: No one has backbone to probe Gota’s abductions: Mervyn
content: The man behind the white van culture was former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa and the FCID had no backbone to investigate into the person who gave orders to the white van abductions, Former Minister Mervyn Silva said.

title: Special program to monitor excise offenses during Vesak
content: The Department of Excise has decided to conduct a special monitoring program to prevent excise offenses and irregularities in excise-licensed establishments, during the Vesak season.The program will take place from 27th April to 3rd May, reported the Excise Department.

title: Ranjan Ramanayake rues missed opportunities for batsman Ranil Wickremesinghe
content: Deputy Minister of Social Empowerment Ranjan Ramanayake has always been an outspoken character during his career in acting as well as his time in politics. Yesterday (April 23rd) he convened a media briefing to speak about Cricket and also spoke about the actions of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in cricketing terms.

title: Sri Lanka hopes to accelerate Chinese projects, says PM
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has said his government will work with China to accelerate ongoing projects and attract more Chinese investment in order to promote economic and social development in the island country.

title: Namal teaches rugby in Kashmir, bets on sports to ‘change discourse’
content: Sri Lankan Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa, who is on his maiden visit to Kashmir for a seven-day rugby training workshop, on Monday said that sports has the potential to change the “perception and discourse about Kashmir” — just as cricket changed the discourse in his country.

title: Driver kills 10, injures 15 plowing van into Toronto sidewalk crowd
content: A driver deliberately plowed his white Ryder rental van into a lunch-hour crowd in Toronto on Monday, killing 10 people and injuring 15 along a roughly mile-long (1.6-km) stretch of sidewalk thronged with pedestrians, police said.

title: Celebrating Vesak in April, a joke – prelate
content: All other Buddhist nations, the world over, are making grand preperations to celebrate Vesak Poya Day, on May 29, and it is absurd for Sri Lanka to celebrate Vesak on April 29, Malwatte Anunayake Ven. Niyangoda Sri Vijithasiri Thera says.

title: CBK takes JO to task
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been conspiring to break up the government and cause division between the President and Prime Minister for the last three years, former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga said.

title: ‘Potta Naufer’ bags awards for Avurudu games
content: Underworld drug kingpin ‘Potta Naufer’ serving a term for life for the assassination of High Court Judge Sarath Ambepitiya had won several awards for his skills in games at an Avurudu festival held at the Badulla Prison yesterday.

title: US rights report notes Sri Lanka’s slowness in transitional justice
content: US State Department mentioned arbitrary or unlawful killings by government or its agents in 2017. Torture remained endemic throughout Sri Lanka in 2017, the US has said, highlighting limited progress made by the government in establishing additional transitional justice mechanisms.

title: Rs.30 million to setup Police posts at 20 resorts
content: The government has allocated Rs.30 million to establish Police posts at 20 identified tourist hotspots to provide better security for tourists visiting the country.

title: It is wrong to impose laws on temples – Mahinda
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that the government is going to bring a draft bill on establishing new religious places and maintenance.

title: North Korea ‘halts missile and nuclear tests’, says Kim Jong-un
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has said he will suspend all missile tests and shut down a nuclear test site with immediate effect.

title: Kohli among 100 most influential people
content: Indian captain Virat Kohli has been named as one of Time Magazine’s 100 most influential people of 2018 following a stellar season last year in which he had amassed 2818 runs across all formats and slammed 11 centuries.

title: Interpol “red notice” for Sri Lanka’s ex-c.bank chief over bond sale
content: Interpol has issued a red notice, a request to locate and provisionally arrest, Sri Lanka’s former central bank governor Arjuna Mahendran who is wanted in connection with an investigation into a bond sale.

title: Time ripe for growth in Iran-Sri Lanka ties: Larijani
content: The Iranian Parliament Speaker, Ali Larijani, says that Iran and Sri Lanka should increase their trade interactions and develop political and trade ties.

title: Mirissa hoteliers told to obtain SLTDA registration
content: Project Management, Youth Affairs and Southern Development Minister Sagala Ratnayaka instructed all owners and hotel operators in Mirissa to strictly adhere to the registration processes of the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Two underworld gang members arrested in Thotalanga
content: Two persons suspected to be from a gang involved in a series of crimes have been arrested by STF personnel at Thotalanga, the Police spokesman said.

title: Taxi meters compulsory from today
content: Meters with the capability of issuing a printed bill will be compulsory from today, the National Council for Road Safety (NCRF) said.

title: Five dead in ‘ammonia tank’ accident at Horana rubber factory
content: Five people were killed and several others hospitalized after being exposed to Ammonia gas in Bellapitiya, Horana a short while ago, the Police said.

title: US has proposed conditions that harm Sri Lanka’s sovereignty – Hadunnetti
content: Sri Lanka should not obtain GSP concessions at the cost of having to surrender to the conditions put forward by the United States, says Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) MP Sunil Handunnetti.

title: Israeli tourists assaulted in Midigama: 4 arrested
content: A week after the assault on Dutch tourists in Mirissa, four suspects were arrested yesterday by the Weligama police over another assault on a group of Israeli tourists in Midigama last Sunday, Police said.

title: UK keen to expand direct investments in Sri Lanka – Trade Secretary
content: The United Kingdom’s Secretary of State for International Trade Liam Fox says that their government is ready for direct investments in Sri Lanka, while increasing the investments in the country.

title: 15 hurt in Swiss road accident involving Sri Lanka tourists
content: Fifteen people were injured on Wednesday (Apr 18) when a coach carrying tourists from Sri Lanka crashed with two trucks on a Swiss highway, police and media said.

title: ‘BLUE-GREEN’ ECONOMIC PLAN TO FULFILL SDGs – PRESIDENT
content: President Maithripala Sirisena delivering the keynote address at the Commonwealth Business Forum yesterday said the primary responsibility of implementing Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) lay with the government and that he, as the Head of State was personally leading these efforts.

title: Maithri will be SLFP presidential candidate – Duminda
content: The SLFP would field President Maithripala Sirisena as its candidate at the next presidential election, SLFP General Secretary and Agriculture Minister Duminda Dissanayake said yesterday.

title: World’s largest aircraft lands in Sri Lanka’s southern airport
content: The world’s largest aircraft, Antonov An-225 “Mriya” landed at the Mattala Rajapakse International Airport (MRIA) in Hambantota in southern Sri Lanka on Wednesday, officials said.

title: Private bank in Seeduwa robbed
content: An unidentified gunman robbed a private bank in Seeduwa town this morning.

title: Bill Gates hails Sri Lanka’s ‘high quality’ primary healthcare
content: The country’s primary healthcare system was held up as an example of what consistent dedication can achieve at this year’s CHOGM.

title: The relics of Lord Buddha will not be transported to Sri Lanka
content: The National Museum, part of the Ministry of Culture of Government of India, had last month approached M S University, seeking the relics as a temporary loan from the university.

title: Politicians are destroying cricket in Sri Lanka: Muttiah Muralitharan
content: Muttiah Muralitharan is a soft-spoken man, not one to get agitated easily. It was a rare sight to see him lose his cool when asked about Sri Lankan cricket’s downfall. In a conversation with ET, the Sri Lankan legend talks about what is wrong with Sri Lankan cricket, why wrist spinners offer better dividends in good batting conditions (referring to Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal) and more.

title: e-Health cards for all by 2020
content: e-Health cards will be provided for all Sri Lankans by 2020, Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Sri Lanka needs to create over 120,000 new jobs every year – WB report
content: The World Bank’s latest edition of South Asia Economic Focus titled “Jobless Growth?” alerted that massive job creation is needed in the South Asian countries in the next decade to catch-up with other countries with similar income levels.

title: Sri Lankan wins lawsuit against UK health service
content: A Sri Lankan refugee who could not speak English has won a legal battle against the National Health Service (NHS) in England after her child was brain damaged after hospital staff did not explain the importance of feeding a newborn.

title: Aluthgamage remanded till today
content: Former Minister of Sports Mahindananda Aluthgamage was yesterday (16) remanded until today (17) the Colombo Fort Magistrate, Lanka Jayaratne, due to his failure to fulfil bail conditions. Aluthgamage was arrested by the FCID on a charge of financial fraud to the tune of Rs 39 million in the purchase of sports equipment.

title: Mahindananda Aluthgamage arrested
content: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage was arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today on charges of misappropriating government funds amounting to Rs.39 million in 2014 to buy Carrom and Checker-boards.

title: Once close Indo-Sri Lankan ties can no longer be seen – C.V. Vigneshwaran
content: Chief Minister of the Northern Province C.V Vigneshwaran says the closeness between Sri Lanka and India, that once prevailed, can no longer be see.

title: President Sirisena to attend CHOGM today
content: President Maithripala Sirisena left to London in order to participate in the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) which will commence from today.

title: President performs New Year rituals
content: Keeping with the tradition, President Maithripala Sirisena performed New Year rituals yesterday (April 14) at his official residence in Colombo.

title: Opposition Leader’s message for Sinhala and Hindu New Year
content: My heartiest wishes to the Tamil and Sinhala people of this country on this special day of Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: New Year Message of Sri Lanka President and Prime Minister
content: The evolution of human civilisation has taken place from era to era enriching the people as cultured entities. The unique cultural events celebrated by various people around the world indicate the affinity and utmost dedication towards their traditional heritages, President Maithripala Sirisena said in his New Year message.

title: Auspicious times for Sinhala and Hindu New Year 2018
content: Sinhala Awurudu Litha 2018. Auspicious times for Sinhala and Hindu New Year 2018.

title: Sri Lankan navy arrest 3 people for smuggling 963,000 USD worth of gold
content: The Sri Lanka Navy, on Thursday apprehended three people for attempting to smuggle 24.2 kilograms of gold from the country via sea, the navy media unit said in a statement.

title: Chinese firm to invest $800 million on Sri Lanka Port City underground road
content: China Communication Construction Company (CCCC) will invest $800 million to build an underground road network to Sri Lanka’s Port City, a $1.4 billion project built on reclaimed land, a government minister said.

title: Four new ministers appointed; full Cabinet reshuffle after New Year
content: Some ministry subjects which fell vacant with the exit of six ministers who left the government after voting in favour of the No-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe were temporary handed over to four existing ministers by President Maithripala Sirisena today.

title: CPC under pressure to raise fuel rates
content: Sri Lanka’s state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) is under pressure to raise fuel prices as the refiner incurred huge losses this year, cabinet spokesman Rajitha Senaratne said on Wednesday.

title: Welcome for Gold Coast medallists
content: The first of the Sri Lankan medallists at the 21st Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast Australia, weightlifters Indika Dissanayake, Dinusha Hansani Gomes and Chaturanga Lakmal Jayasuriya who won Silver and Bronze medals arrived in the country.

title: President Instructs to provide assistance to drought hit farmers
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed to commence a project to cultivate 600 acres of sorghum to provide relief to the farmers who are in a helpless due to inability to engage in farming because of severe drought in Puttalam District.

title: 16 SLFP MPs quit national government
content: The sixteen SLFP Ministers and MPs who voted in favour of the no-confidence motion against the Prime Minister will step down from their posts in the National Government from midnight today (11).

title: Up to 200 feared dead in Algeria plane crash
content: At least 100 people were killed in a military plane crash in Algeria on Wednesday, local media said.

title: Sri Lanka plans to introduce E-motoring for vehicle registration
content: The Sri Lankan Motor Traffic Department is planning to introduce E-motoring system for the registration of vehicles through an online system by 2020, an official said on Tuesday.

title: New cabinet to be sworn in tomorrow
content: Political sources confirm a new cabinet will be sworn in tomorrow.

title: Sri Lanka targets Saudi tourism market
content: Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau has successfully concluded a two-day promotional mission to Saudi Arabia as part of its on-going efforts to develop new markets and increase the number of visitors and spend from the region to Sri Lanka.

title: President’s men to cross over to JO – MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, yesterday, said that the SLFP MPS, including six ministers, who voted for the no-faith motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe last week, would cross over to the Opposition when Parliament met again.

title: Want to make Lankan Premier League exciting – Arnold
content: Former Test cricketer Russel Arnold, who was last week appointed as the Director of Lankan Premier League tournament is confident of making the event a success. Sri Lanka is the only leading cricket playing nation in the Asian region not to have a franchise based tournament as India (IPL), Pakistan (PSL) and Bangladesh (BPL) have highly successful domestic T-20 competitions of their own. SLC had launched Sri Lanka Premier League in 2011 but the tournament crashed a year later due to lack of sponsorship.

title: SLFP Ministers to boycott today’s Cabinet meeting
content: The SLFP Central Committee met at President’s official residence in Colombo last night and all SLFP ministers decided to boycott today’s Cabinet meeting.

title: Lanka’s health service among world’s best – WHO Director General
content: Sri Lanka’s health service is one of the best not only in Asia but in the world, WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

title: Wigneswaran not the next CM candidate: TNA
content: Tamil National Alliance (TNA) MP M.A. Sumanthiran said yesterday Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran would not be given the chief ministerial candidacy again.

title: Sri Lanka, China make significant progress in building Belt and Road Initiative: Chinese ambassador
content: Sri Lanka and China in the past five years have made significant progress in jointly building the Belt and Road Initiative in the island country through which the country’s economy has greatly benefited, said Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka.

title: Search underway as 7 reported missing at Knuckles Range
content: Seven persons from Homagama who went to Knuckles Range reported missing. Search operation under way, Police said.

title: Fuel price revision in the offing
content: A price revision of fuel distributed by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) is in the offing, according to highly placed government sources.

title: National Aluth Sahal Mangalya held at premises of historical Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya under patronage of President
content: The National Aluth Sahal Mangalya which is known to be most venerated agricultural ritual of Sinhalese was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the historical Jaya SrI Maha Bodhiya in Anuradhapura yesterday morning (08).

title: Cabinet reshuffle before the Sinhala and Tamil New Year – Akila
content: President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, who had met for a discussion Saturday night, had agreed on a Cabinet reshuffle within the next four days, Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said today.

title: Serious safety lapses in SriLankan’s new planes
content: SriLankan Airlines lost certification to operate its new A320neo and A321neo aircraft for more than an hour outside the range of airports suitable for emergency landings after its Maintenance Department released one of the planes (registration 4R-ANE) for use despite having detected debris in the oil monitoring system of an engine.

title: UNP decides leadership shouldn’t be changed immediately
content: Majority in UNP Group and Working Committee have decided there is no need for a change in party leadership at this moment says Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam.

title: President issues warning over UNP No-Confidence Motions against SLFPers
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has warned that the UNP MPs move to press no confidence motions against select SLFPers could push the coalition partner towards the Joint Opposition members.

title: PM instructs to withdraw no-confidence against SLFP ministers
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed the UNP MPs to withdraw the no-confidence motion against the SLFP Ministers who voted in favour of the NCM against him, Department of Information Director General Sudharshana Gunawardana said today.

title: No-faith motion against 6 SLFP Ministers, Deputy Speaker handed over
content: The No-Confidence Motions signed by 20 UNP MPs against 6 SLFP Ministers and Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala who voted for NCM on PM handed over to the Speaker.

title: Sirisena has no control over SLFP / UPFA
content: The No-Confidence Motion, moved against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, has confirmed that President Maithripala Sirisena, who is the Chairman of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and the Leader of the United People’s Freedom Alliance, had failed to bring the parties or his group of Parliamentarians to one mindset, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) said yesterday (5).

title: Kiriella calls for sacking SLFP ministers who voted against PM
content: Five out of the six SLFP ministers who voted for the no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe have informed the UNP that they would quit their ministerial portfolios.

title: Indian court finds Bollywood actor Salman Khan guilty of poaching
content: An Indian court on Thursday found Bollywood movie star Salman Khan guilty in a poaching case dating from 1998, a verdict that could derail the career of one of the country’s most popular actors.

title: Dinusha Hansani wins bronze for Sri Lanka at Commonwealth
content: Sri Lankan weightlifter, Dinusha Hansani Gomez won the bronze medal at the 21st Commonwealth Games, lifting a total weight of 155 kg a short while ago.

title: Kabir Hashim resigns as UNP General Secretary
content: United National Party (UNP) General Secretary Kabir Hashim today said that he had decided to resign as the General Secretary of the United National Party.

title: National Govt. will continue: Ranil
content: Soon after defeating the no-confidence motion against him in Parliament, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told the media that the current National government will continue with the members who remain in it.

title: Three injured after gunmen open fire at car in Kosgoda
content: Three persons have been injured following a shooting incident at Athuruwella, Induruwa in the Kosgoda police division when two gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire at a car.

title: Rs. 500 billion spent for health sector annually: Health Minister
content: The annual expenditure of the state health sector records Rs. 500 billion each year, Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe defeats the No-Confidence Motion
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has defeated the No-Confidence Motion brought up against him by the Joint Opposition.

title: Palitha Range Bandara to vote against no-confidence motion
content: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara says that he and 27 other UNP MPs will vote against the No-Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister.

title: JVP to vote in favour of no-confidence motion
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) would vote in favour of the no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, MP Bimal Rathnayake told Parliament a short while ago.

title: SLFP to vote against Prime Minister – Lakshman Yapa
content: State Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardhana, in contradiction to the statement made by State Minister A.H.M. Fowzie said the Sri Lanka Freedom Party has decided to vote in favour of the No Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister.

title: Woman wounds three at YouTube headquarters in California, then kills herself
content: A woman who had voiced complaints online about YouTube opened fire with a handgun at the tech company’s headquarters near San Francisco on Tuesday, wounding three people before shooting herself dead, authorities and media said.

title: Tonight’s vote will decide PM’s fate
content: Parliament will debate the no-faith motion, moved by the Joint Opposition (JO), against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, from 10.00 am to 9.00 pm today. The vote on the motion will be taken at 9.00 pm as per a decision by party leaders.

title: Mano, Rishad to vote against no-confidence motion
content: All Ceylon Makkal Congress (ACMC) led by Minister Rishad Bathiudeen and Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) led by Minister Mano Ganeshan have decided to vote against the no-confidence motion on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: SLMC to defeat no-confidence motion against PM
content: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Leader Minister Rauff Hakeem said today his party decided to vote against the no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: PM meets President again
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the President’s residence a short while ago for another discussion with President Maithripala Sirisena in view of the no-faith motion against him in Parliament.

title: Mahinda vows to repeal new Inland Revenue Act
content: The Joint Opposition (JO) will set up a committee consisting of MPs to organise a series of protests against the new Inland Revenue Act, which took effect on Sunday, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says.

title: SLFP decides to request PM to resign before no-confidence vote
content: The Parliamentary Group of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has unanimously decided to request Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to step down from his position, Minister Chandima Weerakkody said.

title: Discussion held between President, Prime Minister and UNP Cabinet Ministers
content: A special meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is being held at the President’s official residence in Colombo, sources said.

title: ‘Inland Revenue Act to rationalize investor incentive schemes’
content: The introduction of the Inland Revenue Act has rationalized the incentive schemes provided to investors, said Minister of Finance and Media Mangala Samaraweera.

title: We have to end this PM’s authority – Vasudeva
content: Leader of the New Left Front, Member of Parliament Vasudeva Nanayakkara says, “If a caretaker government is appointed and action is taken towards holding a  General Election, and if Ranil Wickremesinghe comes into the Opposition and tries to obstruct such a caretaker government, I have to mention that we will support such a government.”

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa hopes Sirisena will back no-confidence motion against PM
content: Sri Lanka’s former president Mahinda Rajapaksa has expressed hope that incumbent Maithripala Sirisena – who was responsible for his ouster in 2015 – will support a no-confidence motion backed by the joint opposition against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: US GSP trade programme to restart in April
content: The United States’ GSP trade incentive program me for Sri Lanka will become active again on April 22, the US Embassy said yesterday.

title: Apeksha Hospital’s PET Scanner vested with the public
content: The Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Scanner purchased for the Apeksha Hospital in Maharagama, with public funds collected through a campaign supported by Manusath Derana, was officially vested with the people today (April 1).

title: New Inland Revenue Act to come into effect from today
content: According to the Ministry of Finance a new Inland Revenue Act is scheduled to come into effect today (1st April). Following the new Inland Revenue Act, a number of tax amendments will take place with effect from tomorrow (2nd April).

title: Maithri Gunaratne arrested with two shotguns
content: Secretary of the United National Freedom Front and former UNP provincial councillor Maithri Gunaratne, was arrested by the Kadugannawa police with two shotguns, at Pilimathalawa, Police said.

title: SLFP fully backs no-faith motion against Premier
content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) yesterday said it would, on April 04, vote for the no-confidence motion, moved by the Joint Opposition (JO) against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Mangala, Vigneswaran discuss Northern Province development projects
