content: Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera and Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajith Coomaraswamy met Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Vigneswaran in Jaffna yesterday.

title: President emphasized need of Line Ministries & Local Authorities working together in consensual & friendly manner
content: President Maithripala Sirisena emphasized the need of Line Ministries and Local Authorities working together in consensual as well as friendly manner.

title: Government invited China, India power struggle into Sri Lanka: Gotabaya
content: The government has invited the power struggle between China and India into the country by handing over national assets to these two countries, former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa said.

title: President to distribute 1,053 land deeds to farmers in Polonnaruwa district
content: A programme to distribute 1053 land deeds to the farmers in the Polonnaruwa district, under the national programme to distribute one million deeds, will be held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the Royal College in Polonnaruwa, today (30).

title: Bank of China opens in Colombo
content: The Bank of China has an important role to play in making finances and credit available to Sri Lankan enterprises that operate in the country. Bank of China can bring more and more Chinese investments in to Sri Lanka, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Retired Colonel arrested over Avant Garde floating armoury
content: Retired Army Colonel Don Thomas Alfred Wijethunga was arrested yesterday by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the investigation of the floating armoury of Avant Garde Maritime Services Ltd, Police said.

title: Prisons Commissioner arrested over Welikada Prison riot
content: A Commissioner of Prisons Department Emil Ranjan Lamahewa was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) last night in connection with the Welikada Prison riot in 2012.

title: Ten-year education plan for Jaffna – PM
content: A 10-year-plan will be implemented to improve the quality of education in Jaffna, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Vajira reads the riot act to President
content: The UNP yesterday warned President Maithripala Sirisena and the SLFP that the no-confidence motion (NCM) moved against UNP leader and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe would boomerang on them.

title: Govt. fulfills responsibilities to protect children from negative side of modern technology – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that the government fulfills the responsibilities to a maximum level to protect the younger generation from the negative side of modern technology.

title: Best results of 2017 G.C.E. Ordinary Level exam
content: The Department of Examinations announced the names and schools of the students who obtained the best results in the island at the 2017 G.C.E. Ordinary Level examination.

title: Cabinet adds NBT to alcohol
content: Cabinet today imposed the Nation Building Tax (NBT) on alcohol products in addition to existing taxes.

title: Mahindra & Mahindra to assemble vehicles in Sri Lanka
content: India’s homegrown auto major Mahindra & Mahindra on Tuesday announced that it will soon begin assembling vehicles in Sri Lanka, though it did not disclose the type of vehicles to be assembled or the scale of the operation.

title: Sri Lanka seeks India and Japan investment to balance China
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said Sri Lanka is seeking foreign investment from India, Japan and others amid criticism over his country’s reliance on Chinese loans for infrastructure projects.

title: Russia, Sri Lanka discuss oil refinery, oil and gas exports
content: Russia energy ministry said on Tuesday its officials have met the director of Sri Lanka’s General Trading Co and discussed a project of oil refinery in Sri Lanka.

title: One dead in Maligawatta shooting
content: A person was shot and killed by an unidentified gunman at Maligawatta, a short while ago.

title: SLFP and UNP Government politicos to support Namal
content: Several Members of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Government faction and many United National Party (UNP) members have met with the Joint Opposition (JO) in order to express their support to the No-Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister, said United People’s Freedom Alliance Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Restructure UNP or 27 of its MPs will back no-faith motion against PM – Range
content: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara yesterday said the UNP had to be restructured or 27 UNP MPs would either vote for the no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to be tabled on April 4 or abstain from voting.

title: JHU won’t back No-Confidence motion
content: The Jathika Hela Urumaya yesterday (26 March) asserted that they would not be supporting the No-Confidence motion brought against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe by the Joint Opposition.

title: Crimes have increased due to govt’s incapability – Gotabaya
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa today charged that crimes have increased in the country due to the incapability of the government.

title: Serve public devoid of political differences – President
content: Although parties contest elections as separate entities they should render a service to the public devoid of political differences after winning the elections, President Maithripala Sirisena said.

title: Shooting reported at Jothipala Mawatha in Malabe
content: A shooting incident has been reported targeting a residence at Jothipala Mawatha in Malabe in the early hours this morning.

title: No fuel hike
content: No decision has been taken to increase fuel prices in CEYPETCO fuel stations, Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) Chairman Dhammika Ranatunga said.

title: Navin sounds ominous warning to his party
content: If the UNP couldn’t resolve a number of serious issues within the next three months, the government might collapse within six months, Minister of Plantations Navin Dissanayake said addressing a meeting in Nuwara Eliya, on Saturday.

title: 46-year-old man shot dead in Malabe
content: A 46-year-old man has been shot and killed by unidentified gunmen at Chandrika Kumaratunga Mawatha in Malabe.

title: Modi govt officials look at Sri Lanka differently, without understanding: Gotabaya
content: In his first interview since 2010, former defence secretary of Sri Lanka Gotabaya Rajapaksa spoke about the geopolitical situation in the region, the changing character of Indian diplomacy, the meaning of peace, and his own role in the war.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa: People want to see us back in power
content: NEW DELHI, March 24: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that Sri Lankans want to see him back in power.

title: PM 69 today
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe celebrates his 69th birthday today (24). A series of events to mark the Prime Minister’s birthday will be held at Buddhist Temples and other religious places of worship around the country.

title: President as Chief Guest at the Pakistan Republic Day celebrations
content: The Pakistan Republic Day celebrations were held in Islamabad, yesterday (23) on a grand scale with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena attending the celebrations as the Chief Guest.

title: Former principal sentenced to five years for bribery
content: A former principal of a school in Matale district was sentenced to five years rigorous imprisonment by the Colombo High Court yesterday.

title: Diesel and Petrol Prices Up
content: Lanka IOC has increased the prices of diesel and petrol.

title: Sunil asks Navin to reveal bitter truth about ‘sweet tea’
content: JVP MP and Chairman of Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) Sunil Handunnetti has called on Plantations Minister Naveen Dissanayake to name the 53 factories responsible for mixing glucose and sugar with tea leaves.

title: Two dead as suspected IS gunman takes hostages in France
content: At least two people were killed after a gunman claiming allegiance to the Islamic State group opened fire and took hostages at a supermarket in southwest France on Friday.

title: Lankan nabbed with Rs.13 million worth yellow gold jewellery
content: A-32-year old Sri Lankan was arrested this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with yellow gold jewellery weighing two kilogram worth Rs.13 million, Deputy Customs Director and Customs Spokesman Vipula Minuwanpitiya said.

title: President orders HALT TO ALL CONSTRUCTION AT MUTHURAJAWELA
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday directed relevant sections to put an immediate halt to ongoing construction work, land reclamation and other activities carried out in the Muthurajawela Sanctuary area which are causing destruction to the environment.

title: COPA should question Dr. Fernando – JVP
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) yesterday (22) suggested that Parliament should summon the Chairman of the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) Dr. Neville Fernando before the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) over the paid newspaper advertisement to sell the Neville Fernando Teaching Hospital (NFTH), which was taken over by the Government last year.

title: Sri Lankan ex-leader’s MP son says not allowed to enter U.S.
content: Sri Lanka’s opposition legislator Namal Rajapaksa, the eldest son of Sri Lanka’s former leader Mahinda Rajapaksa, on Thursday said he was not allowed to enter the United States despite having a valid visa.

title: Regret slow progress in transitional justice mechanisms in Sri Lanka
content: The Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) yesterday told the UNHRC that it much regrets to learn of the slow progress in establishing transitional justice mechanisms in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka launches global marketing for Ceylon Tea
content: The Sri Lankan Tea Board launched on Wednesday a global marketing campaign for Ceylon Tea, a minister here said on Wednesday.

title: Sri Lankan rupee rises slightly on remittances, exporter dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee rose slightly on Wednesday as exporters sold dollars and remittances boosted inflows, while the gains were capped by importer demand for the U.S. currency in late trade, dealers said.

title: No-confidence motion against PM handed over to Speaker
content: The Joint Opposition (JO) handed over the no confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to the Speaker a short while ago.

title: No-confidence motion against PM to Speaker today: Gammanpila
content: The no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will be handed over to Speaker Karu Jayasuriya today evening (21), said MP Udaya Gammanpila.

title: IAEA to assist Sri Lanka in nuclear energy
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) says it will continue to support Sri Lanka in many areas including nuclear medicine, non-destructive testing in industry and assistance in introducing nuclear energy.

title: Financial inclusion- key constraint to economic growth: IFC
content: Even though Sri Lanka presents a rosy picture in terms of the wide range of financial service providers in the country, high levels of physical access to branches and a high number of accounts, the level of financial inclusion is still listed as a key constraint for growth across many sectors

title: 2017 sinks to slowest economic growth in 16 years
content: The country’s economy in 2017 had grown by only 3.1%, the slowest rate in 16 years and lower than the 4.4% achieved in 2016, as per data released yesterday by the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: Little action by Sri Lanka on promised justice, reforms: HRW
content: The Sri Lankan government should announce a time-bound plan to carry out its pledges to the United Nations Human Rights Council since October 2015, Human Rights Watch said today.

title: UNHRC adopts Sri Lanka’s UPR report
content: The Universal Periodic Review (UPR) Report on Sri Lanka was adopted today at the 37th session of the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in Geneva, the Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka in Geneva said. Sri Lanka was represented by Permanent Representative Ambassador Ravinatha Aryasinha and assisted by the Deputy Permanent Representative Mrs. Samantha Jayasuriya during the session.

title: People need to identify politicians who only think of power and not country – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says some are working according to their personal agendas to gain political power and they are not interested in strengthening the peace and reconciliation or in solving the issues of the country.

title: One dead following shooting in Athurugiriya
content: One person was killed following a shooting incident at Galwarusawa Road in Athurugiriya this evening, police said.

title: 42-year-old killed in shooting at Armour Street
content: A 42-year old man was killed and his wife was injured when two men arrived on a motorcycle opened fire at them at Messenger Street in Armour Street a short while ago.

title: Muslims never asked for a separate area for themselves says Minister
content: Although extremist groups are spreading hatred among Muslims in various countries in the World they will not be permitted to do so in this country said Minister Faiszer Musthapha Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government.

title: Electronic cards for Sri Lankans
content: All hospitals will be computerised by 2020 and an electronic card bearing all data will be issued to all Sri Lankans from April 7, Health Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: JVP won’t help oust RW
content: The JVP would not to sign the no-confidence motion to be moved by the Joint Opposition (JO) against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe…

title: Sri Lanka lifts state of emergency as ethnic tensions subside
content: Sri Lanka’s president announced he has lifted the nationwide state of emergency that was imposed after communal clashes resulted in the deaths of three people.

title: $100 million WB funds for RPCs soon
content: Sri Lanka moves closer in securing $100 million World Bank (WB) funding to restructure Sri Lanka’s Regional Plantation Companies (RPCs) which is facing a severe shortage of working capital and investments, announced Minister of Plantation Industries, Navin Dissanayake

title: BMW said to be driven by Minister’s son hits two cars before plunging into canal
content: A BMW reportedly driven by the son of a senior UNP party official and Cabinet Minister crashed into two cars before plunging into a canal connected to the Diyawanna Oya in Thalawathugoda near Parliament yesterday morning

title: Bangladesh get away with slap on the wrist
content: The shameful behaviour of Bangladesh players during the closely contested last group game of the Nidahas Trophy tournament match at RPS on Friday hasn’t been met with condemnation it deserved as both captain Shakib Al Hasan and reserve player Nurul Hasan have got away with a slap on the wrist having been handed 25 percent fines.

title: OPEN WARRANT FOR UDAYANGA
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate yesterday issued an open warrant written in English through the Interpol for the arrest of former Ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga, a first cousin of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: CRICKET: Bangladesh’s dressing room door damaged in Colombo
content: Aggressive bodily contact, shoving, agitated yelling, pointed fingers and a shattered dressing room door, all marred the finish and the immediate aftermath of the Nidahas Trophy match between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

title: Take advantage of our strategic location minister told at japanese investor forum
content: Japanese businesses must take advantage of Sri Lanka’s strategic location, preferential market access into key economies, and be an early mover in the country’s new growth drive, remarked Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade Malik Samarawickrama at an investor forum in Tokyo.

title: Sri Lankan PM calls for greater trade, economic co-operation with China
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Thursday called for greater economic and trade cooperation with China and hoped China’s assistance and aid would benefit more ordinary people in the island country.

title: Facebook blockage lifted with immediate effect
content: President Maithripala Sirisena instructed the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) to lift the blockage imposed on Facebook with immediate effect, a short while ago.

title: Facebook expresses concern over Sri Lanka ban
content: Facebook said Wednesday it was responding to Sri Lanka’s concerns over incendiary material shared on its platform and hoped internet restrictions imposed during anti-Muslim riots last week would be lifted soon.

title: President visits modern waste management centre in Tokyo
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, who is on a state visit to Japan, made an observation tour of modern waste management centre in Shinagawa in Tokyo, yesterday (14).

title: Japanese – Sri Lankan state leaders agree to strengthen bilateral ties
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe stated that he would work towards providing funds without loans anytime possible while giving assistance to the development progammes of Sri Lanka.

title: “I introduced internet to Sri Lanka” – PM
content: Prime Minster Ranil Wickramasinghe said he is responsible for introducing the internet to Sri Lanka for the very first time.

title: It was not a Sinhala-Muslim clash, it was a mob attack on Muslims: Sri Lanka Minister Rauff Hakeem
content: Xenophobic forces have mobilised themselves and seem to have identified a new enemy in post-war Sri Lanka, says the cabinet minister

title: MINISTER CALLS FOR NEW LAWS TO curb hate speech on SOCIAL MEDIA
content: Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) Leader, Megalopolis and Western Development Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka yesterday stressed the importance of controlling social media by implementing existing laws or enacting new laws.

title: Office on Missing Persons becomes operational
content: Sri Lanka has operationalised the Office on Missing Persons, an special office set up for determining the status of all persons who went “missing” during the war against the LTTE.

title: Sri Lanka President Sirisena meets Japanese Emperor Akihito
content: Sri Lanka President Maithripala Sirisena, who is on a state visit to Japan to further strengthening the long standing bilateral relations between the two countries, met with Emperor Akihito today (13).

title: Social media back by Friday, FB team here on Thursday: Harin
content: Social media platforms, including the Facebook, which were blocked last week, would be accessible by Friday morning, Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure Minister Harin Fernando said today.

title: Sri Lankan maid shot dead in Saudi, killer commits suicide
content: JEDDAH – A Sri Lankan woman was killed by gunfire in Saudi Arabia Saturday morning. A Saudi man who was accused of opening fire on the woman later committed suicide by shooting himself.

title: Voices grow against social media ban
content: The State-imposed thorny ban on social media looks set to drag on till at least Thursday (15 March), after a high-level meeting yesterday failed to agree on a timeline for restrictions, despite numerous pleas from the private sector, rights activists and top diplomats.

title: Bangladeshi plane crashes in Nepal, killing at least 50
content: KATHMANDU – A Bangladeshi airliner crashed on Monday after making an unexpected turn in cloudy weather as it came in to land at the airport in Nepal’s capital, killing at least 50 people, officials said.

title: President meets with Indian Prime Minister & Executive Director of UN Environment Programme
content: President Maithripala Sirisena after attending the Founding Conference of the International Solar Alliance (ISA) in New Delhi met with the Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the Rashtrapati Bhavan.

title: UN condemns anti-Muslim attacks in Sri Lanka
content: The UN’s political chief on Sunday condemned anti-Muslim violence that has targeted mosques and businesses in Sri Lanka as he wrapped up a three-day visit to the island-nation.

title: Sri Lanka’s Chandimal receives two-match suspension for slow over-rate
content: Sri Lanka captain Dinesh Chandimal will miss the team’s next two Twenty20 internationals after being found guilty of a serious over-rate offence during Saturday’s victory over Bangladesh, the International Cricket Council (ICC) said on Sunday.

title: Police investigate fresh anti-Muslim attack in Sri Lanka
content: Vandals attacked a Muslim-owned restaurant in Sri Lanka on Sunday in an alleged “hate crime”, police said, as tensions remain high across the island following a week of violent riots.

title: President Maithripala Sirisena was able to deliver long term benefits to Sri Lanka while establishing peace & reconciliation
content: The Indian President Ram Nath Kovind says the current President Maithripala Sirisena has been able to deliver long term benefits to Sri Lanka while establishing peace and reconciliation in the country.

title: Five killed in Nilaveli boat accident
content: Five persons were killed after a boat in which they were picking flowers capsized on Periyakulam tank in Nilaveli.

title: Anti-Muslim Riots a heavy blow to tourism, economy: Ranil
content: The latest wave of anti-Muslim riots that triggered curfews and a nation-wide state of emergency has damaged Sri Lanka’s international image and was a major blow to the economy, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Government mulling legislation for social media: Madduma Bandara
content: In the aftermath of communal clashes, the government is hoping to introduce fresh legislation to ensure a code of conduct for the operation of social media websites in line with international best practices, Law and Order Minister Ranjith Madduma Bandara said yesterday.

title: JVP asks Muslim leaders to decry extremism in their community
content: JVP yesterday (09) in parliament called on Muslim leaders to raise their voices against extremists in the their community.

title: Sri Lanka tourist arrivals record growth in Feb. on strong rise from China
content: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka exceeded 200,000 in February, a 19.3 percent growth compared to the same period last year, mainly due to a strong rise from China, statistics from the Sri Lanka Tourism Ministry showed here Friday.

title: Curfew in Kandy administrative district during the night
content: A curfew will be imposed in the Kandy administrative district, excluding the Kandy Municipal Council area, from 8.00pm today until 5.00am tomorrow (10), the Police Spokesman said.

title: Army Troops will Ensure Safety to all Communities, Assures Army Commander
content: As normalcy was returning fast, Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake, Commander of the Army went to trouble-torn Kandy yesterday morning (8) and took stock of developments taking place in the aftermath of violence that sparked off in the general areas of Digana, Galaha, Katugastota, Menikhinna, Ambetenna, Akurana, Poojapitiya and a few other affected areas.

title: Compensation for victims soon – Prime Minister
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday said action will be taken to pay compensation to the victims affected by the unrest in several areas in the Kandy district.

title: Sri Lanka’s embattled private teaching hospital up for sale
content: Sri Lanka’s Neville Fernando Teaching Hospital belonging to the country’s only private medical school is up for sale valued at 3.55 billion rupees.

title: One dead, two injured in shooting at Kotahena
content: One person died while another two were wounded following a shooting incident at Kotahena in Colombo.

title: Main suspect in Kandy incident arrested
content: The main suspect accused of instigating the incidents in Kandy has been arrested this morning along with 9 other suspects.

title: The statement released by the Speaker Karu Jayasuriya on Kandy incident
content: The statement released by the speaker of Sri Lanka, Karu Jayasuriya on Kandy incident.

title: Canada deeply concerned by violence in Sri Lanka
content: The Canadian government said it was deeply concerned by the recent inter-communal violence in Sri Lanka and urged all sides to engage in inclusive dialogue and exercise restraint to ensure peace and stability.

title: Police curfew lifted in Kandy
content: In accordance with the people’s request to remove the curfew for a short period to attend their essential activities including purchasing of food and other items, President Maithripala Sirisena has decided to remove the curfew from 10 a.m. and re-impose at 6 p.m. in the Kandy District, the Department of Government Information announced today.

title: Ranjit Madduma Bandara sworn in as Law & Order Minister
content: Minister Ranjith Madduma Bandara was sworn in as the Minister of Law and Order before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat a short while ago.

title: President visits Kandy to discuss current situation
content: President Maithripala Sirisena held a special meeting at President’s House in Kandy to discuss the current situation in the Kandy district.

title: Stern action against saboteurs – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe delivering a special statement on the situation in Kandy yesterday said the Security Forces Chiefs and the Police have been instructed to take prompt action against acts of sabotage and be prepared to control any kind of unrest.

title: MR urges people to be wary of sinister plans to divide country
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday warned that some sinister forces, bent on destabilising the country, were trying to engineer another 1983 style conflagration to drum up international support for their constitutional reforms, aimed at dividing the country into several semi-independent states.

title: Facebook, Viber, WhatsApp and social media blocked – TRC
content: Facebook, Viber, WhatsApp and all other social media networks have been temporary blocked in the country considering the current situation, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) said.

title: TRC instructs to slow internet speeds
content: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) of Sri Lanka has instructed internet service providers to restrain internet access in the Kandy District.

title: US calls for quick action against perpetrators, end to Emergency
content: The US Embassy in Colombo has called on the Government of Sri Lanka to act quickly against perpetrators of sectarian violence, protect religious minorities and their places of worship, and swiftly conclude the State of Emergency.

title: Teldeniya unrest BBS urges calm NBF calls for establishment of law and order
content: In the wake of the Teldeniya incident, the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) has requested the people to remain calm and stop the prevailing violence.

title: CID team sent to Digana
content: A team of investigators from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) was dispatched to Digana yesterday, to take stock of the prevailing situation and damage to property following Monday’s flare up that left one dead.

title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency after Buddhist-Muslim clash
content: Sri Lanka declared a nationwide state of emergency for 10 days on Tuesday to stop the spread of communal violence, a government spokesman said, after clashes erupted between majority Buddhists and members of the minority Muslim community.

title: Government to declare State of Emergency for 10 days
content: A decision was reached during the Cabinet Meeting held today to declare a State of Emergency in the country for a period of 10 days, Minister S.B. Dissanayake said.

title: Troops deployed to quell violence
content: Troops moved into Digana, Kandy yesterday afternoon when the police failed to bring a tense situation there under control. Police curfew was imposed in the Kandy administrative District until 6.00 am today.

title: President orders impartial probe into Digana incidents
content: President Maithripala Sirisena had directed the police and security sector to hold an unbiased, independent investigation into incidents at Digana Kandy today.

title: Kandy unrest: Curfew imposed until tomorrow
content: Police used teargas to disperse two groups of people who clashed in Digana over a death of a 41-year-old man.

title: Canada demands for foreign judges in Sri Lanka
content: Canada strongly demanded that Sri Lanka should fulfill its international commitments by ensuring the involvement of Commonwealth and international investigators and judges in the accountability process.

title: Peace and reconciliation high on Government’s agenda
content: In a hard hitting statement Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera yesterday said that the work of the Office of Missing Persons has been distorted and manipulated for political gain.

title: Chinese shops mushrooming – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has raised concerns about the mushrooming of Chinese shops throughout the country, at the recently held Cabinet meeting.

title: Gazette notification on banning the sale of cigarettes near schools to be issued soon
content: The gazette notification pertaining to the banning the sale of cigarettes within a radius of 100 metres from a school will be issued on April 07, Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: National Government has come to stay – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that Sri Lanka’s National Unity Government has come to stay and no future administration would scrap the concept.

title: Chief Incumbent of Sri Sambodhi Viharaya passes away
content: Chief incumbent of Sri Sambodhi Viharaya, Colombo and founder of “The Buddhist” channel Venerable Daranagama Kusaladhamma Thero passed away.

title: PM predicts bright future for Sri Lanka economically
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe speaking at the Investors Forum in Singapore assured the international investor community that Sri Lanka was committed to forging ahead with its reforms agenda.

title: Programme to renovate 2400 irrigation tanks commenced under President’s patronage in Polonnaruwa
content: The inauguration of the programme of renovating of 2400 irrigation tanks was commenced yesterday (March 02) under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena with the intention of recreating the ancient irrigation development in the country to emerge as a self-sufficient nation.

title: Japan to roll out the red carpet for Sri Lankan president
content: Japan is expected to reaffirm its commitment to bolstering bilateral ties with Sri Lanka during an official visit by the Indian Ocean nation’s leader this month in an effort to forestall Chinese encroachment in the region.

title: India was not interested in building ports or highways in Sri Lanka – MR
content: Former Sri Lanka President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that India was not interested in building ports and highway projects in his country when it was first offered.

title: OIC voices concern over attacks against Muslims in Sri Lanka
content: The Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) has expressed deep concern over the tense situation in Sri Lanka after a mosque, several hotels and vehicles owned by Muslims were vandalized by mobs in the town of Ampara, the Saudi Press Agency reported.

title: Contentious issue: National Payment Platform not discussed at Cabinet meeting
content: In spite of major discussion at the last meeting of cabinet of ministers whether to continue with the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management (CCEM), the controversial move made by the outfit to establish a hybrid company to facilitate ‘single button transactions’ in accordance with proposed National Payment Platform (NPP) hadn’t been taken up.

title: With pumps and canals, Sri Lanka’s capital moves to cut worsening flood risk
content: When heavy rain falls in the hills and plains west of Colombo – and in the city itself at the same time – Sri Lanka’s capital drowns.

title: Rajanganaya drinking water project suspended after uproar
content: A decision has been taken to temporarily suspend the Rajanganaya drinking water project, which had been the cause for yesterday’s tense situation in Thambuttegama.

title: Prime Minister leaves for Singapore
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe left for Singapore this afternoon with a delegation of six members to attend the ‘Invest Sri Lanka’ forum organized by the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE).

title: JVP ready to support no-faith motion against PM
content: JVP yesterday said that it was ready to support the proposed no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Arjuna Mahendran will be arrested – Rajitha
content: Former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran will be arrested for sure, said Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine Rajitha Senaratne

title: Tense situation at Thabuththegma
content: A tense situation was reported in Thabuththegma a short while ago following a protest carried out by a group of farmers.

title: Rajapaksa in Tirumala to worship at Lord Venkateswara shrine
content: Former Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday arrived in Tirupathi, Andhra Pradesh to worship at the famous hill shrine of Lord Venkateswara at nearby Tirumala.

title: ‘Reconciliation need of the hour’
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday stated that incidents such as the one in Ampara on Monday were detrimental to the reconciliation process of the country.

title: President disbands Prime Minister headed Economic Management Committee
content: President Maitripala Sirisena has ordered that the Committee on Economic Management, headed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe be disbanded and the functions of that Committee be vested in the Cabinet of Ministers

title: Tension in Ampara town
content: Four shops and a place of religious worship were damaged and three people injured in a clash between two groups in Ampara town…

title: Financial context demand strengthen macroeconomic policies and institutions says minister
content: Even countries with relatively low levels of absolute debt may face repayment challenges if there are weaknesses in its economic structures and debt management institutions.

title: Egyptian driver murders Sri Lankan maid after love affair
content: An Egyptian twenty-two-year old driver is being held in custody for four days over charges of killing a 54-year-old Sri Lankan maid who worked in Egypt after a love affair had transpired between them.

title: SF, Law and Order Minister in two weeks – Rajitha
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe took over the Ministry of Law and Order for a short period of two weeks only.

title: UNP MPs ready to bring no-confidence against Prime Minister – Range Bandara
content: UNP State Minister Range Bandara yesterday said a no-faith motion would be brought against the party leadership with the support of other UNP MPs, if the party leadership was not changed.

title: PM appoints committee to expedite action on corruption
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has appointed a three-member committee of ministers to examine ways of expediting cases on corruption and fraud, the PM’s Office said.

title: President signs condolence book on Ms. Una McCauley’s demise
content: President Maithripala Sirisena signed the special condolence book to mark the death of the UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative in Sri Lanka, Ms. Una McCauley at the United Nations Office in Sri Lanka.

title: Cabinet reshuffle will do no good – Ex–President Rajapaksa
content: A Cabinet reshuffle wouldn’t do any good to the country under an inefficient government, said former President Mahinda Rajapaksa responding to media in Kandy, yesterday (25).

title: Live Updates: Cabinet reshuffle
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has been sworn in as the new Cabinet Minister of Law and Order, during the Cabinet reshuffle currently underway at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Sridevi: Bollywood superstar dies at 54 of heart attack
content: Bollywood superstar Sridevi Kapoor has died of a heart attack, her family says. She was 54.

title: World Bank praises Sri Lankan Health service
content: The World Bank praises the public health service in Sri Lanka by saying that There are few if any other low or middle-income countries that have public health service like in Sri Lanka

title: PTL’s Arjun Aloysius, Kasun Palisena admitted to Prison Hospital
content: Perpetual Treasuries Limited’s Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena, who are under remand custody over the Central Bank bond scam, haVE been admitted to be the Prison Hospital.

title: CPC urges public to disregard malicious reports intended to sabotage national fuel supply
content: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) wishes to notify the general public that fabricated reports are currently being circulated on various communication platforms, of a possible fuel shortage in the country.

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends marginally firmer in dull trade
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended slightly firmer on Friday in dull trade as banks’ dollar selling on remittance inflows surpassed the importer greenback demand, dealers said.

title: Drug kingpin D. Manju shot dead
content: Drug kingpin Dadallage Manju alias D. Manju was killed during a shoot out with the Police Special Task Force (STF) personnel in Wattala a short while ago, the Police said.

title: INTERPOL has issued red warrant on Udayanga: Police
content: INTERPOL had issued a ‘Red Warrant’ on former Sri Lankan Envoy to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga, naming him as a fugitive wanted by the Sri Lankan authorities, Police Media Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekara announced.

title: National Economic Council tackles food prices, fertiliser and infrastructure issues
content: The National Economic Council (NEC), which met under the chairmanship of President Maithripala Sirisena this week, deliberated over multiple issues concerning the cost of living, fertilisers and infrastructure development and agreed to swiftly resolve these problems.

title: Sri Lanka to launch global marketing campaign for tourism promotion
content: Sri Lanka will launch a global marketing campaign starting from next month to attract more and more tourists to the country, an official here said on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka ranked 91 in Corruption Perceptions Index
content: Sri Lanka has failed to show significant improvement in the Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) 2017, released by Transparency International (TI), the global movement against corruption, the Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) said.

title: SAITM students to be transferred to KDU
content: The government has decided to transfer students of South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) to the medical faculty of Sir John Kotelawala Defense University (KDU) after determination their basic qualifications, Presidential Media Unit said yesterday (21st Feb.).

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer on bank dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended slightly firmer on Wednesday as exporter dollar sales outweighed importer demand for the greenback on hopes that political stability would resume after coalition partners agreed to continue with a cabinet reshuffle.

title: Police suspect grenade in passenger’s bag exploded
content: Initial police investigations into yesterday’s blast in a private bus proceeding from Jaffna to Diyatalawa have revealed that a grenade carried by one of the passengers exploded.

title: Cabinet reshuffle set to take place tomorrow – Amunugama
content: A Cabinet reshuffle is set to take place tomorrow (22) said Minister of Special Assignments Sarath Amunugama.

title: National Government is still valid – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, speaking in Parliament today (21), assured that the National Government is still valid and that the agreement between the UNP and the UPFA has not been rescinded.

title: 19 injured following fire in Diyatalawa bus
content: At least 19 persons have been hospitalised with injuries after a passenger transport bus caught fire in the early hours this morning at Kahagolla in Diyatalawa, the Police Spokesman said.

title: SLRC’s ‘Reconciliation Channel’ launched
content: The ‘Reconciliation Channel,’a new Tamil language channel under the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC) was launched yesterday, presided over by President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Tamil asylum seeker to be deported after UN committee withdraws torture concerns
content: A Tamil asylum seeker appears set for deportation to Sri Lanka after the UN committee against torture withdrew a request to Australia to halt his removal while it investigated the risk of him being tortured upon return.

title: President continues to keep PM without removing him: MR
content: Former President and MP Mahinda Rajapaksa today said it was none other than President Maithripala Sirisena who keeps Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his post without ousting him.

title: Gas cylinder prices to be increased?
content: Sri Lanka gas companies say that they expect to hold discussions with relevant authorities today (20) with regard to increasing the prices of LG gas cylinders.

title: Sri Lankan president’s party decides to stay in unity government
content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) led by President Maithripala Sirisena on Monday ended days of political uncertainty in the country, saying it would continue to be a part of the unity government to push for “major changes” within the government.

title: Sampanthan slams Rajapaksa for Tamil Eelam remarks
content: Leader of Opposition and senior Tamil politician R. Sampanthan on Monday said he was “alarmed” at former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s recent pre-poll campaign in which he told the Sinhalese electorate that “a Tamil Eelam would bloom following the local authority elections”.

title: Parliament to debate current political situation
content: Parliament will take up a special adjournment debate from 4 p.m. until 7 p.m. today on the prevailing political crisis.

title: Government and opposition MPs received cash from Mendis distilleries – Ranjan claims
content: Documents pertaining to payments made by Mendis Distilleries owned by Arjun Aloysious to a set of MPs from government and opposition has been recovered and are being held by President Maithripala Sirisena,Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka sweep series after dominating Bangladesh
content: Sri Lanka cruised to a 75-run victory over Bangladesh in Sylhet to wrap up a 2-0 triumph in the Twenty20 international series.

title: SLFP to quit govt; SC opinion sought on new PM
content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has decided to leave the National Government, party spokesman MP Thilanga Sumathipala said.

title: Government brought in 19A to block Rajapaksas We also can change 19A – Basil
content: Chief organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Basil Rajapaksa said that the 19A that was brought in by the incumbent Government should be ‘re-amended’ as it was enacted to prevent the Rajapaksas from returning to power.

title: We need urgent political reforms: JHU
content: While highlighting the need to introduce political reforms, Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) General Secreatry and Minister, Patali Champika Ranawaka said yesterday the government should be humble enough to accept the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) as the main opposition in Parliament.

title: 109 Indian fishermen released
content: The Sri Lankan government on Friday released 109 of the 136 Indian fishermen who were arrested on charges of poaching in the country’s territorial waters. The released fishermen are likely to be repatriated in the coming days.

title: Sri Lanka PM plans reshuffle in wake of local election drubbing
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Friday he planned to stay in office and reshuffle his cabinet in the wake of a stinging loss in local elections for both parties in the ruling coalition.

title: JO ready to support UPFA Government
content: Joint Opposition (JO) leaders said after meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena they will support a United Peoples’ Freedom Alliance (UPFA) government.

title: New process to serve the people by mobilizing all SLFP candidates – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says programmes will be implemented in the future to serve the people, together with all the people’s representatives who contested for the Local Government election under the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) led United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA).

title: UPFA will not support unity govt – Susil Premajayantha
content: Minister of Science, Technology and Research Susil Premajayantha stated that the majority of the UPFA will not support the continuation of the current unity government.

title: President has no power to dismiss PM – Vajira
content: The President does not have the power to dismiss a Prime Minister according to the 19th Amendment to the Constitution, Home Affairs Minister Vajira Abeywardene said yesterday.

title: President, PM urged to appoint SF Law & Order Minister
content: Civil Society grouping Purawesi Balaya yesterday called for far reaching Cabinet reshuffle, including the immediate appointment of war winning Army Chief Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka as Law and Order Minister

title: UNP to continue with unity govt and carry out party reforms – Kabir
content: Following a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, the UNP parliamentary group has decided to continue with the unity government and carry out party reforms, UNP General Secretary Kabir Hashim said.

title: President to make special statement tomorrow
content: President Maithripala Sirisena is expected to make a special statement on the future course of National Unity Government tomorrow.

title: Four killed, two injured in building collapse
content: At least four persons were killed while another two were wounded after a building collapsed in Grandpass.

title: Some SLFP Ministers to join UNP
content: Some Ministers belonging to the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) are planning to team up with the United National Party(UNP) to form the new coalition government, while others are trying to align with the opposition.

title: Crunch talks to check coalition crack
content: Efforts to break a deadlock on the political future of Sri Lanka’s ruling coalition continued yesterday, with a second round of late night talks for all UNP Cabinet ministers at President Maithripala Sirisena’s official residence at Paget Road last night.

title: President asks PM to step down
content: President Maithripala Sirisena requested United National Party (UNP) leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, on Monday (12), to resign as Prime Minister and appoint another person for the post, according to highly placed sources.

title: China Wants To Turn The Indian Ocean Into The China Ocean
content: China wants to turn the vast Indian Ocean into the China Ocean. When it comes to investment and commerce that is.

title: How a Sri Lankan hero became a taxi driver in UAE
content: When Suresh Pattali of the Khaleej Times flagged down a cab in the mad morning rush to keep a medical appointment, little did he know it would be a journey into the plebeian life of a forgotten national hero.

title: Backbenchers urge PM to form UNP government
content: The United National Party (UNP) backbenchers, who met with party leader Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today, had urged the Premier to form an independent UNP government.

title: Australia issues deportation order for Lankan asylum seeker despite UN request
content: A Sri Lankan asylum seeker has been ordered for deportation next week, despite the United Nations committee against torture requesting Australia not move him while it investigates whether he will be tortured if he is returned against his will.

title: Gota returns to Sri Lanka Says not eligible to be PM
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa yesterday (12) said he is not eligible to be the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka because he is a US citizen.

title: President, PM not taken any decision on future political course
content: Presidential Media Division sources yesterday said that President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe have neither taken any decision nor reached any agreement over governing the Local Government institutions or future political activities of the government.

title: Sri Lanka’s ex-leader seeks fresh elections after council vote boost
content: Former Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa called on Monday for parliament to be dissolved and fresh elections to be held after a party backed by him won local council polls in the strongest rebuff yet to the unity government.

title: Gota returns today
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa who was away in America is expected to return to Sri Lanka today (12).

title: SLPP cruises to resounding win
content: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) cruised to a resounding victory at Saturday’s local government elections (LG) by winning 2,901 seats and bagging 222 local government bodies out of 304

title: Celebrate triumph at LG polls peacefully – Former President
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that he acknowledges everyone who pledged their support at the 2018 Local Government election.

title: Local Authorities Elections Results – 2018
content: Official election results of Local Authorities Election – 2018 Sri Lanka

title: President and Prime Minister voted today
content: President Maithreepala Sirisena casts his vote in this morning, at the local government election in the poling center at sri vidhyaloka vihara new town,Polonnaruwa.

title: Udayanga released as per UAE law and ‘Blue Notice’ rules Foreign Ministry confirms ex-envoy’s release
content: The speculations surrounding the release of former Ambassador to Russia and Ukraine, Udayanga Weeratunga, by a Dubai Court was confirmed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) yesterday (9).

title: ALL SET FOR LG POLLS TODAY
content: Everything is in place to conduct the much awaited ‘Local Government Elections 2018’ today.

title: Investigation center for election complaints
content: A National Inquiry Center to investigate complaints on election irregularities will function on the day of election, 10th February, the Chairman of the Commission, Mahinda Deshapriya said.

title: EU adds Sri Lanka to money laundering blacklist
content: The European Parliament has confirmed that Sri Lanka, Tunisia and Trinidad and Tobago were on the European Commission’s blacklist of countries at risk for acts of money-laundering.

title: Letter bearing Mangala’s forged signature
content: Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera has instructed the CID to initiate an investigation into a fake letter that is currently circulating on social media, under his name.

title: Mulling retirement,Says Lasith Malinga
content: Sri Lanka speedster Lasith Malinga has hinted at possible retirement, saying that he is mentally done with international cricket now that his eventful IPL career is over.

title: New speed-detecting systems on expressways from Feb. 14
content: A new speed-detecting system will be setup on Expressways from February 14, so that speeding drivers could be fined at the exit points, Expressway Operation Maintenance and Management Division said.

title: AG’s team working on legal procedure
content: Two senior lawyers have been appointed to work on the legal procedure for the extradition of Udayanga Weeratunga now held in Dubai to Sri Lanka, Attorney General Jayantha Jayasuriya said.

title: Win at LG Polls a stepping stone: JVP
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said yesterday even though they would not be able to restore the economy that has collapsed just by winning the Local Government elections, they were using it as a stepping stone to gaining power in 2020.

title: President revokes suspension of Brigadier Priyanka Fernando
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has revoked the suspension of Brigadier Priyanka Fernando from duties as the Minister Counsellor (Defence) attached to the Sri Lanka High Commission in London, Army Commander Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake said.

title: Sri Lankan military official suspended over ‘offensive’ behavior in London
content: Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs says the Minister Counsellor (Defence) attached to the Sri Lanka High Commission in London has been suspended with immediate effect and that inquiries will be initiated into the alleged incident involving him.

title: Bond racketeers won’t be protected – Hashim
content: UNP General Secretary and Minister Kabir Hashim yesterday promised punitive action against all those inolved in the bond scams.

title: License of Aloysius owned Mendis brewery cancelled
content: The licence of arrack distillery W.M. Mendis & Co. Ltd has been cancelled by the Excise Department for non-payment of taxes, the Excise Department confirmed.

title: Lanka performing well at primary education level- IPS survey
content: Sri Lanka has been performing well at the primary education level and significant policy gaps exist when it comes to secondary and tertiary education, an IPS survey revealed recently.

title: Sri Lanka court orders two bond dealers remain in custody over alleged scam
content: A Sri Lankan court on Monday ordered two executives from dealer Perpetual Treasuries Ltd, arrested over an alleged government bond scam, to remain in custody until Feb. 16.

title: EPF, NSB, SLIC losses due to bond scams exceed Rs. 31 billion
content: The manipulation of the secondary bond market by Perpetual Treasuries caused three state institutions, Employees’ provident Fund (EPF,) Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation (SLIC) and National Savings Bank (NSB), to lose over Rs. 31 billion, anti corruption activists said yesterday.

title: Wary India looks on as Chinese president talks of strategic cooperation with Sri Lanka
content: China is willing to work with Sri Lanka for better development of bilateral “strategic cooperative partnership”, President Xi Jinping said on Sunday, in statement that’s expected to be closely tracked by India as Beijing and Colombo deepen ties.

title: Sri Lanka eyeing longer talks with China on free trade agreement
content: Sri Lanka wants a longer-time period to negotiate a free trade agreement with China as it is concerned about the economic impact of a rushed deal on their small country, the Sri Lankan ambassador said on Sunday.

title: Udayanga Weeratunga arrested by INTERPOL
content: Former Ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga has been arrested by INTERPOL at Dubai Airport a short while ago.

title: Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena Arrested
content: Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena have been arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department.

title: With Sri Lankan port acquisition, China adds another ‘pearl’ to its ‘string’
content: When Sri Lanka’s government first looked to develop a port on its southern coast that faced the Indian Ocean, it went not to China, but to its neighbor, India.

title: Independence Day Message: Nation pays tribute to its true patriots – President
content: If one is to truly fathom the value of independence, it is essential to understand the pain being oppressed and subservient in the face of a foreign power. This is why we are grateful to all our heroes who sacrificed their lives in order to restore and sustain our nation’s independence.

title: Bellanwila Wimalarathana Thero passes away
content: Professor Venerable Dr Bellanwila Wimalaratana Nayake Thero, Chancellor of the Sri Jayawardanepura University passed awaya short while ago (3), at a Private Hospital in Colombo

title: Queen Elizabeth congratulates Sri Lanka on 70th Independence anniversary
content: Britain’s Queen Elizabeth on Friday congratulated Sri Lanka’s President Maithripala Sirisena on the occasion of the island country’s 70th National Independence Day.

title: AG confirms President’s trillion rupee loan claim
content: Close on the heels of President Maithripala Sirisena’s controversial claim that foreign loans amounting to Rs. 9 trillion that had been procured during the Rajapaksa administration (2006-2014) couldn’t be accounted for, a comprehensive study undertaken by the Auditor General’s Department has confirmed the staggering figure.

title: Southeast Asia’s top drugmaker eyes Sri Lanka
content: PT Kalbe Farma, whose antacid drug Promag is a household name in Indonesia, is seeking a partner in Sri Lanka and eyeing the Middle East as a new market for its nutritional products.

title: Stripping Mahinda of his civic rights not enough – Sarath Fonseka
content: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka says that stepping former President Mahinda Rajapaksa of his civic rights alone is not enough.

title: SLFP will never allow stripping of MR’s civic rights: Dilan
content: State Minister Dilan Perera says that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) will never agree to the stripping of civic rights of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa or anyone else.

title: President emphasized that under any circumstances he would not divide the coutry and will not allow anyone to do so
content: President Maithripala Sirisena emphasized that even though allegations leveled against him that he is attempting to divide the country, under any circumstances  he would not allow anyone to divide the country.

title: Sri Lanka’s apparel exports grow 3.06 pct in 2017
content: Sri Lanka’s apparel exports grew by 3.06 percent last year compared with that of 2016, the Industry and Commerce Ministry said on Thursday.

title: Indian Defence Minister wary of China’s Sri Lanka plans
content: Hinting at security concerns over Sri Lanka handing over its strategic southern port of Hambantota to China, India’s Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has raised doubts whether that country would confine itself only to port activities.

title: Rajitha announces arrest of GR soon after Feb. 10 polls
content: Health Minister and Cabinet spokesman Dr. Rajitha Senaratne alleges that Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) candidate for the next presidential election, former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa has fled the country fearing arrest in the wake of ongoing judicial investigations into acquisition of MiGs from Ukraine under controversial circumstances.

title: Ravi asked to refrain from exercising duties as UNP deputy leader
content: The committee headed by Minister Tilak Marapana made a recommendation today (31), that former Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake should not exercise his duties as the Deputy leader of the UNP until further notice.

title: PRECIFAC findings have silenced many politicians – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says some politicians who made a big noise, demanding an early parliamentary debate on the Commission of Inquiry Report into Treasury Bond Issues in 2015 and 2016, have become silent, after the Commission of Inquiry into Serious Acts of Fraud Corruption and Abuse of Power (PRECIFAC), released its findings recently.

title: Special meeting of party leaders to discuss future actions on CB Bond Commission Report
content: President Maithripala Sirisena held a special meeting with the party leaders at the Presidential Secretariat today (29) to discuss future steps on the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry into the Bond Issuance of the Central Bank.

title: U.S. lifts ban on refugees from ‘high-risk’ nations
content: The Trump administration said Monday that it will resume accepting refugees from 11 nations whose applicants it designated “high-risk” and will implement tougher screening procedures to weed out potential extremists and criminals.

title: Sri Lanka is all talk and no action on repealing PTA – HRW
content: The Sri Lankan government has failed to fulfill its pledge to abolish the abusive Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), Human Rights Watch said in a report released today.

title: Sri Lankan rupee closes marginally weaker as banks, importers buy dollars
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended slightly weaker on Monday in dull trade as banks and importers bought dollars, dealers said.

title: Fifty percent subsidy given to farmers on seed potatoes would be increased to 100 percent- President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says steps will be taken to increase the fifty percent subsidy given to farmers on seed potatoes up to 100 percent.

title: President reminds people of ‘dark era’ under MR
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday questioned the nation on whether they wished to go back to the dark era by voting in favour of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Pohottuwa of Prof.G.L. Peiris.

title: MR rejects President’s offer
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday said that his successor President Maithripala Sirisena’s proposal for combining the SLPP and SLFP to form a government was only a trick.

title: In order to prosecute wrongdoers AG directs CID to probe Bond report
content: The Criminal Investigation Department has been instructed, by Attorney General Jayantha Jayasuriya, to conduct the necessary investigations into issues arising out of the Bond Commission Investigation report, to enable him to prosecute the wrongdoers.

title: Sri Lankan leader says $58 billion foreign debt under previous govt unaccounted for
content: Sri Lanka’s president said on Friday that more than $58 billion, or 90 percent, of foreign loans borrowed by the previous government was unaccounted for in Finance Ministry records.

title: “CMC has to be the best in the country” – President
content: The Colombo Municipal Council has to become one of the best in the country, says President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Be long-sighted and clear-headed at LG poll: Mangala
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera yesterday said he believed that it is important to be long-sighted and clear-headed about the monumental choice facing all Sri Lankans at the upcoming Local Government (LG) election.

title: Sri Lankan man arrested without valid travel documents
content: A 32-year-old Sri Lankan national, who arrived in Ramewaram by a boat was arrested for travelling without valid travel documents, Tamil Nadu police said.

title: Sri Lanka tea exports to China witnesses boom
content: Sri Lanka’s tea exports to China surged 30 percent to 9.9 million kilograms in 2017 from the year before, making China the eighth biggest market for Ceylon tea, local media quoting the Sri Lanka Tea Board said on Thursday.

title: Ranil trying to follow Mahathir Mohamad
content: The present regime, in its present form was able to start up the economy which was at a standstill and will end up stabilizing it by showing budget surpluses by 2020, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said recently.

title: Rs. 202 Million PET scanner arrives
content: The PET Scanner to be installed at the Maharagama Apeksha Hospital has arrived in Sri Lanka.

title: JVP, JO want President’s Secy questioned over thousands of pages missing from bond report
content: The JVP and Joint opposition MPs demanded from Speaker Karu Jayasuriya yesterday to summon Secretary to the President to parliament and question him for misleading parliament by providing it with an incomplete copy of the report of the bond commission.

title: World Cup arrives in Sri Lanka to kick off global tour
content: The World Cup trophy has arrived in Sri Lanka for the first time as the most coveted prize in global soccer started a 54-country tour ahead of the 2018 tournament in Russia.

title: Wigneswaran turns down Bathiudeen’s request
content: Northern Province Chief Minister C.V.Wigneswaran has turned down the request made by Minister Rishad Bathiudeen asking for 1000 acres of land for the rehabilitation of Muslims in Mullaitivu district.

title: Indonesian President Joko Widodo arrives in Sri Lanka
content: Indonesian President Joko Widodo arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago, with a delegation of 50 members, on a two-day official visit.

title: Light railway to take off this year
content: Physical work of the proposed light railway project from Kaduwela to Colombo Fort would commence this year said Minister of Megalopolis and Western Development Champika Ranwaka.

title: Singapore PM ‘very glad’ negotiations for FTA with Sri Lanka went smoothly
content: While Sri Lanka is in the process of negotiating free trade agreements (FTA) with several partners, Singapore is the first to complete one with them, and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said he is “very glad” that negotiations went smoothly.

title: Speaker says nothing missing from Bond Commission report
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya announced yesterday that he had been informed by the Secretary to the President that Parliament had been given copies of the complete report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry, which had investigated the bond scams.

title: Uva Chief Minister surrenders to police
content: Uva Province Chief Minister Chamara Sampath Dassanayake surrendered to the Badulla Police this morning in connection with a incident in which he was accused of forcing a lady Principal kneel in front of him.

title: Singapore firms bullish about Sri Lanka amid news of FTA
content: Singapore businesses said they are bullish about the Sri Lanka market, and expect to benefit considerably from a free trade agreement (FTA) that both countries will sign today.

title: Sri Lanka rupee slips on importer dollar demand
content: The Sri Lankan rupee closed slightly weaker on Monday as dollar demand from importers and banks surpassed mild selling of the U.S. currency by exporters, dealers said.

title: All Opposition parties, sans JO, now in ‘Yahapalana’ Govt., says MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday claimed that while there was a yahapalana government in power there was a yahapalana opposition as well.

title: President orders immediate probe
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has directed IGP Pujith Jayasundera to conduct an immediate investigation into complaints of alleged harassment caused by Uva Chief Minister Chamara Sampath Dassanayake to a female school principal in Badulla recently.

title: Kataragama shooting incident :58 protesters arrested
content: 58 persons including 13 women have been arrested as police fired tear gas to disperse violent protesters in Kataragama.

title: Udayanga says he acquired assets legitimately with funds earned overseas
content: Sri Lanka’s former Ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga, says the Yahapalanaya government is trying to foist allegations of “acquiring properties illegally” against him as a ploy to eclipse the truth at a time an election is around the corner.

title: Gone like a shot: Why did Sri Lanka reinstate alcohol ban for women?
content: Even in ultra-conservative Saudi Arabia, women will finally get the right to drive cars this year. Compare that to Sri Lanka, where women recently won the right to buy a drink at a bar – or rather had won it, until it was revoked just days later.

title: Sri Lanka to settle $42 million oil dues to Iran by February
content: Sri Lanka is going to pay $42 million of its oil dues to Iran this February, Sri Lankan Daily Mirror reported citing the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

title: New Coach Cannot Perform Miracles, Says Sri Lanka’s Thisara Perera
content: After a humiliating 163 run loss to Bangladesh on Friday, Sri Lanka are on the verge of exiting from the tri-nation series which has Zimbabwe as the third team.

title: Maximum period for court cases will be limited to three years – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that the current legal system within Sri Lanka is undergoing radical change to enable the justice system to become more efficient and prevent the delay of justice.

title: Importing vehicles without seat belts, airbags banned from July
content: The government’s decision to ban the import of vehicles which are not equipped with air bags and seat belts and below the emission levels or its equivalent as prescribed by Euro IV, has been postponed to July 1, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: National action plan for elimination of bribery and corruption
content: An intellectual gathering to discuss setting up of an action plan for elimination of bribery and corruption, chaired by Secretary to the President, Austin Fernando was held at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (January 18).

title: CaFFE writes to Speaker asking for missing parts of bond commission report
content: Annexure three of the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry on Treasury Bonds has neither been given to the MPs nor released to the public via the Presidential secretariat website

title: CEB workers calls off strike
content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) workers called off the strike which was launched yesterday against assaulting some CEB workers

title: Lanka will enjoy economic progress in the near future – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that the government has adopted a strong and adaptable fiscal policy to ensure that the country enjoys a vast level of economic progress in the near future.

title: President orders AG and other officials Act Now on Bond Commission Report Prime Minister’s ‘Value Judgment’ questioned
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday directed the Attorney General, Jayantha Jayasuriya, the Governor of the Central Bank, Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy and DG Bribery Commission Sarath Jayamanne and other officials to immediately act on the recommendations of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry into the alleged Bonds scam.

title: President was hurt by certain remarks – Rajitha
content: Co-cabinet spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senaratne yesterday clarified that the President had merely voiced his displeasure against certain remarks made against him by some members of the UNP.

title: Bond and PRECIFAC reports handed over to Speaker’s office
content: The Bond Commission report and PRECIFAC reports were handed over to the Speaker’s Office this morning.

title: Angry President says Enough is enough
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (16), walked out of the Cabinet meeting after making an emotional speech, in which he criticized United National Party (UNP) members who were attacking him on the campaign trail…

title: Yes there was a bond scam: Ranjan
content: Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake admitted to there having been a Central Bank bond scam, and said President Maithripala Sirisena’s decision to investigate such scams was an election promise and therefore should be supported by the people.

title: Sri Lanka, China think tanks co-launch book on Sino-Lanka relations
content: Sri Lankan and Chinese think tanks on Tuesday jointly launched a book on the Sino-Lanka relations titled “The Island of the Lion and the Land of the Dragon” in order to strengthen the bilateral relations between the two countries.

title: Gotabaya is JO’s candidate for Presidential Polls – Roshan
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa will be the Joint Opposition’s candidate for the next Presidential Election, says MP Roshan Ranasinghe.

title: Largest haul of seized cocaine destroyed
content: Enforcing the government’s commitment to create a drug free society, 928 kgs of seized cocaine valued at Rs. 16.7 billion was publicly destroyed for the first time in the country…

title: Length of President’s term only five years
content: The Supreme Court has informed President Maithripala Sirisena that his term of office is five years, the President’s Media Division says.

title: If there were Bonds frauds in MR’s time President, CBSL must reveal them – Bandula
content: Following the special statement made by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Member of Parliament Bandula Gunawardena insisted that the President Maithripala Sirisena and the Central Bank Governor reveal to the people whether the Treasury bond frauds actually took place between 2008 and 2014…

title: Government will seek assistance from IMF for Central Bank reform – Harsha
content: Deputy Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs Harsha De Silva stated that the government will seek assistance from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to reform the Central Bank in accordance with the recommendations made by the Bond Commission.

title: Tourism, industrial zones will help increase pci Growth Rate: PM
content: Several industrial and tourism zones being set up by the government will help increase the Per Capita Growth Rate and accelerate development, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Sri Lanka President Restores Ban On Women Buying Alcohol
content: Colombo:  Sri Lanka’s president on Sunday reimposed a four-decade-long ban on women buying liquor, just days after his finance minister had lifted the restriction.

title: Sri Lanka’s Northern Province CM calls for bigger role in India-assisted development projects
content: Sri Lanka’s Northern Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran has sought greater collaboration between the Government of India and the provincial administration in the Tamil-majority north in development projects.

title: Thai pongal day messages
content: Marking this year’s Thai Pongal festival as an occasion to make the efforts taken by the government to take the country towards self-sufficiency in food meaningful and providing strength to these efforts, President Maithripala Sirisena extended his greetings to all Hindus across the world celebrating the festival that expresses gratitude to nature.

title: Indo-Lanka accord is a sound framework, say experts
content: The Indo-Sri Lankan agreement drafted in 1987 is a sound framework that can be improved upon, say politicians and those who were involved closely with the political developments then.

title: IMF says economy normalising but reforms essential
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) envisages Sri Lanka’s economy normalising in 2018 with the real GDP growth projected to reach about 4.6% over the medium term; however, the global lender called on the Government to continue its reform process centered on fiscal consolidation to maintain stabilisation momentum.

title: Sri Lanka Central bank suspends four officers over alleged bond irregularities
content: Sri Lanka’s central bank said it has suspended four officers and taken disciplinary action against several others following alleged irregularities in a 2015 government bond auction.

title: Attorney General says: President’s term covers six years
content: The incumbent President who was elected on January 8, 2015 had assumed duties in the office of President on January 9, 2015 for a period of six years.

title: Traffic offenders to get fines by mail
content: According to a new system to monitor traffic offences, CCTV cameras in strategic places in Colombo would take pictures of offenders, and the picture along with the fine would be mailed to their homes, Law and Order and Southern Development Minister Sagala Ratnayaka said yesterday.

title: Ministry revokes the prohibition on selling liquor to women
content: Ministry Finance and Mass media yesterday revoked the prohibition on selling liquor to women and employing women in places where liquor is manufactured or sold.

title: 17-year-old detainee commits suicide at Pettah Police Station
content: A 17-year-old detainee has committed suicide at the Pettah Police Station by hanging himself inside a cell.

title: Sri Lankan rupee edges up on exporter dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee closed marginally firmer on Wednesday in dull trade, as dollar conversions by exporters surpassed mild demand for the U.S. currency from importers and banks, dealers said.

title: PIO MPs concerned over rising intolerance in India
content: At the first-ever conference of sitting Indian origin MPs representing 23 countries across the world, a disquiet on the rising incidences of intolerance and hostility towards religious minorities in their ancestral land was palpable.

title: Johor Ruler invests in Sri Lanka
content: PETALING JAYA: The Sultan of Johor, Sultan Ibrahim Ibni Almarhum Sultan Iskandar (pic), is making an investment into the US$100mil industrial zone for pharmaceutical manufacturers in Sri Lanka.

title: Young Chinese billionaire in Colombo
content: One of the youngest billionaires of China, Cai Xiaoru, arrived in Sri Lanka on Monday demonstrating renewed investor confidence on the nation.

title: Victor Ratnayaka’s wife arrested
content: Hashini Amendra, the wife of veteran singer Victor Ratnayake, was arrested by the Tangalle Police this morning for the alleged misappropriation of Rs. 1.28 million worth of jewelry belonging to a state bank.

title: Former Navy Spokesman granted bail
content: Former Spokesman of the Sri Lanka Navy, Commodore D.K.P. Dassanayake, and five others have been granted bail by the Colombo High Court.

title: Sri Lanka to raise $500 million via bonds, divesting state hotels amid debt
content: Sri Lanka aims to raise $500 million this month via development bonds and is in the process of divesting two state-owned hotels, the central bank and a ministry said on Monday, as the government faces unprecedented debt repayment this year.

title: President vests Moragahakanda Mega Irrigation Project with the nation
content: President Maithripala Sirisena vested the Moragahakanda Development Project with the nation, today (08).

title: Rajagiriya flyover declared open by President and PM
content: The Rajagiriya flyover which is being constructed providing long term solutions for the heavy traffic congestion in the Rajagiriya was declared open by President Maithripala Sirisena  and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe a short while ago.

title: RANIL WANTS PARLIAMENT TO DEBATE BOND REPORT
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday called for the summoning of Parliament two-weeks ahead of schedule to debate the Bond Commission report which has called for a forensic audit of the Central Bank.

title: Bond scam loss burden placed on public through higher taxes – Mahinda
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says the loss caused by treasury bond scam was much bigger than the amount stated in the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry into the bond scam.

title: India waiting to hear the ‘good news’ MRIA bid is still open for investors says Government
content: While India is ‘waiting’ to hear the final word on their bid proposal to uplift the defunct Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA), through a joint venture project, the Government says the bidding to run the MRIA on a lease agreement is still open for local and international investors.

title: Cricket World Cup for the Blind begins tomorrow
content: ISLAMABAD: The Pakistan leg of the Cricket World Cup for the Blind gets under way with the opening match between the hosts and Bangladesh at Lahore’s Gaddafi Stadium on Monday (tomorrow).

title: Bond scams: UNP leadership must take blame – DEW
content: General Secretary of the Communist Party D. E. W. Gunasekera yesterday said that the top UNP leadership couldn’t absolve itself of the responsibility for the bond scams.

title: PM orders swift action
