content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has directed Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy to discuss with the Monetary Board and take steps to implement the recommendations of the Bond Commission report as soon as it is released.

title: A Chinese flag flies over Sri Lanka as China extends its reach into India’s backyard
content: On the first day of the new year, the Chinese and Sri Lankan flags were hoisted to the same height over the Hambantota port in the Indian Ocean nation.

title: Japan will provide fullest support for development & reconciliation process of SL – Japan FM
content: The Foreign Minister of Japan Tharo Kono said that the Government of Japan is ready to provide its fullest support for the development and reconciliation process of Sri Lanka.

title: Cricket: Sri Lanka sacks ODI skipper Perera
content: Sri Lanka on Thursday ousted Thisara Perera as one-day captain and said it would announce a replacement next week.

title: I am at loss to understand how I became a suspect: Ravi Karunanayake
content: UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake, against whom the Bond Commission presses bribery charges, said he was at a loss to understand how he turned up as a suspect since the Central Bank and the State Banks did not remain under his purview.

title: PM’s Office says: Commitment to Yahapalanaya demonstrated by Bond probe
content: The manner in which the Bond issue was investigated and the commitment to identify those responsible demonstrated the democratic and law abiding nature of the Yahapalana National Government. We now hope that the Attorney General’s (AG) Department will do the same, said a statement released from the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: Postal workers to go on strike
content: The Joint Trade Unions of Postal Service Workers issued a statement that all Postal service employees will go on strike should the government fail to provide a satisfactory resolution to the problems within the Postal service.

title: Sri Lanka central bank sees recovery in 2018, cautious on easing
content: Sri Lanka’s economic growth in 2018 is forecast at between 5-5.5 percent, bouncing back from an anticipated four-year low of less than 4 percent last year, central bank Governor Indrajit Coomaraswamy said on Wednesday.

title: President wants Treasury Bond losses recovered
content: President Maithripala Sirisena issuing a special statement yesterday on the Treasury Bond Commission report reiterated his commitment to fully recover the loss to the government from the Treasury bond issue and bring the offenders to book.

title: Former Divulapitiya Acting OIC arrested
content: The former Acting Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Divulapitiya Police Station has been arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) in connection with the death of a suspect in custody on October 04, 2017.

title: We can’t despair, we can’t abandon things, says Sri Lanka’s R. Sampanthan
content: R. Sampanthan, leader of the Opposition in Sri Lanka’s Parliament, is also the country’s seniormost politician, having been in politics for more than six decades. In the January 2015 presidential poll, the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) he leads backed the President Maithripala Sirisena–Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe combine that ousted former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: China Harbour Engineering to invest $1 billion in Sri Lanka’s Port City: minister
content: A consortium led by state-run China Harbour Engineering Company Ltd will invest $1 billion to build three 60-storey office towers on reclaimed land of the Port City development in Sri Lanka’s capital, a government minister said on Tuesday.

title: Polythene ban comes into effect
content: The ban imposed on polythene and household electric appliances that contain Hydrochloro-flurocarbon or HCFC by the Central Environment Authority (CEA) in the September 2017 Gazette Notification came into effect yesterday (1st Jan.).

title: President to make special statement on Bond report
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will make a special statement to the media on Wednesday in connection with the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) report into the Bond Issuance of the Central Bank, the President’s Media Division said yesterday.

title: Bond scams fatal blow to UNP – Mahinda
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday said that the unmanageable rising cost of living and the bond scams would seriously affect the UNP’s campaign at the forthcoming local government elections.

title: Nearly 300,000 people remain affected by drought in Northern Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka’s Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said on Monday that as many as 293,764 people remained affected by the drought in five northern districts of the island country.

title: Fire at Meethotamulla garbage dump
content: A fire broke out at a section of the massive garbage pile at Meethotamulla this morning, the Police said.

title: President’s message for the New Year
content: Every passing moment adds to our knowledge and experience and at the same time, each and every moment of the future will judge our capabilities to face new emerging challenges.

title: Prime Minister’s message for the New Year
content: 2018 dawns on us as we recall the victory won in restoring political and social values, in realizing a dream long cherished by the people of this country.

title: Defaced currency notes: Deadline extended
content: The previously given deadline of today, December 31, for the public to exchange willfully defaced or altered currency has been extended by three months, Central Bank sources said.

title: Central Bank Bond Commission report handed over to President
content: The final report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) into the Bond Issuance of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has been handed over to President Maithripala Sirisena today.

title: India offers fully funded training to Sri Lankan Government
content: India has introduced over 40 training courses for Sri Lankan government officials to give them an understanding of India’s approach towards governance, the Indian High Commission said.

title: New Sri Lanka coach bans music at training
content: COLOMBO: New Sri Lanka cricket coach Chandika Hathurusingha pledged to get tough with the under-performing national team — including banning music in training — while demanding “full control” over selection.

title: United States GSP program expires on Dec 31
content: The United States’ Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) program expires on December 31, 2017. The United States Congress did not re-authorize GSP before adjourning for the year.

title: ‘Pledge for Freedom’ launching ceremony under President’s patronage
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said he will not consider political differences or relative relationships in his journey to build a clean and pure political culture for the future of the nation.

title: Over Rs. 130 Million worth heroin seized this year – Minister Sagala
content: The Special Task Force and the Police Narcotics and Organized Crimes Division has been able to seize heroin stocks valued over Rs. 130 million this year and going by this record

title: Sri Lanka releases 69 Tamil Nadu fishermen
content: The Sri Lankan courts in Jaffna and Vavunia today ordered the release of 69 Tamil Nadu fishermen lodged in prisons there, an official said here.

title: 2017 A/L exam: Best results in the island
content: The Department of Examinations says that a total of 163,104 students who sat for the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination this year have gained entrance to universities, as per the results released online last night.

title: To form majority in LG bodies SLFP-SLPP coalition needs 55% Susil
content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) and the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) will obtain 55 per cent of the votes in the coming Local Government (LG) Election and will enter into coalition to form a majority in many LG bodies, Minister Susil Premajayantha said.

title: Russian team to visit Sri Lanka to examine quarantine procedures after lifting tea ban
content: A team of technical experts from Russia will visit Sri Lanka in January to examine plant quarantine procedures in the island country, the Sri Lankan Foreign Ministry said Wednesday.

title: Colombo could be like Delhi soon
content: Colombo could face air pollution issue like New Delhi soon, Central Environment Trust Director Sajeewa Chamikara said yesterday.

title: Cabinet approves US$ 175 Million for National Carrier
content: Cabinet has approved US$ 175 million to be obtained from Credit Suisse to give a much-needed lifeline to the cash-strapped, ailing national carrier SriLankan Airlines, State Minister of Public Enterprise Development, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena said.

title: Remembering lives swept away by the deadly waves in 2004
content: It’s been thirteen years since the tsunami wave that hit the country and left behind a trail of devastation, with thousands of lives lost in the catastrophe.

title: Russian watchdog to resume tea imports from Sri Lanka: RIA
content: MOSCOW – Russia’s agriculture safety watchdog will resume imports of tea from Sri Lanka, RIA news agency cited its head Sergey Dankvert as saying on Monday.

title: CHRISTMAS MESSAGES
content: President Maithripala Sirisena extended his warmest greetings for a happy Christmas to all Christians who are devoted heirs of this magnificent universal festivity.

title: India appears threatened by Chinese projects in Sri Lanka: experts
content: India has launched fierce attacks against Chinese commercial activities in Sri Lanka in recent weeks, and moved to secure more projects in Sri Lanka with Japan, in what appears to be desperate moves to maintain its declining influence in Sri Lanka.

title: India beat Sri Lanka to wrap up T20 series sweep
content: India completed a 3-0 series sweep against Sri Lanka on Sunday following their five-wicket victory in the final Twenty20 International at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

title: Priority should be given to uplift economic standard of low-income families in 2018 development plans – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says in the year 2018, priority should be given for the projects which focused on uplifting of the economic status of underprivileged people while developing their livelihoods.

title: GMOA opposes ‘sale’ of SAITM medical school to SLIIT
content: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) yesterday said it would give the government time till next Sunday (31) to withdraw its decision to hand over the Medical Faculty of the South Asian Institute of Medicine (SAITM) to the Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology (SLIIT) and provide a justifiable solution to the medical undergraduates and graduates of SAITM.

title: Abduction of 11 youth: Witness says CID changed statement
content: When the case where former navy spokesman D.K.P. Dissanayake was an accused was taken up for hearing before the Fort Magistrate Court, a key witness the CID had changed several parts of his initial statement and requested that he be allowed to made a personal statement in Court.

title: JVP slams move to relocate beggars
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) is opposed to the Government’s move to relocate beggars.

title: Narcotic pills worth Rs 25 million seized in Peliyagoda
content: A stock of narcotic pills illegally imported to the country and estimated to be worth around Rs 25 million has been taken into custody in the Peliyagoda area, Police Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekara said.

title: Train runs over car killing two, injuring two others
content: Two individuals were killed on the spot when a car crashed into a train plying from Halawata to Colombo

title: Government in overdrive with US assistance: Search for ‘stolen funds’
content: A US official is in Colombo to coordinate high profile ongoing asset recovery operations undertaken by the Sirisena-Wickremesinghe administration.

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer on remittances, dollar conversions
content: The Sri Lankan rupee closed firmer on Thursday, as exporter dollar sales and inward remittances exceeded demand for the U.S. currency by importers, dealers said.

title: Life imprisonment for elephant killers
content: The government had decided to amend Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance to implement life imprisonment for those found guilty of killing wild elephants.

title: President emphasizes need to eradicate poverty in region
content: The Third Ministerial Meeting of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) was commenced under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena in Colombo, yesterday (20).

title: Wilpattu National Sanctuary Forest Conservation Dept denies releasing land
content: The Department of Forest Conservation emphasized yesterday (20) that they had not released any land within the environment and eco system belonging to Wilpattu National Sanctuary, which has been under the supervision of the Department, since 8 May 2013.

title: Defence rentals cost Rs. 5 billion yearly
content: The abrupt and unplanned decision taken by the previous regime to remove the Defence Headquarters from Colombo has cost an annual rent of Rs. 5 bn for 15 buildings, the defence forces are occupying at present.

title: Axiata subsidiary has invested US $ 2.2 billion in Sri Lanka
content: PETALING JAYA: Axiata Group Bhd through its subsidiary, Dialog Axiata PLC, has invested over US $ 2.2 billion (RM9bil) in Sri Lanka, the telecommunications company said.

title: Russia to discuss restricted tea imports with Sri Lanka in December
content: Russia’s agriculture safety watchdog Rosselkhoznadzor plans to discuss restricted tea imports with Sri Lanka at the end of December, it said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Deputy Minister Nimal Lanza resigns
content: United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) Gampaha district MP and Deputy Minister of Home Affairs Nimal Lanza resigned from his ministerial portfolio today.

title: Government overcame all economic difficulties: PM
content: Proper economic management policies adopted by the government have enabled the country to overcome the debilitating effects of the unfavourable climatic conditions experienced in recent times. If not for the government led by President Maithripala Sirisena, the country would never have been able to overcome the economic difficulties caused by the adverse weather conditions, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Public transportation requires expansion – Champika Ranawaka
content: Minister of Megapolis and Western Development Patali Champika Ranawaka stated that the public transportation network requires expansion to resolve the problems faced by the general public.

title: Local Government election on February 10
content: The Local Government election would be held on February 10, 2018, Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Desapriya announced today.

title: Malaysian PM meets President
content: The official meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and the visiting Prime Minister of Malaysia Dato’ Sri Mohd Najib bin Tun Abdul Razak was held at the Presidential Secretariat, this morning (18th Dec.)

title: CEB workers threaten countrywide strike
content: Joint Trade Union Alliance of the Ceylon Electricity Board yesterday warned that they would launch a countrywide strike if the government failed to provide solutions to their problems today (18).

title: Fifty Chinese couples marry in mass ceremony in Sri Lanka
content: Fifty couples from China tied the knot in the Sri Lankan capital on Sunday in a mass wedding ceremony, conducted in the island’s Buddhist traditions, as the island aims to woo more tourists.

title: Ban use of polythene for upcoming elections campaigns – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena instructed the Central Environmental Authority (CEA) to ban the use of polythene during the upcoming election campaigns.

title: When I don’t score, people think my attitude is wrong – Mathews
content: Former captain Angelo Mathews has been Sri Lanka’s best batsman on this tour having notched up two hundreds so far. The 30-year-old in an interview with ‘Sunday Island’ spoke about the technical adjustments he has done to his game and the misconception among people that his attitude is wrong when he goes through a lean patch.

title: U.N. asks urgent reforms to end arbitrary detention in Sri Lanka
content: The United Nations on Friday urged the Sri Lankan government to urgently implement reforms to end war-time arbitrary detention and strengthen independent monitoring of tough legislation.

title: Financial Intelligence Unit signs MoU with Sri Lanka Police
content: In terms of the provisions of the Financial Transactions Reporting Act, No. 6 of 2006 (FTRA), the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) of Sri Lanka entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Sri Lanka Police recently at the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to share information/intelligence…

title: Ven.Gnanissara thero discusses acquisition of $290 billion with former President
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa participated in an event where a water bowser was donated to the kidney disease prevention program of the Colombo Gangaramaya temple on Thursday (14).

title: Russia restricts tea supplies from Sri Lanka after finding beetle
content: Russia will place temporary restrictions on imports of all agricultural products from Sri Lanka, including tea, from Dec. 18, the Russian agricultural safety watchdog Rosselkhoznadzor said on Thursday.

title: Polythene banned for polls
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday instructed the Central Environment Authority to ban the use of polythene for election decorations.

title: No confidence in management – SriLankan Airlines Unions
content: The Alliance of Unions of SriLankan Airlines in a letter addressed to its Chairman Ajith Dias had claimed that they had no confidence in both him and the Board to be in charge of the National Carrier.

title: Electronic Government Procurement soon
content: Electronic Government Procurement (e-GP) will be introduced into the Public Procurement System, according to a proposal approved by Cabinet this week.

title: Will Sri Lanka turn to SMS storm warnings after ‘night from hell’?
content: In the early evening of Nov. 29, Ajith Dias, an office worker in Colombo, started receiving warnings on Facebook of a brewing storm nearing Sri Lanka’s southern coast.

title: Railway strike called off
content: Railway trade unions have decided to call off the strike action. The decision to call off the strike was made following a special discussion with the Cabinet sub-committee appointed to look into the matter.

title: UN officials visited LTTE detainees– Did not visit two naval officers in prison
content: The United Nations (UN) did not visit the Naval Officers, Cmdr Dasanayaka and Lt. Cmdr Sumith Ranasinghe who are in prison but it was reported that they had visited the LTTE detainees at the same location, rear admiral (Rtd) Sarath Weerasekara said.

title: Two more arrested in betel leaf import scam
content: LAHORE: National Accountability Bureau (NAB), Lahore, Tuesday arrested two more betel leaf importers for causing a loss of Rs26.757 million to national exchequer by evading/miscalculating custom duty liable on import of betel leaf in a Rs2.6 billion corruption case.

title: President requests striking railway workers to return to work
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has requested all workers engaging in the railway strike action to report for work, taking into consideration the inconvenience caused to students who are to sit for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level examinations, as well as the inconvenience experienced by the general commuters.

title: All parties that were elected into power failed miserably – Anura Kumara
content: Leader of the JVP Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that all the political parties that were elected into power failed to fulfill the needs of the people.

title: NFF in deep crisis
content: The National Freedom Front (NFF), led by Wimal Weerawansa MP yesterday plunged into deeper crisis with the party’s Deputy Leader Weerakumara Dissanayake and NFF National Organiser Piyasiri Wijenayake joining the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).

title: Police step in as railway strike action reaches day four
content: The Railway Department states that nearly 20 trains to be used by office goers have been added to the service today for the convenience of the commuters.

title: Korea offers USD 14 Million for Garbage Collection Compactors to Sri Lanka
content: The Export-Import Bank of Korea approved USD 14 million for supply of garbage collection compactors to Sri Lanka. This project will provide 190 garbage compactors to local authorities in all nine Provinces of Sri Lanka in order to collect and transfer large amount of waste to dumping sites in an efficient and economical manner.

title: Perera lauds Lakmal after emphatic ODI win
content: Dharamsala: New captain Thisara Perera Sunday hailed Suranga Lakmal as Sri Lanka’s premier fast bowler after he led the visitors to a seven-wicket win over India in the first one-day international.

title: Foreign experts to fight bribes, corruption
content: The Government was mulling obtaining the assistance of external experts to carry out investigations on corruption, Minister of Law and Order Sagala Ratnayake said over the weekend.

title: Sri Lanka hands port formally to Chinese firm, receives $292 million
content: Sri Lanka formally handed over commercial activities in its main southern port to a Chinese company on Saturday and received $292 million out of a $1.12 billion deal, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera said.

title: Swift relief for farmers affected by extreme weather- PM
content: A mechanism to provide relief for farming families affected by extreme weather will be developed within two weeks, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Sri Lanka parliament backs tax exemptions for port deal with Chinese
content: Sri Lanka’s parliament approved on Friday a raft of tax concessions for a Chinese-led joint venture which will handle the southern port of Hambantota under a $1.1 billion deal that has sparked public anger and concerns in India and elsewhere.

title: Sri Lankan pleads guilty to bomb threat on flight
content: A Sri Lankan man who threatened to set off a bomb onboard a flight from Melbourne is facing a maximum 20 years’ jail after pleading guilty to attempting to take control of an aircraft.

title: Electric car plant, lithium battery factory in Lanka soon – Dr Yaddehige
content: Richard Pieris & Company PLC plans to invest between Rs 15 to 20 billion in several unique projects in the next three years that will see electric cars, lithium batteries and Oud perfume manufactured in Sri Lanka

title: IMF approves US$ 251.4 mn to Lanka
content: The IMF Executive Board completed the third review of Sri Lanka’s Extended Fund Facility arrangement on Wednesday (6), enabling the disbursement of US$ 251.4 million to the country.

title: Ranil to apply brakes on the rising cost of living To make special statement tomorrow
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will make a special statement tomorrow (8) morning in Parliament on the increased cost of living and the Government’s decision to import rice and coconut as a temporary measure to provide relief for consumers.

title: Sri Lanka again named Asia’s most sought travel destination
content: Sri Lanka has continued to receive a number of achievements for its recognition as a compact travel destination across the globe, and received another endorsement recently becoming one of the emerging destinations and one of the most popular global destinations from the key findings of the 2018 Virtuoso Luxe- Australian edition report.

title: Resident US advisor here to assist CIABOC: Sri Lanka categorized among the worst
content: The US State Department Special Project has made provision for a Resident Legal Advisor in Colombo to provide anti-corruption and asset recovery training and also support the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery and Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Chinese enterprises job fair to be held in Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka and China will jointly conduct “the First Chinese Enterprise Job Fair in Sri Lanka,” organised by the Chinese Chamber of Commerce in Sri Lanka and Sri Lankan Ministry of Skills Development and Vocational Training, an official said Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka to hand Hambantota port to Chinese firm, receive $300 million
content: Sri Lanka will hand over commercial activities in its main southern port to a Chinese company on Saturday (9) and receive around $300 million out of a $1.1 billion deal soon after, Ports Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe said.

title: Weerakumara, fourth NFF leader to challenge Wimal
content: A fourth prominent member of the National Freedom Front (NFF) is challenging the party leader Wimal Weerawansa.

title: Lawyers and activists urge Sri Lanka to ban genital cutting
content: LONDON – Lawyers and activists representing a group of Sri Lankan women who were subjected to female genital cutting as children will meet the justice minister on Wednesday to urge a ban on the ritual.

title: CID begins investigations into Galgamuwa Tusker killing
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID), on Monday, began investigations into the killing of Galgamuwa Tusker or Galgamuwe Dala Poottuwa.

title: Trump travel ban: Supreme Court lets restrictions take full effect
content: The US Supreme Court has ruled President Donald Trump’s travel ban on six mainly Muslim countries can go into full effect, pending legal challenges.

title: Comprehensive drug prevention programme soon – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said a comprehensive drug prevention programme would be initiated, adding that the government does not intend to increase state income through cigarette and alcohol sales, adding that based on the government’s drug policy, it is not suitable to grant concessions to any form of alcohol, cigarette or any other intoxicant.

title: Centuries for Mathews and Chandimal but India still on top
content: Having kept it locked up all through this tour, Sri Lanka finally reminded everyone of the batting quality they possess, as centuries from Dinesh Chandimal and, at long last, Angelo Mathews helped them avoid the follow-on at the Feroz Shah Kotla.

title: Journalist murder probes have a long way to go – Mangala
content: The Sri Lankan Government on Monday said it remains firm in its commitment to work with the international community, to work towards ending impunity for crimes against journalists, and to uphold the rights of journalists around the world who place themselves at risk every day, to give voice to the voiceless.

title: No crimes against journalists under present government – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the present government in 2015 put a definitive end for crimes against the media and there since being no journalist abductions, murders, attacks, or intimidation.

title: Sri Lankan family deported after spending 5 years in Canada
content: A Sri Lankan family who spent five years in Canada was deported Sunday despite appeals to Public Safety Minister Ralph Goodale to issue a reprieve.

title: ATM card cloning gang with Sri Lanka, Mumbai links nabbed
content: The Chittoor police on Saturday nabbed a five-member gang hailing from Tamil Nadu involved in ATM-cloning offences while they were about to strike at an ATM centre at Palamaner and seized Rs. 10 lakh, electronic gadgets used for cloning ATM cards, capturing details of PIN numbers and swiping machines.

title: President releases water for research purpose for Moragahakanda electricity generation
content: President Maithripala Sirisena released water for research purpose for the electricity generation of Moragahakanda yesterday (Dec. 02) at auspicious time.

title: NFF’s Wijesekera joins SLFP
content: National Freedom Front politburo member and former Trincomalee District Parliamentarian Jayantha Wijesekera obtained Sri Lanka Freedom Party membership after a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.

title: Power outage Half a million still affected Repair work to be completed today
content: Some half a million residents are still without electricity, nearly 48 hours after the power supply was disrupted as a result of the inclement weather, a top official with the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy said yesterday.

title: Korea hikes bilateral concessional loans to Sri Lanka to US$ 500 million
content: Korea has increased bilateral concessional loans for Sri Lanka, from US$ 300 million to US$ 500 million, as the two countries celebrate 40 years of diplomatic relations.

title: Tropical storm kills at least seven in Sri Lanka
content: A tropical storm has killed at least seven people and left five fishermen missing in Sri Lanka, bringing down trees across main roads and on houses, officials said on Thursday, warning of landslides and flooding in severely hit areas.

title: Rice exporters to visit Sri Lanka
content: A 15-member delegation of Rice Exporters Association of Pakistan (REAP) will visit Sri Lanka in December to increase rice exports, a statement said on Wednesday.

title: Weather: Heavy rains, gusty winds as deep depression begins to move away
content: Department of Meteorology in Sri Lanka states that the depression that occurred in the South-west of Sri Lanka has developed into a deep depression.

title: Interim order preventing action against Gota
content: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order till December 6, preventing the FCID from taking action against former defence secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa based on the Public Property Act.

title: Legal action against those commemorating LTTE – Minister
content: Legal action will be taken against anyone commemorating a proscribed organisation, Defence State Minister Ruwan Wijewardene said.

title: Piyasiri Wijenayake expelled from NFF
content: National Organizer of the National Freedom Front (NFF) Piyasiri Wijenayake stated that he was requested to step down from his post within the NFF and resign from a member from his political party.

title: North Korea confirms successful testing of intercontinental ballistic missile
content: North Korea successfully launched a Hwasong-15 intercontinental ballistic missile on Wednesday, a newsreader on the state-run North Korean Central Television (KCTV) announced. The launch was ordered by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. The broadcast showed a still photo of Kim signing the order.

title: I’ll never betray the nation – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena assured to the Sri Lankan community in South Korea that he would never betray the nation or the country. Addressing the Sri Lankan community in Republic of Korea

title: Government blundered by halting East Terminal causing Rs 3.5 billion loss – Ports Minister
content: A delay in developing the Colombo Port East Terminal had led to a loss of Rs 3.5 billion to the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA), Ports and Shipping Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe told parliament yesterday.

title: Pothas slams ‘embarrassing’ Sri Lanka after worst Test defeat
content: Sri Lanka coach Nic Pothas warned his players there would be “repercussions” after the country’s worst-ever Test defeat, at the hands of India on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka to release 50 acres of capital land for investments
content: Sri Lanka will release nearly 50 acres of state-owned land in the near future for investments in Colombo’s commercial area, a minister said on Monday, as the island nation targets a record $2.5 billion in total foreign direct investments next year.

title: Death knell of government imminent: JO
content: National Organizer of the Joint Opposition Dalles Alahapperuma said it is with disgust that the Joint Opposition rejects the shameless attempt being made by the government to postpone the elections of local government bodies for about 2 years and 7 months.

title: Nominations for 93 Local Councils to be called today
content: The district returning officers will issue notice calling for nominations for 93 undisputed local government bodies today (27th Nov.), the Elections Commission Chairman told, following the conclusion of a crucial internal meeting.

title: PM predicts victory at LG polls
content: As much as the UNP gave leadership and captured power to form a National Government in 2015, the government will win the village level administration in 2018 too and carry forward the country’s development process, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: PM has made a pledge to India – Wimal
content: Leader of the National Freedom Front (NFF) Wimal Weerawansa stated that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has made a promise to India to enact the proposed new constitution within Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Minister Musthapha gone abroad even without informing the PM’ – Kiriella
content: Leader of the House, Higher Education and Highways Minister Lakshman Kiriella said that the government was not aware of the whereabouts of Minister Mustapaha.

title: Sri Lanka PM returns from India to fight fire
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe returned from a four-day Indian visit to battle a deepening rift between his party and President Maithripala that threatens to undermine their unity government.

title: Around 82% of indirect taxes borne by people – Mangala
content: I was dismayed when I was told that 82% of the total tax revenue collected by way of indirect taxes is borne by the normal citizen, Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera said.

title: “If there are complaints against my decisions to stop corruption & fraud, I will continue the struggle together with people – President
content: “If there are undue criticism and complaints against the decisions taken by me to stop corruption and fraud, I am ready to leave all positions and join the people to continue the struggle” says President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Criminal investigators face many a challenge – Secretary to the President
content: Secretary to the President, Austin Fernando emphasized the importance of the tasks entrusted to criminal investigation officials. He said that their task is of immense importance to the quest for justice and fight crimes, corruption and frauds.

title: Net neutrality gives voice to people – PM
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today came out in support of Net neutrality, saying that unthrottled access to the Internet is key to level playing field and giving voice of the oppressed.

title: Split in NFF? – Piyasiri says party doesn’t need Wimal
content: Piyasiri Wijenayake says that the day the National Freedom Front (NFF) will be limited only to a name board is not very far away.

title: Ajith appeals Speaker to mediate
content: UNP MP and Deputy Minister Ajith P. Perera yesterday made an appeal to Speaker Karu Jayasuriya to mediate to get the details of the telephone conversations from the Presidential Commission of Inquiry…

title: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe to hold talks with PM Modi on wide range of issues today
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is on a four-day visit to India to attend the 5th Global Conference on Cyber Space, will on Thursday hold extensive talks with his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi.

title: Northern Edu Minister’s negative feelings understandable – Wigneswaran
content: Chief Minister of the Northern Province C.V. Wigneswaran responded to a question raised by a journalist on his view on the controversial actions of the Northern Province Education Minister who refused to raise the national flag at an event earlier this month.

title: Bonds Scam I contacted Aloysius to conduct research – Sujeewa
content: State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe affirmed that he had contacted the Owner of Perpetual Treasuries Limited, Arjun Aloysius in an effort to gather details for his book that he was authoring related to the sale of Treasury Bonds and also in a bid to clarify certain other issues and to verify a few other details.

title: Sri Lanka to probe phone tapping of legislators
content: Sri Lanka’s parliament Tuesday announced an investigation into how the private phone records of legislators were leaked in a scandal that has deepened acrimony between President Maithripala Sirisena and his coalition.

title: ‘Some Sri Lankan goods doing extremely well in India’
content: From chicken sausages, nail polish, strawberries and chicken feed to glass and Damro chairs, some Sri Lankan goods are doing ‘extremely well’ in India.

title: JO will not align with the SLFP – Namal
content: MP Namal Rajapaksa stated that the Joint Opposition will not join with the SLFP to contest the upcoming elections as a united front.

title: PM off to India
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremsinghe is due to leave on an official visit to India today,(November 21), states a press release from the Prime Minister’s office..

title: Sri Lanka PM appears before bond probe panel
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe appeared voluntarily before a panel investigating alleged irregularities in government bond sales on Monday to clear his name.

title: Prime Minister arrives at Bond Commission
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe appeared before the Presidential Commission of Inquiry today (20) to record a statement over Central Bond scam,a short while ago.

title: PM WARNS TROUBLE MAKERS
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe who visited Gintota in Galle yesterday in the aftermath of the tense situation that prevailed in the area said that stern legal action will be taken against those responsible for the violence.

title: Fake sms on petrol shortage again! Leads to panic buying in Kandy
content: A malicious and scurrilous countrywide sms (short messaging service) campaign over mobile phones, by unknown unruly elements, led to panic buying of both petrol and diesel and long queues in the Kandy District last night.

title: PM not summoned to Presidential Commission; making voluntary appearance – Kiriella
content: There is an attempt to portray that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has been summoned before the Presidential Commission into the Treasury bond scam.

title: Chandika Hathurusingha to take over as Sri Lanka coach after India series: Reports
content: Sri Lanka Cricket are on the verge of former Test cricketer Chandika Hathurusingha as the Head Coach of the men’s team Sri Lankan team, according to Cricbuzz. It is reported that the 49-year-old will arrive in Colombo next week to meet officials and he is expected to take over after the ongoing series in India.

title: GOTABHAYA FIXED IN AVANT-GARDE CASE
content: A corruption case filed against former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa and seven others, was yesterday fixed for trial by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Curfew imposed in Galle
content: A police curfew has been imposed in six Grama Niladhari divisions which fall under the purview of the Galle Police.

title: We won’t allow Aava group to raise its head – Sagala
content: Law and Order Minister Sagala Ratnayaka assured that the government would not allow the so-called Aava group, or any other criminal gang, to raise its head in the North.

title: CID probe into telephone conversations: Links between COPE ‘Footnote’ members and Aloysius revealed
content: An in-depth investigation, conducted by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has revealed a spate of telephone conversations between Perpetual Treasuries Pvt Ltd (PTL) owner Arjuna Aloysius and some members of the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE), which probed alleged bond scams.

title: Ravi Karunanayake and family spoke to Aloysius over 750 times
content: Evidence before the Bond Commission revealed that former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake and his family spoke to Arjun Aloysius over 750 times in total during the period February 5, 2015 to June 20, 2017.

title: Sri Lanka considers investment in peace as sound economic policy – Dr. Harsha De Silva at Geneva summit
content: Addressing the Third Cycle of Universal Periodic Review of Sri Lanka held in Geneva, National Policies and Economic Affairs Deputy Minster Dr. Harsha De Silva yesterday (15th Nov.) said: “For the very first time in our history, a section of the National Budget for 2018 is expressly dedicated to reconciliation.

title: British woman wins $5,200 for Sri Lankan deportation over Buddha tattoo
content: A British woman won 800,000 rupees ($5,200) in compensation from a Sri Lankan court on Wednesday after being wrongly deported for having a Buddha tattoo on her arm.

title: Indictments against four Customs officers for accepting Rs.125 million bribe
content: The Colombo High Court  today(15) filed indictments against four ex-senior customs officials allegedly involved in accepting a bribe of Rs.125 million; the largest ever recorded bribe nabbed by the Bribery Commission.

title: Sagala denies secret meetings with Senarath
content: Minister of Law and Order Sagala Ratnayake denied that he had conducted any ‘secret meetings’ with former President’s Chief of Staff Gamini Senarath.

title: Filling Stations – Some creating artificial shortage: Arjuna
content: Petroleum Resources Development Minister Arjuna Ranatunge said yesterday he had received information that certain filling stations were continue to create an artificial petrol shortage and a special team had been deployed to investigate it.

title: 30-year war cost Sri Lanka over US$ 400 Billion
content: The Government yesterday (13) said, that failure to manage the ethnic issue had resulted in the country’s economy losing billions over the years.

title: Army camps won’t be removed endangering national security – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that the army camps have not been removed in a way which will weaken the national security or will have an impact on the security forces.

title: Strong earthquake hits Iraq and Iran, killing at least 145
content: A magnitude 7.3 earthquake hit the region around the border between Iran and Iraq on Sunday, killing at least 145 people state media in the two countries said, as rescuers searched for dozens trapped under rubble.

title: Tax revenue doubled
content: The State Tax Revenue has doubled within three years from 2014, Megapolis and Western Development Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said.

title: Will President Maithri ask Ranil to quit as PM?
content: Clad in a carefully chosen blue and green tie, Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera entered the Chamber at 3.05p.m. on Thursday (9) to present Budget 2018, which was themed, ‘Blue-Green Budget; the Launch of Enterprise Sri Lanka’.

title: Labour Minister wants ‘Gal’ arrack prices reduced to benefit common man
content: Labour, Trade Union Relations and Sabaragamuwa Development Minister John Seneviratne asked the Finance and Mass Media Minister to bring down the price of ‘Gal’ (extra special) arrack.

title: Sri Lankan rupee firms on remittances; budget clarity awaited
content: The Sri Lankan rupee edged higher on Friday on dollar inflows from remittances, while the market awaited more clarity on the budget policies announced a day earlier, dealers said.

title: How Budget 2018 could affect vehicle prices
content: Sri Lanka’s vehicles importers today said that the Excise Duties of several vehicles are expected to change in line with proposals announced in the 2018 Budget.

title: Sri Lanka says it will investigate allegations of torture
content: Sri Lanka says it will investigate allegations by more than 50 ethnic Tamils that they were abducted and tortured by police or army soldiers long after the end of the island nation’s civil war.

title: BUDGET 2018 TO ENERGISE ECONOMY
content: Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera presenting his maiden budget for 2018 envisions to increase the economic growth rate to 6 percent by 2020 from the current 4.5 percent.

title: Mangala to present 72nd budget today
content: The 72nd budget of independent Sri Lanka and the fourth of the incumbent government will be presented to Parliament by Minister of Finance and Mass Media, Mangala Samaraweera today (9) at 3:00 p.m.

title: Sri Lanka gets 40,000 tonnes of petrol from UAE amid fuel shortage
content: Sri Lanka was set to receive a 40,000-tonne petrol shipment from the United Arab Emirates early on Thursday to help plug a fuel shortage triggered by panic buying, officials said, and India assured further help to its neighbour if needed.

title: Levies of several essential items reduced
content: The Ministry of Finance has reduced the special commodity levy on several essential items including potatoes, big onions, Dhal, coconut and vegetable oil.

title: US grants for promoting religious freedom in India, Sri Lanka
content: The US has announced a grant of nearly $500,000 for organisations which can come up with ideas and projects to promote religious freedom in India and Sri Lanka.

title: Presidential Committee to probe fuel shortage
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday appointed a Cabinet Sub-Committee to probe the cause of the crippling fuel shortage prevailing in the country.

title: Harassments through means of telecommunication is a punishable offense
content: Sri Lanka Telecommunication Regulatory Commission said that spreading rumours through SMS messages and harassing individuals by means of telephone calls is a punishable offense.

title: Circular to be issued over supply of petrol: fuel to be pumped only to vehicles
content: The Secretary to the Petroleum Ministry stated that a circular will be issued today (7), on the issuance of petrol declaring that fuel should be pumped only to vehicles until the fuel crisis has been averted.

title: Sri Lanka fuel shortage to end on Nov. 9 – Oil minister
content: Sri Lanka’s fuel shortage will end on Nov. 9, Petroleum Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said on Monday, as state-run oil retailer Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) and Lanka IOC traded blame charges over the shortage.

title: Seven dead, 44 injured in bus accident at Madurankuliya
content: Seven persons reported dead and 44 others injured following a collusion between a bus and a 3-wheeler at Madurankuliya on the Colombo-Puttalam road.

title: Petrol crisis drags on; crucial meeting today
content: The Petroleum Resources Ministry is to hold a crisis meeting today to address the fuel shortage as panic buying of fuel continued for the second day yesterday with the Ceylon Petroleum Cooperation struggling to meet demand.

title: Texas gunman kills at least 26 worshipers at small-town church
content: A gunman massacred at least 26 worshipers and wounded 20 others at a white-steepled church in southeast Texas on Sunday, carrying out the latest in a series of mass shootings that have plagued the United States, authorities said.

title: Sri Lanka, China open Industrial Zone Office
content: Sri Lanka and China jointly launched the “Sri Lanka-China Logistics and Industrial Zone Office” in Sri Lanka’s southern port of Hambantota on Saturday.

title: President visits Pandit Amaradewa’s residence
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (Nov. 03) visited the residence of the late music maestro Pandith W.D. Amaradeva in Maharagama to join his one year remembrance.

title: Promote peace, China’s Xi Jinping tells soldiers at first overseas base
content: Troops serving at China’s first overseas military base, in the Horn of Africa country of Djibouti, should help promote peace and stability, President Xi Jinping told them in a video chat

title: Sri Lanka limits fuel supplies after delay in import shipment
content: Thousands of Sri Lankan motorists queued for fuel on Friday after the state-run fuel retailer limited supplies following a delay in a fuel shipment and a rejection of another shipment due to the wrong specification, officials said.

title: Premier Turnbull hails President Sirisena’s great reconciliation programme
content: Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull congratulated President Maithripala Sirisena for the “great reconciliation programme undertaken by the Sri Lankan government”.

title: MR complains of conspiracy
content: The UNP, the TNA, the SLFP and the JVP were engaged in a ‘constitutional conspiracy’, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa told Constitutional Assembly yesterday.

title: EU lawmakers see little progress in Sri Lanka rights reforms
content: European lawmakers said on Thursday they were disappointed about Sri Lanka’s slow roll-out of human rights reforms that the island nation had promised in exchange for trade concessions.

title: SC upholds ruling on Geetha Kumarasinghe’s MP seat
content: The Supreme Court has today upheld the decision of the Appeal Court to annul MP Geetha Kumarasinghe’s Parliamentarian post as she was a dual citizenship holder.

title: Australian PM Malcolm Turnbull arrives in Sri Lanka
content: Australian Prime Minster Malcolm Turnbull arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning to mark the 70th anniversary of Australia-Sri Lanka bilateral relations.

title: Trump says he will terminate green card lottery system
content: US President Donald Trump has said that he would end the popular US green card lottery after a radicalised Uzbek man who entered the country under the programme killed eight people in New York.

title: Final draft of US-prepared new Constitution ready – Keheliya
content: There is no point in debating the interim report of the Constitutional Assembly Steering Committee as the final draft of proposed constitution has already been prepared by the US and given to the government, UPFA Kandy District MP Keheliya Rambukwella says.

title: Pakistani couple arrested with Rs. 30 million worth heroin at BIA
content: A Pakistani couple had been arrested with 2.7 kilos of heroine worth Rs. 30 million by the Police Narcotics Bureau ( PNB ) at the Bandaranaike International Airport this morning.

title: Three JO MPs reprimanded for shameful conduct
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya yesterday said that those who threatened to set the House on fire, could not be allowed to stifle democracy.

title: 8 dead as truck mows down bike path in lower Manhattan
content: A driver plowed a pickup truck down a crowded bike path along the Hudson River in Manhattan on Tuesday, killing eight people and injuring 11 before being shot by a police officer in what officials are calling the deadliest terrorist attack on New York City since Sept. 11, 2001.

title: Sri Lanka says keen for early conclusion of China trade deal
content: Sri Lanka is keen to reach agreement soon on a free trade deal with China, its foreign minister said on Tuesday, describing Beijing as a close friend and ally, despite strong local opposition to some major Chinese-invested schemes.

title: PM OPTIMISTIC OF THE FUTURE
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was buoyant yesterday when he presented the two year progress report of the government led by the United National Party.

title: Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa condemns Constitutional Assembly
content: Former Minister of Justice Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa stated that the Steering Committee of the Constitutional Assembly has been an unconstitutional and powerless entity since its inception.

title: China urges closer cooperation with Sri Lanka on key projects
content: China and Sri Lanka should focus on strengthening cooperation over key investment projects, Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Monday told his visiting counterpart from Sri Lanka, amid strong local opposition to some major Chinese-invested schemes.

title: Buddhist policy is to resolve conflicts without destroying lives – President
content: “President Maithripala Sirisena has an immense capability to overcome critical challenges faced by the country. He is the only leader who can give a solution to the national issue, with an agreement of all communities”, says Ven. Medagoda Abhayathissa Thero, senior lecturer of Sri Lanka Pali and Buddhist University.

title: SAITM medical faculty abolished
content: The Presidential Committee appointed to resolve issues related to the South Asia Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) has recommended abolishing the SAITM Medical Faculty and establishing a not-for-profit Institute under the supervision of the Higher Education Ministry for its operations and management.

title: Sri Lanka launches first banking robot
content: One of Sri Lanka’s leading commercial banks, Sampath Bank, said on Thursday that it had launched the country’s first banking robot that works in the form of a humanoid teller.

title: Presidential Committee releases statement with recommendations to solve SAITM issue
content: A statement was issued a short while ago by the Presidential Committee appointed by President Maithripala Sirisena to solve the problems that have arisen in the Faculty of Medicine at SAITM.

title: Four killed in Kosgoda shooting incidents
content: Four persons have been confirmed dead following multiple shooting incidents that ensued in Kosgoda earlier today (29), where one individual has also been injured.

title: Tax concessions for small businesses, subsidies for select groups
content: Tax concessions for small and medium scale businesses, and targeted subsidies to selected groups are among highlights of next month’s budget proposals.

title: Constitution making: MPs mustn’t support SC report: Elle Gunawansa Thera
content: Ven. Elle Gunawansa Thera yesterday asked the government not to deceive the people with regard to the Steering Committee (SC) report and urged the MPs to avoid supporting it when presented in Parliament.

title: Smart Identity Card from today
content: Department of Registration of Persons will issue new Smart Identity Cards with modern technology from today (27th Oct.).

title: Harsha slams CEB
content: Foreign Affairs Deputy Minister Harsha De Silva repeatedly criticised the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) for what he called an abdication of its duty.

title: Hero Pakistan bus driver happy to welcome back Sri Lanka
content: Meher Mohammad Khalil, a Pakistani bus driver who held his nerve under gunfire to guide the Sri Lankan team to safety during an attack in 2009, is thrilled that international cricket is finally returning to Lahore.

title: SLC denies the alleged involvement of any official or employee in the incident of harassment
content: Sri Lanka Cricket wishes to deny the alleged involvement of any official or employee of SLC in the purported incident of harassment of a female journalist in Abu Dhabi during the ongoing Sri Lanka Vs. Pakistan series.

title: UNP promoting TNA agenda – Vasu
content: The United National Party (UNP) is actually promoting the agenda of the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) through the proposed new Constitution. That is why Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe wants it passed in a hurry, United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara alleged.

title: Issues affecting Tamils have to be addressed – Government
content: The government said yesterday that the Tamil people had issues which needed to be resolved and it would be addressed within a united country.

title: Sri Lanka to offer tax breaks for project involving China-backed Port City
content: Sri Lanka is preparing legislation with tax incentives to attract investment into a big property development near Colombo port that includes a $1.4 billion Chinese-backed real estate project, a government minister said on Wednesday.

title: President commences two day state visit to Qatar
content: President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at Hamad International Airport in Doha today (25) on a two day state visit on the invitation of the Emir of Qatar Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani.

title: Final decision on SAITM to be delivered today
content: The government will give its final verdict on the Medical Faculty of the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine today (25).

title: PRICING Formula for electricity, fuel
content: Sri Lanka is looking at introducing a pricing formula for both electricity and fuel soon, Central Bank Governor, Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy said.

title: Buddhists sects oppose for new constitution – MR
content: All sects of Buddhism including the Asgiriya and the Malwathu chapters were objecting to introduce a new constitution to Sri Lanka, Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said yesterday.

title: U.N. says Sri Lanka’s delay in post-war reconciliation involves risks
content: Long delays in Sri Lanka’s post-war reconciliation is not without cost, and its government should implement measures to resolve outstanding issues, the United Nations said on Monday.

title: One killed, 7 arrested following shootout in Divulapitiya
content: A shootout took place between the Police Special Task Force and a criminal gang in Henpitigedara, Diwulapitiya.

title: Sri Lanka to import 200,000 metric tons of rice
content: The Ministry of Industry and Commerce has decided to immediately import 200,000 metric tons of rice.

title: Sri Lankan doctors working in ISIS healthcare service?
content: Doctors from several countries including Sri Lanka are working for the ISIS healthcare service, claims a suspected Indian doctor working for the ISIS and recruiting youths for the terror group.

title: Rs. 2,000 million granted to 17,000 flood affected families in Kolonnawa
content: The Government has taken steps to grant Rs. 2,000 million as compensation to 17,000 families in the Kolonnawa DS division in the Colombo district affected by the 2016 floods to help uplift their lives. During the first phase of the programme, Rs. 271.6 million was distributed at Rs. 10,000 per family last year.

title: China’s loan delayed: Central Expressway at roadblock
content: A continuing delay by China’s Exim Bank to extend a loan of US$ 1.1 billion (Rs 158 billion) to Sri Lanka has put on hold the first phase of the Central Expressway project. The project covers 37.09 kilometres and links up to the rest of the Central Expressway from Mirigama.

title: Sri Lanka will continue to work with UN, other firms by aligning govt. policy with SDGs
content: Sri Lanka will continue to work with the United Nations (UN) and other institutions by aligning the government’s policy strategy with the “Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and Targets” to be achieved by 2030, Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera said.

title: PRUDENT DEBT MANAGEMENT STRATEGY TO OVERCOME FISCAL FRONT CHALLENGES
content: More than Rs.3,489 billion is required in the next two years for debt servicing, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told Parliament yesterday, also highlighting that the Government has put in place a prudent debt management strategy to overcome the unprecedented challenges in the fiscal front.

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends higher on inward remittances
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended marginally higher on Friday as selling of the U.S. dollar by banks on account of inward remittances surpassed early demand for the greenback from importers, dealers said.

title: Northern people’s and student’s representatives meet President
content: A group of people, including a member of Northern Provincial Council K. Sivajilingam who recently protested in Jaffna hoisting black flags, met with President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat, yesterday (19th Oct.).

title: PM slams mischievous media spin; Malwatte Chief Prelate denies opposing new constitution
content: The Chief Prelate of the Malwatte Chapter rejected media reports which mischievously suggested that he opposed any Constitutional reforms, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday (19th).

title: Hirunika, UNP organizer for Ratmalana
content: MP Hirunika Premachandra was appointed by the Prime Minster Ranil Wickremesinghe as the UNP organizer for Ratmalana yesterday.

title: Rumours dispelled; Gotabaya Rajapaksa returns to Sri Lanka
content: It has been reported that former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa returned to Sri Lanka earlier today (19), dispelling rumours of his impending arrest.

title: Meteor explosion cause for bright light, sound in SP – Prof. Jayaratne
content: Colombo University Physical Science Department Prof. Chandana Jayaratne confirmed that the bright light and sound which was heard from the Southern Province (SP) this evening was because of an explosion caused by a meteor.

title: ALL DEBTS TO BE SETTLED BY END 2018 – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government will never shrug off the responsibility vested upon it to revive the country’s economy.

title: Prime Minister’s Deepavali message
content: Jain and Hindu believers celebrate Deepavali with the sacred light of truth that wins over the darkness of evil. The true meaning of Deepavali is found in overcoming lies with the truth, hatred with love, evil with goodness and defeat with victory.

title: President’s Deepavali message
content: I am very pleased to send this message of greetings on the occasion of the festival of Deepavali celebrated by the Hindus throughout the world, symbolizing the victory of light over darkness, knowledge over ignorance, good over evil, and hope over despair.

title: PM may be summoned
content: Chairman of the presidential commission of inquiry probing alleged bonds scams Justice K.T.Chitrasiri yesterday said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe would be summoned as a witness if necessary.

title: Release all prisoners detained under PTA: Sampanthan
content: Opposition Leader R.Sampanthan yesterday in Parliament urged the Government to release all prisoners detained under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) without further delay.

title: Anika Wijesuriya has fled country due to threats – AG’s Dept
content: Anika Wijesuriya, who testified before the Bond Commission earlier on regarding the Penthouse apartment, in which former Minister Ravi Karunanayake resided, had left the country due to death threats

title: Government got no mandate to repeal Constitution – MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says the government did not receive a mandate to repeal the existing Constitution. He has opposed some of the key proposals made by the Steering Committee of the Constitutional Assembly.

title: Treasury Bond issue: Former CB Governor Cabraal gave top appointments in banks to his relatives
content: It was revealed yesterday before the Treasury Bond Commission that former Governor of the Central Bank Ajith Nivard Cabraal, while holding office, had several of his close relatives appointed to top posts in banks coming under the purview of the Central Bank.

title: Sri Lanka confirms visit to Lahore for T20 clash
content: The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has officially confirmed its national team’s tour to Pakistan for the last T20 match of the on-going series, to be played at the Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore on Oct 29.

title: Namal Rajapaksa and 7 others granted bail
content: UPFA Parliamentarians Namal Rajapaksa, DV Chanaka, Provincial Councilor Sampath Atukorala and five other arrested in connection with the protest in Hambantota have been granted bail.

title: Sad to see long-serving SLFP organizers removed – John
content: Labour and Trade Union Relations Minister John Seneviratne, who is a senior member of Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), said yesterday that it was sad that some party organizers who had served the party for a long time had been expelled even without giving them reasons for their dismissal.

title: President promises special programme to uplift Northern farmers
content: Farmers in the North had toiled with enthusiasm and dedication to make the country self sufficient in food in the past. A special programme will be launched to resolve the problem of Northern farmers and uplift them as an economically strong farmer entity once again, President Maithripala Sirisena said.

title: PM ready to give evidence before bond probe commission
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is ready to give evidence before the presidential commission of Inquiry probing the Treasury bond scandal if the commission wants him to do so, according to a statement issued by the Prime Minister’s office yesterday.

title: New legislation to open Lanka to ICT experts
content: Sri Lanka would soon introduce legislation for the Immigration Controller to act as the sole authority to expedite bringing in foreign experts to be employed in the ICT sector in Sri Lanka, said State Minister for Finance, Eran Wickramaratne.

title: President cautions the North: dont’ give the devil a chance
content: “If you stage protests against me and I am weakened, the devil will get an opportunity,” President Maithripala Sirisena told a gathering in Jaffna yesterday.

title: India eyes airport in Sri Lanka, near Chinese Belt and Road outpost
content: India is in advanced talks with Sri Lanka to operate an airport on the southern tip of the island, where China has invested heavily as part of its Belt and Road initiative, a Sri Lankan minister said.

title: Eran’s advise to private sector Don’t complain, give solutions
content: State Minister of Finance Eran Wickramaratne, addressing a forum in Colombo yesterday (12), said that what the Government wants from the private sector is not only complaints, but possible solutions to those problems.

title: Sri Lanka to receive USD 700 million from Millennium Challenge Corporation
content: Minister of Finance and Media, Mangala Samaraweera, met Fatema Z. Sumar, the Regional Deputy Vice President for Europe, Asia, Pacific and Latin America in the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) on the sidelines of the WB/IMF Annual Meeting

title: Welgama and Mahindananda removed from SLFP Organiser posts
content: UPFA MPs Kumara Welgama and Mahindananda Aluthgamage have been removed from their respective organiser posts by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).

title: Taiwanese officials arrive in Sri Lanka to assist in money transfer probe
content: A Taiwanese bank official and two investigators arrived last night (11), to assist in the Taiwan money transfer probe.

title: Lightning strike leaves train commuters stranded
content: The sudden train strike last evening resulted in a tense situation at the Colombo Fort and Maradana Railway stations. All trains starting from Colombo Fort and Maradana, were cancelled due to trade union action staged by the engine drivers and railway guards yesterday.

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends down on dollar demand from oil importers
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended weaker on Wednesday as banks bought dollars on behalf of state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corp, which stocked up crude ahead of an expected fuel price hike, dealers said.

title: Malik, Kabir insist no bonds discussed at Treasury meeting
content: Ministers Kabir Hashim and Malik Samarawickrama, testifying before the Presidential Commission of Inquiry probing the bond scams, yesterday said that to make payments to the contractors engaged in road development projects and to continue with the ongoing projects the government had needed funds to the tune of Rs.15 billion.

title: Treasury Bonds Auction Probe Summon Ranil for questioning Mahendran
content: Former Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Arjuna Mahendran told the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) probing the Treasury Bonds fraud, yesterday (10)…

title: CERT|CC cautions Viber, WhatsApp, IMO users
content: The Computer Emergency Readiness Team (CERT|CC) said yesterday it had received several complaints from mobile phone users claiming that their phone numbers had used to create fake smartphone messaging applications.

title: Ranil meets Finnish PM : Finland, Lanka to strengthen ties in energy sector
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Finland’s Prime Minister Juha Sipilä agreed that a concrete pilot project would be initiated in the field of wave energy in Sri Lanka.

title: Namal, DV Chanaka, Ranaweera and 3 others arrested
content: MPs Namal Rajapaksa, DV Chanaka, Prasanna Ranaweera and 3 others arrested by Hambantota Police over the protest held in Hambantota on Friday, the Police spokesman said.

title: Colombo shanty free by 2023 – Minister Ranawaka
content: Colombo will be a shanty free city by 2023, said the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development Patali Champika Ranawaka.

title: Directress of Namal’s company arrested at BIA
content: Iresha de Silva, a directress of Gowers Corporate Services which is allegedly owned by MP Namal Rajapaksa, has been arrested on arrival at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning.

title: Sri Lanka arrests two over hacking of Taiwan bank accounts
content: Two people have been arrested in Sri Lanka for suspected money laundering from a Taiwanese bank whose computer system was hacked to enable illicit transactions abroad, police said on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 10 Tamil Nadu fishermen
content: Sri Lankan Navy arrested Puthucheri state Karaikal -based ten Indian fishermen and seized one trawler for poaching in Sri Lankan territorial waters on Saturday night.

title: HRC probes assault on journalist in custody
content: The Human Rights Commission has launched an inquiry into a senior police officer assaulting a journalist taken into custody while he was covering the protest at Hambantota on Friday.

title: SPECIAL CID PROBE INTO CYBER BANK HEIST
content: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched a special investigation relating to a cyber heist where hackers illegally transferred USD 1.1 million from a leading bank in Taiwan to two bank accounts in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lankan rupee rises on inward remittances
content: The Sri Lankan rupee closed firmer on Friday due to heavy inward remittances and as a bank sold dollars for a stock-related transaction, dealers said.

title: TNA genuinely involved in forming new constitution – Sampanthan
content: The Tamil National Alliance(TNA) is genuinely involved in the processes of forming a new Constitution, said Opposition Leader and leader of TNA R. Sampanthan.

title: All Agri Tech Equipment Tax Free
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says in order to make the National Food Production drive a success, the Government will remove all the taxes on imported Agricultural Technological Equipment.

title: Bond scam probe: Political interference and public-private sector complicity frightening – Dew
content: One-time Chairman of the Committee on Public Enterprises (CoPE) Dew Gunasekera yesterday declined to comment on state banks, Bank of Ceylon, the People’s Bank and the National Savings Bank receiving instructions twice in 2016 to make bids at the treasury bond auctions at lower interest (yield) rates as that particular matter hadn’t been investigated by his committee.

title: Basil takes a bold step
content: The famous slogan put forward by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa during his Presidential campaign trail in the North was “known devil is better than unknown angel”.

title: ‘National Food Production Battle’ begins today
content: The National Food Production Battle implemented under the guidance of President Maithripala Sirisena, will commence today (6th Oct.)

title: No fuel price hike, says Arjuna
content: Petroleum Resources Development Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said that the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) will not increase fuel prices despite continuous requests by the Lanka Indian Oil Company (LIOC) for both parties to increase the price of petrol and diesel prices evenly.

title: Malinga left out of Sri Lanka squad for Pakistan ODIs
content: Sri Lanka has dropped Lasith Malinga from the one-day international squad to face Pakistan in a five-match series starting next week, raising doubts if the fast bowler will feature in the team’s plans for the 2019 World Cup.

title: Misuse of State property Many vehicles not returned
content: More than 32 vehicles used by former Chief Ministers and MPs of North Central, Sabaragamuwa and Eastern Provincial Councils have not been handed over to the councils yet, Executive Director of Campaign for Free and Fair Elections (CaFFE), Rajith Keerthi Tennakoon said yesterday.

title: People’s Bank, BoC, NSB heads reveal: Ravi asked state banks to bid at lower interest rates
content: Chairmen and senior officials of three major state banks––the Bank of Ceylon, the People’s Bank and the National Savings Bank–– testifying before the presidential commission of inquiry probing the bond scams yesterday said that on two occasions in 2016, the then Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake had instructed them to make bids at the treasury bond auctions at lower interest (yield) rates

title: Exclusive: Sri Lanka rejects Chinese request for local fuel sales
content: Sri Lanka has blocked a proposal by Chinese firms bidding to build the island’s biggest oil refinery to sell fuel locally, fearing a threat to domestic firms that dominate the small but growing market.

title: US 2019 Diversity Visa Lottery opens for Sri Lankans
content: The US Embassy in Colombo announced the start of the 2019 Diversity Visa Lottery Program, also known as the “Green Card” Lottery.

title: Local and International community lauds govt actions to protect Rohingya refugees
content: Minister of Ports and Shipping Mahinda Samarasinghe stated that the government has been praised by local and international bodies for the manner in which it responded to the mistreatment of the Rohingya refugees by radical groups in the nation.

title: Alleged misappropriation of Rs. 21 million of Brian Shaddick
content: The indictments filed against Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) leader MP Udaya Gammanpila and another accused for allegedly misappropriating Rs. 21 million following their alleged fraudulent share transaction that took place in 2000 were read out at the Colombo High Court yesterday.

title: President at Suraksha scheme launch : “Education a long term investment”
content: Suraksha, the launch of the health insurance scheme for students was seen as a historic occasion by President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday, as he hoped that it would help the 4.5 million school going children in the country.

title: Sri Lanka arrests Buddhist monk after protest against Rohingya Muslims
content: A Sri Lankan court remanded a Buddhist monk in custody on Monday after charging him with leading hardline nationalists in a protest against 31 Rohingya Muslim asylum seekers last week, forcing the refugees to flee a U.N. safe house, police said.

title: New Constitution will not dilute country’s unitary status: PM
content: The proposed new Constitution will not dilute the unitary status of Sri Lanka in any way. It will seek maximum devolution of power under a unitary state, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Docs threaten all-out strike if solution favours SAITM
content: The Secretary of the GMOA Dr Haritha Aluthge said that his organisation would go for a countrywide indefinite strike if the government tried to legalise SAITM.

title: PM’s World Children’s and Elders’ Day message
content: Children whose future lies in the world of tomorrow and the elderly who are spending the evening of their lives today, are the focus of the UN Day for Children & Elders.

title: President’s World Children’s and Elders’ Day messages
content: World Elders’ Day message: Elders are the most experienced senior community of a country. They are the persons who bestow their years of experience, knowledge and good sense to the contemporary generations, stated President Maithripala Sirisena sending a message to mark World Elders’ Day.

title: LIOC says fuel price hike in the offing
content: Due to mounting losses in the backdrop of a surge in international fuel prices, Lanka IOC said an increase in the prices of petrol and diesel is on the cards.

title: Army to stay in North & East – Commander Shuns claim by Wigneswaran
content: Army Commander Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake said that expediting the removal of Army Camps in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, is not suitable under the present circumstances.

title: IMF UPBEAT ON SRI LANKA’S ECONOMIC OUTLOOK
content: Sri Lanka was given a positive outlook to its economic reform program by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka imposes tougher visa sanctions on North Koreans
content: Sri Lanka recently imposed enhanced visa restrictions for North Koreans entering the country in compliance with the U.N. Security Council’s sanctions against North Korea’s nuclear and missile development.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism earnings pass 2 billion USD in 2017
content: Sri Lanka has earned over 2 billion U.S. dollars from tourism this year with steady growth in numbers, the country’s Central Bank said here on Thursday.

title: IGP should be directed to arrest cops who turned a blind eye – Senaratne
content: Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday that the government should direct the Inspector General of Police to arrest the policemen who had turned a blind eye when some Buddhist monks surrounded and attacked a UNHRC safe house in Mount Lavinia, sheltering some Rohingya refugees from Myanmar, on Tuesday.

title: Will not allow room for corruption, fraud or irregularities in development process – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the assistance of the international community has been received for the development process of Sri Lanka as a result of the ensured political stability in the country, and emphasized that he will not allow any room to occur corruption, fraud or irregularities within the development process.

title: UNHCR alarmed at violence against Rohingyas in Sri Lanka
content: The United Nations on Wednesday raised concern for the safety of Rohingya Muslim asylum seekers in Sri Lanka after Buddhist monks and hardline nationalists forced them to flee a U.N. shelter in the capital Colombo.

title: Protesters force Rohingya refugees to flee Sri Lanka safe house
content: Sri Lankan monks and hardline nationalists protesters forced 31 Rohingya Muslim asylum seekers to flee a United Nations safe house in the capital Colombo on Tuesday, police said.

title: Detained Rohingya refugees transferred under Police protection
content: The group of 30 Rohingya refugees, who were detained at a house of UNHRC in Mount Lavinia, had been taken into the Police custody for their protection, Police Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekara said.

title: JVP does not pander to Rajapaksa: Anura Kumara
content: Whether we vote in favour of or against a Bill solely depends on the decision of the JVP Central Committee. The JVP is not pandering to Rajapaksa or any other party, JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: President directs imposition of 100% levy on big onion imports
content: President Maithripala Sirisena directed to the Finance Ministry to impose 100% levy on imported big onions.

title: Sri Lanka to take action to control coconut price
content: Sri Lanka will bring in a permanent price index to control the price of coconuts after several black marketeers have been caught selling coconuts at exorbitant rates, a local media report said Monday.

title: LP gas prices increased
content: The price of a domestic Litro gas cylinder (12.5kg) would be increased by Rs.110 with effect from midnight today, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) said.

title: Call to lift ban on movement of Rohingyas to Sri Lanka
