content: A day after Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe categorically stated that his government will not admit Rohingya refugees into the country, a pro-peace think tank, the National Peace Council of Sri Lanka appealed to the Sri Lankan government to lift the ban on the entry of Rohingya refugees

title: Sri Lanka says Chinese-funded port city project to attract $1 billion investment in next stage
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the country will attract $1 billion of investment after completion of the first site of a China-funded massive port city project, state media reported Sunday.

title: Police force to be modernised: PM
content: The Government will introduce new reforms to the Sri Lanka Police to make it more efficient and productive, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Sri Lanka’s reconciliation process is proceeded step by step – President to UN High Commissioner for Human Rights
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says Sri Lanka is performing for the betterment of its people with much responsibility, in keeping with the charters of UN, as a member of United Nations. He said the government is taking the process to ensure human rights and reconciliation forward step by step.

title: Korea grants $ 2.5 m to develop Ocean University
content: The Ocean University of Sri Lanka, the first ever state university for maritime and ocean sciences is going to be upgraded under the financial and technical assistance by the Republic of Korea.

title: Anti-corruption unit launches investigation in Sri Lanka
content: The International Cricket Council’s Anti-Corruption Unit has launched an investigation in Sri Lanka, world cricket’s governing body has said.

title: Sri Lanka in talks with two Chinese firms for $3 billion refinery
content: Sri Lanka is in talks with two Chinese companies about investing up to $3 billion to build in a new refinery at its Chinese-controlled port, a top government official said on Friday.

title: EU pledges Rs. 5.4 billion for rural development in two provinces
content: The European Union (EU) has pledged Rs. 5.4 billion (EUR 29.7 million) to reduce poverty in Uva and Central Provinces by improving both living conditions and food security.

title: Health Ministry takes steps to reduce prices of medicinal drugs
content: The Ministry of Health says the prices of expensive medical drugs will be reduced in the near future.

title: Weapons stored at Wasgamuwa National Park Office go missing
content: Five weapons including two repeater rifles and a t-56 weapon had been robbed from the wildlife officers’ armoury at Wasgamuwa National Park last night.

title: Second heart transplant abandoned
content: The second heart transplant planned at the Kandy General Hospital was abandoned at the last minute yesterday due to a tug-o-war between consultants not to remove the beneficiary’s heart. This situation has arisen even after the heart was harvested from the donor and fixed to a machine pending the transplant.

title: Sri Lanka to produce ornamental fish of high standard
content: The construction of the maiden fish breeding centre in Sri Lanka commenced recently at Sevanapitiya in Polonnaruwa.

title: Tax incentives mulled to make North attractive to investors
content: The government is now planning to provide tax incentives to prospective foreign direct investors and local investors to invest in the North that had been devastated by the three decade war, Deputy Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs Dr Harsha de Silva said.

title: LG and PC polls next year – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe informed Parliament yesterday that the Local Government elections would be held in January, while the Party leaders would take a decision on the fate of the Provincial Council polls.

title: Sri Lanka grab automatic 2019 World Cup berth at Windies’ expense
content: Sri Lanka have secured an automatic berth at the 2019 Cricket World Cup at the expense of West Indies after the two-times champions lost to England in the opener of their one-day series on Tuesday.

title: PTA was not used for past six months: Sagala
content: The Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will be replaced soon with a new counter terrorism law, Law and Order Minister Sagala Ratnayaka said in Parliament yesterday.

title: President urges world to support forward march of Sri Lanka towards reconciliation, restoration of democratic freedoms, human rights and rule of law
content: President Maithripala Sirisena called upon the international community to seriously consider the tremendous progress made by the government towards reconciliation, restoration of democratic freedoms

title: Data missing from Arjuna Mahendran’s mobile phones
content: A considerable amount of data has been missing from the two mobile phones handed over by former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran to the Presidential Commission of Inquiry, probing the controversial treasury bond scam.

title: Akila announces insurance cover for schoolchildren
content: The main objective of the Education Ministry is to ensure a better future for children to enable them lead a happy life with their feet firmly on the ground safeguarding ourness.

title: PM says OMP agreement has no retrospective effect
content: The agreement on looking for missing persons is effective for the future and not the past said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: ‘No reports of Rohingya Muslims fleeing to Sri Lanka’
content: There are no reports of Rohingya Muslims fleeing to Sri Lanka in the wake of a mass exodus taking place in Myanmar’s Rakhine state, Foreign Affairs State Minister Wasantha Senanayake said.

title: President to address UN General Assembly on September 19
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will leave for New York, US today (17th Sept.) to attend the 72nd General Assembly of the United Nations (UN).

title: Hirunika Writes To Rajitha On Prison Hospital Doctor
content: Parliamentarian Hirunika Premachandra has written to Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne calling for the transfer of the prison hospital doctor.

title: Sri Lanka Cricket appoint Graeme Labrooy as chief selector
content: Former pacer Graeme Labrooy has been appointed as the new chief selector of Sri Lanka, replacing Sanath Jayasuriya.

title: North Korea fires second ballistic missile over Japan
content: North Korea has fired a ballistic missile across Japan, its second such provocative move in weeks.

title: Disappointing to see present govt. also investing in Hambantota – Patali
content: Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, Patali Champika Ranawaka stated that although the Rajapaksa Government invested Rs. 900 billion to develop Hambantota, no economic benefit was reaped by it.

title: Financial Times journalist killed by crocodile during holiday in Sri Lanka
content: A Financial Times journalist has died after he was dragged underwater by a crocodile while on holiday in Sri Lanka.

title: CoI accepts Aloysius’ right not to give evidence
content: The owner of primary dealer, the Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL), Arjun Aloysius, has opted not to give evidence before the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (CoI), probing the alleged bond scams, involving the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and (PTL) in Feb 2015 and March 2016.

title: Sri Lanka: 2 Years On, Scant Progress on UN Resolution
content: United Nations member countries at the Human Rights Council in Geneva should press Sri Lanka to promptly meet the targets of the council’s October 2015 resolution for transitional justice, Human Rights Watch said today.

title: School fire kills 22 students in Kuala Lumpur
content: Twenty-five students and two wardens died when a blaze tore through a Malaysian religious school in what officials described as one of the country’s worst fire disasters for years.

title: Council set up to strengthen the national economy meets
content: The National Economic Council, appointed by President Maithripala Sirisena to take required decisions to strengthen the national economy held its first meeting yesterday (Sep. 12) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: ‘China will support Sri Lanka to be information, telecommunication hub in region’
content: Giving a further fillip to bilateral cooperation between China and Sri Lanka, the Chinese government is planning to support Sri Lanka to be the information and telecommunication hub in the region.

title: Sri Lanka’s PM makes fresh call for foreign investments
content: Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Tuesday made a fresh call on foreign investors to consider investing in Sri Lanka as the island country aims to become a hub in the Indian Ocean region.

title: Deputy Minister Arundika Fernando removed
content: Deputy Minister of Tourism Promotion and Christian Affairs Arundika Fernando removed from his post by President Maithripala Sirisena with effect from today.

title: Sri Lanka to cultivate neglected lands to produce more food
content: Sri Lanka’s President Maithripala Sirisena said on Monday that all neglected private and state lands across the country would be cultivated in order to produce more food.

title: Aravinda de Silva to return as Sri Lanka cricket team advisor post India trashing?
content: Colombo: Aravinda de Silva could soon take up an advisory role with the Sri Lankan cricket team, as Sri Lanka Cricket is mulling over his name.

title: Flexible working hours for Govt Offices in Battaramulla
content: The Ministry of Public Administration and Management has decided to initiate a pilot project introducing flexible working hours for the public sector currently serving in offices situated in the Battaramulla area.

title: Arjun Aloysius arrives at PCoI with PC Gamini Marapana
content: Former Perpetual Treasuries Director Arjun Aloysius arrived at the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) into the Treasury Bond issue for the fifth time with President’s Council (PC) Gamini Marapana a short while ago.

title: North Korea illegally exported commodities to countries including Sri Lanka
content: North Korea illegally exported coal, iron and other commodities worth at least $270 million to China and other countries including India, Malaysia and Sri Lanka in the six-month period ending in early August in violation of UN sanctions, UN experts say.

title: No decision to hand over expressways to Private Sector: Kiriella
content: Responding to concerns raised by various entities, Higher Education and Highways Minister Lakshman Kiriella said the government has not taken any decision to handover the running of Expressways to private entities.

title: President donates Myanmar gifted tusker elephant to Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic
content: President Maithripala Sirisena offered a Tusker elephant named Pulatisi Raja, to the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalanda Maligawa) in Kandy, yesterday (08). Myanmar has donated this Tusker elephant to the President.

title: Budget 2018 on 9 November
content: Budget 2018 will be presented to Parliament on 9 November, Minister of Finance and Mass Media, Mangala Samaraweera said in Parliament yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka Navy ships Sayura and Sagara to participate in war games with India
content: Sri Lankan naval ships Sayura and Sagara entered Visakhapatnam harbour to participate in the fifth edition of SLINEX 2017, a bilateral naval exercise between India and Sri Lanka.

title: Sharjah family suicide: Sri Lanka Consulate steps in
content: Dubai: The Sri Lankan Consul-General Charitha Yattogoda said his office is extending help to the next of kin of the family who police said committed suicide in a hotel apartment in Sharjah last week.

title: Sri Lanka, Australia sign agreement to counter human trafficking
content: Sri Lanka and Australia have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) enabling a closer cooperation to counter human trafficking in the region, the Australian High Commission in Colombo said in a statement.

title: Lalith Weeratunga and Anusha Palpita found guilty in Sil Cloth distribution case
content: Former Secretary to the President Lalith Weeratunge and former Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) Director General Anusha Palpita were found guilty in the Sil Cloth distribution case by the Colombo High Court today.

title: Sri Lanka Cricket denies Thilanga has connections to gaming industry
content: Sri Lanka Cricket today issued a special statement refuting the news reports and rumours circulating via both mainstream and social media claiming that SLC President Thilanga Sumathipala is involved in the gaming industry.

title: Petronet to form JV with Japan, Sri Lanka firms for LNG plant
content: India’s biggest gas importer, Petronet LNG, will soon form a joint venture with Japanese and Sri Lankan companies to build a liquefied natural gas (LNG) terminal near Colombo, the Indian company said in a statement on Wednesday.

title: UNP marks 71st anniversary today
content: The 71st anniversary of United National Party (UNP) falls today. A religious ceremony to mark this occasion will be held today at Sirikotha under the patronage of party leader and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: JO plans No-Faith against SF
content: Member of Parliament Prasanna Ranatunga said, that the Joint Opposition plans to file a No-Confidence Motion against Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka.

title: 80 Indian fishermen released by Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka has released at least 80 Indian fishermen who had been caught poaching in the island nation’s waters, officials said Tuesday.

title: Journey of consensual government is a clear victory for the people – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says whatever said to the contrary, the journey of the consensual government during the past two and a half years is a clear victory for the people.

title: Decision on legalizing abortion will be made once proposal is submitted to cabinet – Rajitha
content: The Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, Dr. Rajitha Senaratne stated that the motion to legalize abortion on two more counts was merely a proposal at this stage.

title: If he made such statements during era of kings Fonseka would have been killed – Wimal
content: Minister Sarath Fonseka would have been killed in a gruesome manner, for his treacherous statement about former Army Commander Jagath Jayasuriya, if he lived in the time of the kings, National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa told the media yesterday.

title: President emphasizes that he will not allow anyone to do any harm to Jagath Jayasuriya or any war hero
content: President Maithripala Sirisena emphasized that he will not allow anyone in the world to do anything for Retd Major Gen. Jagath Jayasuriya or any of Sri Lanka’s military commanders or war heroes.

title: It was a lost opportunity with Ford reversal
content: Sri Lanka lost a great opportunity to ensure a smooth transition of the national cricket team when Graham Ford left, former skipper Kumar Sangakkara says.

title: India’s fullest support to President Sirisena’s government – Indian External Affairs Minister
content: Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj said that the government of President Maithripala Sirisena could always count on continues Indian support. She said this when she called on President Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence in Colombo yesterday (September 1).

title: Telecommunications levy removed from today
content: The 10% telecommunications levy imposed on data would be removed and the data capacity would be increased by 10 per cent from today.

title: Ranatunga-Sumathipala battle intensifies
content: Former World Cup winning national cricket captain and Petroleum Resources Development Minister Arjuna Ranatunga has stepped up pressure on President Maithripala Sirisena and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe to remove Sri Lanka Cricket chief Thilanga Sumathipala.

title: Sri Lanka emerging as transit hub for cocaine smugglers: officials
content: International cocaine smugglers are increasingly turning to Sri Lankan as a transit hub in Asia, authorities say, after they made a series of seizures of the drug, some smuggled in containers of sugar from Brazil.

title: National Economic Council to meet soon to strengthen national economy – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the National Economic Council which was appointed by him to make a comprehensive transformation in the agriculture and industrial sectors in the country, with the objective of strengthening of the national economy, will meet for the first time on the 12th of September.

title: Rathupaswela shooting: Brigadier Aruna Deshapriya, Sergeant released on bail
content: Sri Lanka Army Brigadier Aruna Deshapriya Gunawardena and the Staff Sergeant Sirisena who were alleged to have given orders to shoot the Rathupaswela protestors were released on bail by the Gampaha High Court today.

title: Rajitha defends decision to take money from President’s fund
content: Irate Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne defended his decision to take Rs. 10 million from the President’s fund for his medical treatment in Singapore stressing that he was not the “only one” to do so.

title: LTTE handbills distributed in Vavuniya
content: Security forces stationed in Vavuniya have reported that handbills penned by LTTE intelligence agencies were circulated among the people of Vavuniya last night (29).

title: President reviews drought relief activities
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has reviewed the progress of the programmes implemented by the Government to provide relief to the people affected by the drought prevailed in various parts of the country.

title: Selection Committee resigns
content: The entire National Cricket Selection Committee headed by Sanath Jayasuriya has tendered their resignations effective 7 September.

title: Post crowd violence in Pallekele, ICC seeks security assurance
content: ICC Match Referee Andy Pycroft has reportedly sought security assurance from the Sri Lankan cricket board for the remainder of the limited-overs series against India following boorish fan behaviour during the third ODI in Pallekele on Sunday.

title: Wimal renews corruption charges against new Justice Minister
content: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa, MP, has alleged that Foreign Employment Minister Thalatha Atukorale had been rewarded with justice portfolio, in spite of prevailing corruption charges against her.

title: President laid foundation stone for ‘Pandith Amaradeva Sangeetha Asapuwa’
content: The foundation stone laying ceremony of the ‘Pandith Amaradeva Sangeetha Asapuwa’ was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the premises of the Ape Gama, yesterday (28).

title: Avant Garde Chairman, Major General Palitha Fernando notified to appear before High Court
content: The Colombo High Court issued summons on Avant-Garde Maritime Services (Pvt) Ltd Chairman Nissanka Senadhipathi and Maj. Gen. Palitha Fernando ordering them to appear in court on September 19 for allegedly offering and accepting a bribe of Rs.35.5 million following the Avant-Garde floating armoury transaction.

title: Lack of Revenue CBSL prints Rs 11.3 Billion
content: Due to the Government’s lack of revenue, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), on Friday (25), printed Rs 11,336 million to help the former meet its monetary commitments, interpretation of Central Bank’s open market operations (OMO) showed.

title: Rajitha claims drug & tobacco lobbies conspiring against him
content: Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine Minister Dr Rajitha Senaratne yesterday said that pharmaceutical mafia and tobacco companies were behind the moves to oust him.

title: Proposal for foreign company to run expressways
content: The Government is considering a proposal to hand over the management and operation of existing and proposed expressways to an international company, Highways Minister Lakshman Kiriella said.

title: Will defeat no-faith motion against Rajitha: Ravi Karunanayake
content: Former Foreign Affairs Minister Ravi Karunanayake yesterday said they would defeat the no-confidence motion brought against Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne by the Joint Opposition MPs.

title: New Justice Minister & Buddha Sasana Minister sworn in
content: Ms Thalatha Atukorale has been appointed as the new Minister of Justice and Mr Gamini Jayawickrama Perera has been appointed as the new Minister of Buddha Sasana.

title: India survive Dananjaya brilliance to beat Sri Lanka
content: Akila Dananjaya’s career-best 6-54 was in vain as India beat Sri Lanka by three wickets in their second one-day international to go 2-0 up in the five-match series on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka likely to miss 2017 revenue goal on tax proposal delay
content: Sri Lanka is likely to miss its revenue target this year due to delays in implementing proposals set out in the 2017 budget, a top finance ministry official said on Thursday.

title: I’m ashamed to have been part of such a cabinet – Wijeyadasa
content: Former Minister of Justice and Buddha Sasana, Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe stated that he was ashamed that he had to be a part of a cabinet of ministers that was selling off the country’s treasures.

title: Corruption cases to be revisited by new Justice Minister, says Rajitha
content: Cases filed against bigwigs of the previous regime may be refiled under fresh charges with the appointment of the new Justice Minister, Cabinet Co-spokesperson Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday.

title: Sri Lankan justice minister sacked over criticism of Chinese port deal
content: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Wednesday sacked the justice minister over his criticism of a $1.1 billion deal, signed last month, to lease a port to a Chinese company, the cabinet spokesman said.

title: President approves removal of Wijeyadasa Rajapakse
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has approved the removal of Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa from his ministerial portfolios as per the request made by the United National Party (UNP).

title: Dialog trials 5G, a first in South Asia
content: Dialog Axiata demonstrated 5G (Generation) Technology for the first time in South Asia, paving the way for next generation wireless connectivity with speeds in excess of 35 Gbps (Gigabits Per Second) yesterday.

title: President donates Rs. 45 million to gold plate canopy of Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has given Rs. 45 million for gold plating the golden canopy of the historic Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic.

title: President to be consulted before final decision on Wijeyadasa
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has stated that a decision would be taken with regard to Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakse after discussing the matter with President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Pothas says too many cooks in cricket
content: After Sri Lanka suffered a humiliating nine wicket defeat at the hands of India in the opening ODI of the five match series, Interim Coach Nic Pothas shed some light into the current crisis of the national team when he said there are too many cooks involved within the set up.

title: IGP wants 75% of crimes solved Gives Police year end deadline
content: Inspector General of Police Pujith Jayasundara said that at least 75 per cent of the reported crimes and complaints should be solved by the end of this year.

title: 27 Indians overstaying in Sri Lanka arrested
content: At least 27 Indians, including five women, have been arrested for overstaying their tourist visas in Sri Lanka, immigration officials said on Sunday.

title: Proposal to take over Neville Fernando Hospital to be discussed in parliament
content: Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine Dr.Rajitha Senaratne stated that a detailed proposal on the government take-over of the Neville Fernando Hospital will be submitted as a Bill in parliament, after obtaining consent from the relevant signatories.

title: War crimes probe: Constitution won’t permit foreign judges, says FM Marapana
content: Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana, PC, yesterday said foreign judges couldn’t be accommodated in domestic judicial mechanisms in accordance with the Constitution.

title: Sri Lanka condemns terror attack in Barcelona
content: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Ministry on Friday strongly condemned a terrorist attack in Barcelona which killed at least 13 people and injured over 100 others.

title: China key to Sri Lanka’s economic progress: survey
content: In an islandwide poll conducted for a leading business magazine in Sri Lanka, 72 percent of the respondents believe that China is key to Sri Lanka’s economic progress, local media reported on Friday.

title: President lay foundation stone for waste-based electricity plant
content: The naming of the Karadiyana Waste Management Project as the Mihisaru Viyamana Resources Management Centre, to streamline the solid waste management in the Colombo district and laying the foundation stone for the project, which aimed at generating electricity from garbage in the Western province

title: Private hospital charges to be regulated says minister
content: The government is now in the process of regulating private hospital bills because most private hospital charges are exorbitant, Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine Dr Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: TRC Levy Removed, Duty on Vehicles Reduced
content: The Finance Ministry announced today that it would remove 10% TRC levy on Internet Services.

title: Mahinda is exacting a grand scheme of revenge – Mangala
content: Minister of Finance and Media Mangala Samaraweera stated that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is currently scheming to exact revenge on the general public who voted to oust him from power in 2015 through his attempts misrepresent acts of the current government.

title: UNP to mull no-faith motion against Wijeyadasa today
content: The Working Committee of the United National Party will meet this morning at Sirikotha and one of the items up for discussion is a Motion of No-Confidence against one of the party’s Cabinet Ministers, Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe.

title: Sri Lankan rupee ends steady as bank dollar sales offset demand
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended steady on Wednesday as dollar selling by banks in the latter part of the session offset the importer dollar demand, dealers said.

title: Arjuna Ranatunga renews calls to sack Thilanga Sumathipala
content: Minister Arjuna Ranatunga blamed Sri Lanka’s cricket board Tuesday for the squad’s crushing three-Test series whitewash on home soil against India.

title: Trials should be held on a day-to-day basis at a ‘Higher Court’: Rajitha
content: Trials should be held on a day-to-day hearing basis at a ‘Higher Court’ on the cases filed against top notch officials of the previous Rajapaksa regime, Minister Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: President instructs officials to complete proper waste management programme by December
content: President  Maithripala Sirisena instructed the officials to complete the implementation of proper waste management programme in the nine provinces of the country by December, in accordance with the Government policy of providing a permanent solution for the garbage disposal issue of the country by next year.

title: Shiranthi and Rohitha arrive at CID, FCID
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s wife Shiranthi Rjapaksa and their youngest son Rohitha Rajapaksa arrived at the CID and FCID respectively this morning to give statements over two separate ongoing investigations.

title: Worst ever defeat – Dinesh Chandimal
content: Sri Lanka skipper Dinesh Chandimal who has been playing for Sri Lanka since 2011 said that this is the worst series defeat ever he has been part of.

title: ICTA CEO and Managing Director steps down
content: The CEO and Managing Director of Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) Muhunthan Canagey resigned from his position yesterday.

title: Google adds voice recognition for Sinhala and Tamil
content: Google’s speech-to-text recognition has added another 21 languages including Sinhala and Tamil, the global internet giant announced today.

title: India To Sri Lanka: Forget China, We Want Your Empty Airport
content: An Indian company has emerged with a bold plan for taking over Sri Lanka’s struggling Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA). The proposal, which would see India pumping $205 million into the airport for a 70% share for 40 years, was approved by Sri Lanka’s Civil Aviation Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva and sent on to the country’s cabinet for review.

title: Special operations Room to gather crime information
content: The Police have opened a special 24 hour operations room with a hotline dedicated to gather information on any drug related or organised crimes at the STF headquarters.

title: Does China harbour strategic ambitions for Sri Lankan port?
content: Sri Lanka says it’s a way for it to help claw its way out of debt. China says it’s a strictly commercial deal for one of its state firms.

title: Sri Lanka in talks with China’s Alibaba to promote online sales of Ceylon Tea
content: Sri Lanka’s government is in talks with China’s e-commerce giant, Alibaba, to promote online sales of the country’s popular Ceylon tea, a local media reported Sunday.

title: Shootout at Kurana, two injured
content: A shootout took place in Kurana, Negombo between an underworld gang travelling in a Dolphin van and the STF in a jeep last evening. The incident took place near the Grandiza Hotel in Kurana.

title: Money printing up by Rs. 11 Billion Economy suffers double blow
content: The economy suffered a double blow on Friday (11 August), reflected by the Central Bank printing Rs 11 billion to help the Government to meet its obligations in the absence of adequate revenue…

title: TNA calls on US to ensure GoSL fulfils its Geneva commitments
content: The United States has been urged to ensure that Sri Lanka fully implemented the Geneva Resolution 30/1 co-sponsored by Colombo on Oct 1, 2015.

title: Projects to generate electricity from garbage commence
content: The construction work of the first two projects to generate electricity from garbage commenced under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena on 10th Aug. in Kerawalapitiya.

title: Wijedasa criticizing Cabinet decision is a serious issue – Harsha
content: Deputy Minister Dr Harsha de Silva says that the ‘Good Governance’ (yahapalana) government has established a new political culture and that the resignation of Ravi Karunanayake from his foreign minister post is something not witnessed before in the country.

title: PM says he has ushered in a new culture
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday said in parliament that the resignation of Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake signified a new political culture and he was proud of having ushered it in.

title: Ravi Karunanayake resigns as Foreign Minister
content: Delivering a lengthy statement in Parliament with regard to the allegations leveled against him, Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Ravi Karunanayake announced that he is resigning from his ministerial portfolio.

title: Cabinet approves minimum traffic fine of Rs. 25,000
content: The Cabinet granted the approval to increase the minimum fine for traffic offences to Rs. 25,000 today.

title: Ravi to quit shortly
content: Following a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday at the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Minister Karunanayake is likely to quit his portfolio shortly, according to sources.

title: Government policy is to bring foreign investment without harming the interests of Sri Lanka – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the policy of the present government is to bring foreign investment in a way which will not harm the country’s sovereignty.

title: All public institutions to be solar power plants
content: Minister of Power and Renewable Energy Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said that he has got the approval of the cabinet and the budget to establish solar panels on the roofs of all public institutions and thereby generate solar power.

title: Police to crack foreign links in ‘Ava’ gang
content: Police are now carrying out investigations to uncover possible foreign links to the criminal gang ‘Ava group,’ Police spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara said yesterday.

title: No faith in Govt.’s actions – Mahinda
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that no faith could be placed in the present government’s course of action.

title: Thilanga urges Ravi to resign
content: Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala yesterday said that Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake should resign immediately to save the honour of the government.

title: Hambantota Port agreement cuts debt burden: PM
content: Sri Lanka can enhance foreign reserves and relieve the debt burden following the new agreement on the Hambantota Port signed between the Ports Authority and China Merchants Port Holdings, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: Jaffna terror network moves to Colombo
content: Police have, with the help of information elicited from former LTTE cadres nabbed in the aftermath of recent attacks on police and security forces in the North, uncovered clues of a well-established terror network operating in Colombo.

title: China’s naval hospital ship makes first visit to Sri Lanka
content: The hospital ship of the Chinese Navy makes its first port visit to Sri Lanka from Aug 6 to Aug 10, Xinhua News Agency reported.

title: JO grilled over MR not signing no-faith motion against Ravi
content: Top Joint Opposition spokesman Bandula Gunawardena, MP, yesterday assured that former President and Kurunegala District MP Mahinda Rajapaksa would vote for a no-faith motion against Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake

title: GOVERNMENT HAS SELECTED WRONG CHINESE COMPANY!
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa,in a special interview with Ceylon Today Sunday Edition, alleged that the Unity Government has accepted the bid from China Merchant Port Holdings Ltd, been accepted in a backdrop where the other company China Harbour Co. Ltd…

title: Ravi denies pressure from President, PM to resign
content: Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake Saturday denied he was under pressure from President Maithripala Sirisena to resign following his testimony before the commission investigating the controversial bond auctions.

title: China pitches for better ties with Sri Lanka
content: China has donated equipment estimated at $293,000 to the Sri Lankan Parliament in a bid to further strengthen the ties between the two countries, a media report said.

title: All facilities for school teachers – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the government will provide all required facilities for school teachers to provide good education to the students.

title: MORAL DEGENERATES AND A RAVISHED ECONOMY
content: It’s a measure of the man’s temperate nature that he accepted the portfolio of Sports Minister although his academic and political track record would justify him being entrusted with tasks at a higher level in the Cabinet. In the 2010 General Election, he received 132,600 preference votes which was the highest received by any candidate in the Kurunegala District.

title: Sri Lanka rupee closes higher on exporter dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended firmer on Thursday, erasing early losses as the exporter greenback sales surpassed importer demand for the U.S. currency, while investors largely shrugged off a central bank monetary policy decision, dealers said.

title: No-Faith Motion against Ravi handed over
content: The Joint Opposition says a no-confidence motion against Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ravi Karunanayake, has been submitted.

title: Ravi denies knowledge of Penthouse deal
content: Foreign Minister and former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake yesterday vehemently denied any involvement in the leasing or the subsequent purchase of a penthouse at Monarch Residencies in Colombo 03.

title: Eastern terminal of Colombo Harbor will not hand over to any other party – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena emphasizes that the Eastern Terminal of the Colombo Port will not be handed over to any external party under any circumstance.

title: Sri Lankan held for entering Delhi’s IGI Airport on alleged fake ticket
content: A Sri Lankan national has been apprehended at the Delhi airport for entering a terminal allegedly using a fake ticket, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka invites more Chinese investors
content: Sri Lanka on Monday called on more Chinese investors to invest in the island country, saying that China had invested more than $52 million in the country in 2016 alone.

title: Aloysius’ forgotten Apple Password: Commission says use memory or deal with implications
content: Anuja Premaratne PC sought permission from the Commission to allow his client, Arjun Aloysius to purchase a sim card with the same mobile number which he has handed over to the digital forensic investigators attached to the Treasury Bond Commission.

title: Sri Lanka rupee rises on exporter dollar sales, inward remittances
content: The Sri Lankan rupee traded firmer on Monday as dollar inflows due to inward remittances and exporter greenback sales surpassed importer demand for the U.S. currency, dealers said.

title: UNP to support Ravi
content: If a No-Confidence Motion is brought against Minister of Foreign Affairs Ravi Karunanayake, without any concrete evidence, the United National Party (UNP) will defend him, UNP General Secretary Minister Kabir Hashim said yesterday.

title: If Ravi is a true gentleman, he should resign – Dayasiri
content: Minister of Sports, Dayasiri Jayasekara stated that Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake should ideally resign in light of the Central Bank’s bond scam allegations directed at him.

title: Sri Lanka condemns hostile acts by North Korea
content: The Government of Sri Lanka condemns the firing of a ballistic missile of intercontinental range by the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) on 28th July, and the series of recent similar hostile acts by DPRK in violation of UN Security Council Resolutions.

title: Sampanthan hopes Govt’s efforts would find a lasting solution to ethnic issue
content: Opposition Leader R. Sampanthan hopes the government’s efforts to rewrite the Constitution would find a permanent solution to the ethnic issue.

title: Sri Lanka signs $1.1 billion China port deal amid local, foreign concerns
content: Sri Lanka signed a long delayed $1.1 billion deal on Saturday to lease its southern Hambantota port to China ignoring an appeal by opposition parties to debate the pact in parliament.

title: Finance Minister promises wide ranging economic reforms
content: Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera yesterday promised wide ranging reforms to the economy in the wake of a positive report from the IMF on the country’s economic condition this month.

title: Hambantota Port agreement to be signed tomorrow – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that the Hambantota Port agreement will be signed tomorrow (29).

title: Arjuna didn’t say final was fixed, says Murali
content: Muttiah Muralidharan doesn’t wish to read much into Arjuna Ranatunga’s demand for a probe into Sri Lanka’s 2011 World Cup final loss to India at the Wankhede.

title: Power cut due to fuel shortages – Min. of Energy
content: The Ministry of Power and Energy addressed the frequent power cuts the country has been experiencing as of late.

title: Strike not acceptable – PM
content: The CPC trade union strike is not acceptable when a number of discussion rounds with unions had ended successfully, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in Parliament yesterday.

title: Bond scam probe: Mahendran hands over two mobile phones to CID; Ravi doesn’t turn up
content: Presidential Commission of Inquiry (CoI) yesterday ordered former Central Bank Governor Arjun Mahendran to immediately hand over his hand phones, tab computers and laptops used since January 1, 2015.

title: Ravi wants to live in Visumpaya; President says no
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has turned down three Cabinet papers submitted by Foreign Affairs Minister Ravi Karunanayake including the one seeking ‘Visumpaya’ (Acland House) Union Place, Colombo to be designated as his official residence, sources said.

title: Ravi should resign – Mahindananda Aluthgamage
content: Opposition MP, from the UPFA, Mahindananda Aluthgamage, in Parliament yesterday called for the resignation of Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ravi Karunanayake

title: Government asks petroleum workers to report for duties
content: The government asks the workers of Petroleum Corporation to report for duties to avoid the inconvenience faced by the people.

title: Sri Lankan cabinet approves agreement with China on Hambantota Port
content: Sri Lankan cabinet has approved agreement with China on Hambantota Port, describing it as “a win-win situation for both countries.”

title: Security Forces enter Petroleum Storage Facilities in Kolonnawa and Muthurajawela
content: Distributing and unloading fuel has been declared an Essential Service from midnight, tonight.

title: Petroleum trade unions go on strike; public subjected to distress
content: President of the Ceylon Petroleum General Services Union, Ashoka Ranwala stated that fuel distribution had been stalled island-wide as a result of the ongoing strike.

title: Dengue outbreak kills 300 in Sri Lanka, hospitals at limit
content: An outbreak of dengue virus has killed around 300 people so far this year in Sri Lanka and hospitals are stretched to capacity, health officials said on Monday.

title: Another GMOA strike today
content: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) yesterday decided to launch a token strike from 8 am today, GMOA Media Spokesman Dr. Samatha Ananda said.

title: Bond commission serves summons on former Finance Minister
content: The Presidential Commission probing alleged Central Bank bond scams in Feb. 2015 and March 2016 has summoned former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake, MP, to appear before it early this week.

title: Sri Lanka navy rescues two elephants washed out to sea
content: Two young elephants washed out to sea were saved from drowning on Sunday by the Sri Lankan navy in the second such incident off the island in as many weeks.

title: Sri Lankan president orders tighter security for judges following shooting incident
content: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Sunday instructed his police chief to ensure the security of all judges after a shooting incident on Saturday threatened the life of a high court judge in Jaffna, in northern Sri Lanka.

title: Police Sergeant dies in Jaffna shooting
content: A Police Sergeant attached to the security detail of Jaffna High Court Judge M. Ilanchezhiyan, who was undergoing treatment at the Jaffna General Hospital for gunshot injuries in yesterday’s shootout at Nallur, died early this morning, the Police said.

title: Top CB official linked to bond scam spirits away files at night
content: Serious doubts of a plot to destroy evidence of the Treasury bond scandal have arisen after a very senior official of the Central Bank was found removing a haul of files and documents from the bank recently.

title: New Sri Lanka tax bill aims to widen tax net, cut indirect taxes
content: Sri Lanka’s new tax bill, demanded by the IMF as a condition for a third tranche of aid disbursed this week, will seek to ensure that all citizens pay direct taxes and cut indirect taxes, top finance ministry officials said on Friday.

title: Present Government gave a proper meaning to free health service – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the present Government gave a proper meaning to the free health service by providing all the facilities in the health service free of charge.

title: Never easy playing Sri Lanka in their backyard: Kohli
content: Top-ranked India will not take Sri Lanka lightly despite the home team’s recent indifferent form as well as controversies over fitness and ethics, captain Virat Kohli said on Thursday.

title: UN chief congratulates government on setting up office of missing persons
