title: Sri Lankan rupee firmer after IMF loan
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended firmer on Monday as exporter dollar sales surpassed early greenback demand from importers on worries capital outflows would increase as incoming U.S. President Donald Trump’s policies were seen guiding U.S. rates higher and strengthening the dollar.

title: Hefty fines for six traffic violations
content: The fines for six traffic violations including drunk driving will be increased to Rs.25,000, Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva says.

title: UN Human Rights Committee orders Sri Lanka to compensate Canadian torture victim
content: A Toronto man who was imprisoned and tortured while visiting Sri Lanka must be compensated for the abuses he suffered, the United Nations Human Rights Committee has ruled.

title: Rajapaksa accuses government of media suppression
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday accused the government of suppressing the media at a time when the country’s attention was on the budget and constitutional reforms.

title: IMF sees stability in Sri Lanka’s macroeconomic, financial conditions
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Saturday said Sri Lanka’s macroeconomic and financial conditions have begun to stabilize and the island nation’s performance under its $1.5 billion loan programme is satisfactory.

title: We should face difficult tasks for the betterment of motherland – President
content: “What we have to do for the motherland is not the easy tasks but face the difficult tasks and win them”, says President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Ravi defends decision to give MPs vehicles
content: Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake yesterday denied allegations raised by opposition lawmaker and JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake in relation to obtaining 58 vehicles on operational leases, which is supposed to save the state money.

title: Sri Lanka says 32 ‘elite’ Muslims have joined Islamic State in Syria
content: Thirty-two Sri Lankan Muslims from “well-educated and elite” families have joined Islamic State in Syria, the justice minister told parliament on Friday, promising that the government would clamp down on extremists.

title: 1,275 Million allocated for Salawa victims
content: The government has allocated Rs 1,275 Million to pay compensation for people affected due to the Salawa Blast and already Rs 875 million has been paid.

title: Jaliya Wickramasuriya arrested by FCID
content: Former Sri Lankan Ambassador to the USA, Jaliya Wickramasuriya was arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigations Division (FCID) last night over a financial fraud, Police said.

title: JVP queries possible vehicle bribe to MPs supporting government
content: The JVP demanded to know yesterday why the state officials tasked with providing luxury vehicles to 58 MPs supporting the government should not be accused of fraud.

title: Sri Lanka’s Financial City to pave way for future economic growth, says expert
content: Sri Lanka’s plans for establishing a Colombo International Financial City will pave way for future economic growth and is a symbol of confidence, a leading European official said here Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka changes rules to encourage stock market listing
content: Sri Lanka’s Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) announced new measures on Thursday to encourage companies to list their shares on the Colombo Stock Exchange after earlier changes failed to raise market liquidity.

title: We should strengthen our country’s borders: PM
content: We should strengthen our country’s borders, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe said.

title: Sri Lankan official dodges UN questions over alleged torture – report
content: A United Nations committee that monitors acts of torture in member countries grilled an intelligence chief Wednesday over the alleged abuse of detainees during Sri Lanka’s bloody civil war

title: Sri Lanka awards oil products supply contracts to Reliance, Petrochina
content: Sri Lanka has awarded refined oil products term supply contracts to Singapore-based Petrochina International and India’s Reliance Industries Ltd, official government documents showed on Wednesday.

title: Gunmen kill police officer in Kurunegala
content: A Sub inspector was shot dead and two other policemen injured when a group of unidentified gunmen opened fire at a police vehicle at Maspotha in Kurunegala last night, police said.

title: No military backing for Aava: Ruwan
content: There is no military backing for the ‘Aava ‘ group in Jaffna, but investigations are on to find out whether those who left the Army have joined it, State Defence Minister Ruwan Wijewardena said in Parliament yesterday.

title: TN asks Centre to direct Sri Lanka to release fishing boats
content: Tamil Nadu Government has requested the Centre to ask the Sri Lankan government to release over 100 fishing boats, which are still in custody of the island nation.

title: Motorcyclists want Rs. 10,000 minimum fine for luxury vehicles
content: Luxury vehicles should be fined a minimum of Rs. 10,000 with different fines being imposed according to vehicle categories if the government is not prepared to change the rule proposed in the 2017 Budget, the Ceylon Motorcyclists’ Association (CMA) stated.

title: Sri Lanka beats Zimbabwe by 8 wickets in tri-series opener
content: Sri Lanka beat Zimbabwe by eight wickets in the first game of a triangular limited-overs series at Harare Sports Club on Monday.

title: LPBOA to hold talks with Finance Minister
content: Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association President Gemunu Wijeratne while vehemently opposing the minimum traffic fine increase up to Rs. 2500, however said the LPBOA will talk to the Finance Minister to iron out the issue.

title: Minimum traffic fine won’t be changed: Ravi
content: Responding to a demand  made by private bus operators to abolish the proposed minimum traffic fine of 2,500 rupees, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said that the proposal was made to save the lives of motorists as well as pedestrians and that the decision won’t be changed.

title: Water-tariff up by 30%
content: The tariff on water will increase by a minimum of 30%, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) said today.

title: China important partner in Sri Lanka’s economic development – FM
content: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera on Friday said India realised the dangers of bottom-trawling, but the two countries should work out a win-win situation for poor fishermen on both sides of the Palk Bay.

title: PM promises to sack cops if found guilty of attacking disabled war heroes
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told Parliament yesterday that if any policemen were found guilty of attacking disabled servicemen near the Presidential Secretariat last week they would be sacked from the service.

title: Gemunu warns of bus strike against hike in traffic fines
content: Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) Chairman, Gemunu Wijeratne, says that the government should immediately withdraw the proposal to increase the minimum fine for traffic offences to Rs 2,500.

title: Donald Trump had acted in a Sri Lankan film
content: America’s President-elect Donald Trump had acted in a film co-produced by the veteran Sri Lankan film-maker Chandran Rutnam along with Bo Derek.

title: Government calls it progressive budget
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake yesterday presented what the government called a progressive budget

title: Five shot in downtown Seattle near scene of anti-Trump protests
content: A gunman opened fire in downtown Seattle on Wednesday evening following an argument and wounded five people, one man critically, not far from protests against the surprise victory of Republican Donald Trump in the U.S. presidential election.

title: President congratulates US President-Elect Donald Trump
content: “The Government and the people of Sri Lanka join me in congratulating you on your victory”, said President Maithripala Sirisena sending a congratulatory message to the President-elect of the US, Mr. Donald Trump.

title: Donald Trump elected president of the United States
content: Republican Donald Trump has defeated his Democratic rival Hillary Clinton in the US election, according to ABC election analyst Antony Green, and will become America’s next president.

title: Budget 2017 will benefit all: Finance Minister
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake will present the third budget of the national unity government in Parliament tomorrow.

title: Sri Lanka records strong growth in tourist arrivals from China, India
content: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka rose by 13.7 percent in October year-on-year with Indian and Chinese markets recording a commendable growth, statistics from the Tourism Department showed on Tuesday.

title: China defends Lanka envoy’s comments over Chinese loans
content: China today defended comments by its ambassador to Sri Lanka over criticism against high interest rates charged on Chinese loans to the country

title: Sri Lanka central bank considers new bond tender system to stabilise long term rates
content: Sri Lanka’s central bank is working with the IMF and the World Bank to introduce a new system for selling bonds to bring down sharply higher interest rates in long-term government securities, Deputy Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe told Reuters on Tuesday.

title: Pension benefits to differently abled prematurely retired War Heroes under direction of President
content: It has been decided to provide pension benefits to the differently abled War Heroes who volunteered to retire before completing their 12-year mandatory service period with retirement compensation

title: India, Sri Lanka need to implement large developmental projects: President Mukherjee
content: India and Sri Lanka need to expeditiously implement some of the large developmental projects that have been under discussion on the ground, India’s President Pranab Mukherjee has said.

title: Appeals Court orders release of Tiran Alles
content: The Court of Appeal suspends the remand order on former MP Tiran Alles issued by Colombo High Court and orders to release him, reporter said.

title: Sri Lankan rupee rises as exporters, banks sell dollars
content: The Sri Lankan rupee traded firmer on Monday as dollar selling by exporters and banks outpaced demand for the greenback from importers, dealers said.

title: Magistrate refuses to issue stay order on disabled soldiers protest
content: Colombo Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today refused to issue a stay order request by the Police prohibiting the protest march organized by the disabled soldiers opposite the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Disciplinary action against cancer specialists of Apeksha Hospital
content: Health Minister Rajitha Senarathne has instructed Health Secretary Anura Jayawickreme to commence an investigation regarding the doctors of Apeksha Cancer hospital, Maharagama

title: Summons to China’s envoy: Government displeased over his remarks
content: Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera will summon China’s Ambassador Xi Xiangliang to lodge the Government’s ‘deep displeasure’ over his remarks at a news conference to a handpicked group of journalists this week.

title: Sri Lankan gets 10 years jail for peddling drugs
content: A special city court has sentenced a 23-year-old Sri Lankan to 10 years RI under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act for trying to smuggle 2kg heroin from the Chennai international airport in 2010.

title: Tamil group to break over 1000 coconuts to bless Hillary
content: A group of Sri Lankan Tamils in Jaffna will break over 1,000 coconuts and light as many candles to bless Hillary Clinton, saying the Democratic presidential candidate’s win would be important for the future of the minority community.

title: Bond scams: MR holds entire government responsible
content: Former President and Kurunegala District MP Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that the ruling UNP-SLFP coalition leaders including President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe should take the responsibility for Central Bank bond scams.

title: ‘Army has nothing to do with AAVA Group’
content: Northern Province Governor Reginald Cooray yesterday refuted claims that the Army was behind the AAVA Group in the North.

title: No reason to create ‘Aava’: Gotabaya
content: Former defence secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa said yesterday that there was no reason for the Army or Military Intelligence to create a gang like ‘Aava’

title: Sri Lankan rupee recoups early losses to end steady
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended steady on Thursday as dollar selling by exporters late in the day erased losses due to demand for the greenback from importers earlier, dealers said.

title: Pandit Amaradeva passes away
content: Veteran singer and musician Pandith W. D. Amaradewa, who was admitted to the Sri Jayawardanapura Hospital this morning following a heart attack, passed away a short while ago, the hospital sources confirmed.

title: Amaradewa hospitalised
content: Pandith W. D. Amaradewa was admitted to the Sri Jayawardanapura Hospital this morning following a heart attack, hospital sources said.

title: Cabinet will stand by PM on Central Bank bond issue
content: Cabinet this week took the unanimous decision to stand by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe against allegations that he too was involved in the Central Bank bond scam, said Co-cabinet spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senaratne.

title: ‘Our Sri Lanka Freedom Front’ changes name; GL named Chairman
content: The political party registered as “Our Sri Lanka Freedom Front” (Ape Sri Lanka Nidahas Peramuna), with the symbol of a budding flower, has reportedly changed its name to “Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna,” according to sources.

title: Chinese envoy says Sri Lanka is ‘unfair’ to term Chinese loans as expensive
content: China’s Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Yi Xianliang, on Tuesday, said it was unfair for Sri Lanka to term loans given by China’s EXIM Bank as ‘expensive’ and questioned the government as to why it had sought fresh loans from China if the interest rates were ‘too high’.

title: Pension benefits for prematurely retired War Heroes
content: Steps are being taken to provide pension benefits on the directives of President Maithripala Sirisena to the disabled War Heroes who volunteered to retire before the due retirement day owing to medical reasons.

title: Sri Lanka central bank chief expects rupee to stabilise once port sale completed
content: The Sri Lankan central bank governor said on Tuesday he expected the rupee to stabilise when the $1 billion sale of a stake in the southern port of Hambantota to a Chinese investor was completed in four to five months.

title: Classified garbage collection programme inaugurated at President’s Official Residence
content: The inauguration of the classified garbage collection programme was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence, today (Nov.01).

title: All cigarette brands increased by a minimum of Rs. 5 each
content: All cigarette brands has been increased by a minimum of Rs. 5 each. (Approx 15%) from today, the Ceylon Tobacco Company announced.

title: Jaffna University students to meet President today
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will meet with Jaffna University students today over the incident in which two university students were allegedly shot at by the police for not complying an order to stop their motorbike.

title: PHU demands RW’s resignation over CB Bond scam
content: The Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) today demanded the resignation of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe over the Central Bank (CB) Bond sale scam.

title: Government will bring a People’s Budget with many surprises beneficial to all – Finance Minister
content: The forthcoming budget that will be presented on Nov 10 will really be a people’s budget as it would incorporate ideas proposed by the people from all corners of the country.

title: Only segregated garbage from November 1
content: All the Municipal Councils have decided to collect only segregated garbage from November 1, according to a concept of Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Faiszer Musthapha.

title: Perpetual Treasuries on buying spree with its billions
content: Perpetual Treasuries, the controversial primary dealer at the centre of the Central Bank bond scam, is on a buying spree.

title: Cigarette makers accused of shady game
content: Minister of Health, Rajitha Senaratne said that with the approval of 15 per cent VAT, the price of a cigarette is expected to rise to Rs. 55. This has been subject to public debate.

title: Sri Lanka to sell 80 percent of southern Hambantota port to Chinese firm
content: Sri Lanka will sell to a Chinese company 80 percent of a $1.5-billion port in its south, where China has also been offered an investment zone, in a bid to cut the country’s debt burden, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: Mahendran responsible for CB Bond scam: COPE report
content: Former Central Bank Governor Arjun Mahendran was held responsible for the controversial Central Bank Bond sale scam in the COPE report presented in Parliament a short while ago,

title: War heroes will even be looked after retirement: President
content: Measures would be taken to rectify without delay the salary anomalies of war heroes who became differently abled during the war against terrorism, President Maithripala Sirisena promised yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka eyes incentives, lower taxes to boost investment
content: Sri Lanka will introduce concessions on investments and a lower tax regime in its next budget to boost faltering investment, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told the parliament on Thursday.

title: Jaffna incident offenders would be punished after the offence proved – Minister Sagala
content: The unfortunate incident that occurred recently in Jaffna killing two university students riding a motorbike is an issue that harms the present reconciliation initiativeand the offenders would be charged after the investigations are finished

title: Coalition Against Coal hails move to cancel Sampur
content: The Coalition Against Coal is thanking the government for deciding to cancel the proposed Coal Power plant that was to be set up in Sampur.

title: VAT passed
content: The Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill was passed in Parliament yesterday with a majority of 66 votes.

title: Wigneswaran appeals for calm as North observes hartal over killing of students
content: The Chief Minister of the Northern Province, C.V.Wigneswaran, has appealed to the people of the province, especially the youth, to be calm as they mourn the killing of two university students by the police.

title: COPE chairman to reveal harassment at the hands of UNP members
content: Chairman of the Parliament watchdog committee (COPE), Sunil Handunnetti told Parliament yesterday that he would reveal to the House the harassment he underwent at the hands of UNP members who caused him to walk out of Monday’s meeting.

title: No language-based conflict should take place in the country – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says any conflict should not take place in the country based on the languages spoken by the different communities.

title: FR against vandalising Buddha status re-fixed for support
content: A Fundamental Rights petition filed seeking an Interim Order directing the Law and Order Minister to take action to investigate the incidents of vandalising Buddha statues in the Northern Province

title: UN adapting and refocusing its work in Sri Lanka
content: The United Nations on Monday said it is adapting and refocusing its work in Sri Lanka with evolving global and national development priorities.

title: Handunnetti walks out of COPE meeting
content: COPE (Committee on Public Enterprises) Chairman MP Sunil Handunnetti has left the committee meeting held in Parliament a short while ago on Monday.

title: Terrestrial broadcasting license of CSN Channel cancelled
content: Terrestrial broadcasting license of CSN Channel  has been cancelled due to violation of conditions, the Secretary Ministry of Media says.

title: New Constitution needed since the war has ended – PM
content: The war, which prevailed for the past 30 years in the country has now been finished and the country needs a new Constitution, said Prime Minster Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Sarath Kumara Gunaratne arrested
content: Former Fisheries Deputy Minister Sarath Kumara Gunaratne had been arrested after he surrendered to the Negombo Police Station over an accident in which an individual was killed in 2002.

title: Two police officers attacked by biker gang in Jaffna
content: Two policemen were attacked with swords in broad daylight in Jaffna yesterday.

title: Four dead, 2 injured in shooting at Mattakkuliya
content: Four people were killed and two were critically injured after a group of unidentified men shot at them in Mattakkuliya area a short while ago.

title: Buddhism’s position in Lanka won’t change: President Sirisena
content: The foremost place accorded to Sri Lanka’s majority religion of Buddhism will be preserved in its new Constitution, President Maithripala Sirisena has said.

title: I am a tough administrator – Dilrukshi
content: President Maithripala Sirisena publicly warned that he would take action against the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) as well as the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for ‘pursuing a political agenda’ at a function held on 12 October in Colombo.

title: 2 Tamil students of Jaffna varsity shot dead by Lankan police
content: Two Tamil students were on Friday gunned down by police in Sri Lanka’s Tamil-dominated former war-zone Northern Province’s Jaffna city, prompting authorities to arrest and suspend five policemen.

title: COPE report holds Mahendran responsible
content: Parliamentary watchdog committee, COPE (Committee on Public Enterprises), yesterday approved its Chairman’s report holding former Central Bank governor Arjuna Mahendran responsible for Treasury bond scandals.

title: Gazette to reduce prices of 48 drugs signed
content: The Gazette notification to reduce the prices of 48 varieties of essential pharmaceutical drugs has been signed by the Minister of Health Dr Rajitha Senaratne.

title: United Nations Urges Sri Lanka To Reduce Army’s Grasp
content: A UN rights expert reiterated calls for Sri Lanka to step up reconciliation efforts and reduce the military’s presence in former war zones seven years after the end of fighting.

title: New initiative to make the country self-sufficient in sugar manufacture – Finance Minister
content: Having targeted to make Sri Lanka self-sufficient in sugar manufacture, plans are afoot to increase sugarcane cultivation and set up of 15 new manufacturing plants in the country.

title: Sri Lanka will regain GSP plus: Prime Minister
content: Sri Lanka will regain the GSP plus facility by early next year without a doubt, as the European Union authorities are ready to grant the facility by about that time, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday.

title: India offers solar plant in Trincomalee
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi brought up the matter in his recent meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena in Goa, on the sidelines of the BRICS summit, highly-placed Indian government sources said.

title: Hidden hand in country’s governance: Gammanpila
content: Referring to the recent remarks by President Maithripala Sirisena about the FCID, CID and the Bribery Commission, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) leader Udaya Gammanpila noted that this indicates there was a hidden hand involved in the governance of the country.

title: As a govt. we fulfill the responsibilities hitherto neglected by others – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said although former leaders say that the government had not done anything in the past 2 years, as a government what we fulfill today are the responsibilities neglected by the former leader.

title: Tissa Attanayake remanded for forging documents
content: The Colombo High Court today remanded former United National Party Secretary, Tissa Attanayake until December 5.

title: Political hand behind Dilrukshi’s resignation: JHU
content: The Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) said there may be a political hand behind the resignation of the Director-General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery Or Corruption (CIABOC) Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe.

title: Sri Lanka’s state run airlines imposes total ban on “Samsung Galaxy Note 7”
content: Sri Lanka’s state run airline carrier, Sri Lankan Airlines and and budget airline Mihin Lanka, on Tuesday said that it had banned the use and carriage of ‘Samsung Galaxy Note 7’ phones on its aircraft.

title: Sri Lanka hopes to obtain EU GSP Plus this year
content: Sri Lanka has said it hopes to obtain the GSP Plus trade concession from the European Union (EU) by the end of this year following successful discussions held in Brussels.

title: Putin assures fullest support to Sri Lanka
content: President of Russia Vladimir Putin, expressing his appreciation over the transformation in Sri Lanka assured that he will provide every required support to Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka imposes daily power cuts after Chinese plant fails
content: Sri Lanka will turn off electricity across the country for one-and-a-half hours daily with effect from Monday, the state-run power firm said

title: FCID arrests Thirukumar Nadesan
content: Businessman Thirukumar Nadesan has been arrested by the police Financial Crimes investigations Division (FCID) today.

title: Bribery DG resigns
content: Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption Dilrukshi Dias Wickramsinghe had tendered her resignation to President Maithripala Sirisena today.

title: China, Sri Lanka vow to deepen cooperation within Belt and Road framework
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Sunday, vowing to deepen bilateral pragmatic cooperation within the Belt and Road framework.

title: Ministry announces decision to impose day and night power cuts
content: The Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy states that power cuts for a period of three and a half hours daily will be imposed owing to the ongoing power crisis.

title: President holds bilateral discussions with Indian Premier
content: President Maithripala Sirisena who is in India to participate BRICS Outreach Summit held bilateral discussion with the Indian Premier Narendra Modi at the Taj Exotica Hotel in Goa yesterday (Oct. 16).

title: Public urged to use electricity sparingly
content: Public has been urged to use electricity sparingly and possible power cuts in the future due to tripping at the Norochcholai coal power plant, the Ceylon Electricity Board says.

title: Algeria’s Richest Man Issad Rebrab To Construct $150 Million Sugar Refinery In Sri Lanka
content: Algerian billionaire Issad Rebrab plans to invest more than $150 million in the construction of a sugar refinery in the Southern Province of Sri Lanka according to the Daily News.

title: President to leave for India to attend BRICS Outreach Summit
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will leave for India tomorrow (Oct. 15) to attend the BRICS Outreach Summit to be held in Goa, India from 15th to 16th October.

title: PM leaves for Belgium to bring GSP Plus back
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will leave for Brussels, Belgium tomorrow(16th Oct.) for high level discussions with EU to obtain the GSP Plus relief back to Sri Lanka.

title: Retired army officer claims he killed Lasantha in suicide note
content: A retired army officer has committed suicide by hanging himself at his resident in Karandupana, Kegalle.

title: Court orders auctioning of Malwana land after Basil denies ownership
content: The disputed land in Malwana which was said to have been owned by former Minister Basil Rajapaksa will be put up for auction.

title: President or Government can take action if unhappy with FCID
content: While declining to comment on the views expressed by President Maithripala Sirisena on the FCID at a function held at the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute on Wednesday

title: Moragahakanda Kalu Ganga Multi purpose Development Project will be vested with public in 2018 – President
content: The Moragahakanda Kalu Ganga Multi- purpose Development Project will be vested with the public by the year 2018

title: UN appoints Antonio Guterres as new secretary general
content: The UN General Assembly on Thursday formally appointed Antonio Guterres as the new secretary general of the United Nations, replacing Ban Ki-moon.

title: Sri Lankan Judge sworn in as Supreme Court Judge in Fiji
content: A former Sri Lankan Supreme Court judge has been sworn-in as a new Supreme Court judge in Suva.

title: Jayaram Jayalalitha: Ailing India chief minister gives up powers
content: The ailing chief minister of India’s southern Tamil Nadu state has handed over all her responsibilities to her deputy, the state governor has said.

title: Focus on present, not dwell on past- Special UN Rapporteur
content: More focus should be placed on the current situation, with regard to human rights and minority issues, rather than dwelling on the past, the Special Rapporteur on Minority Issues of the United Nations Human Rights Council Rita Izsák-Ndiaye has said.

title: Sugar tender allegations unfound – Secretary
content: Recent allegations on certain sugar and ethanol sales by Lanka Sugar Company are unfound as due procedures have been followed, said the Secretary to the Ministry of Industry and Commerce T.M.K.B. Tennakoon.

title: Garbage dump fire blankets Badulla with methane gas
content: The Badulla area was blanketed by methane gas owing to a fire that erupted in a garbage dump a couple of days ago. A fire erupted in close proximity to a garbage recycling unit carried out by the Badulla Municipal Council.

title: Rita Izsak-Ndiaye to visit former conflict areas
content: The U.N.’s expert on minority rights arrived in Sri Lanka on Monday on a ten-day visit to examine conditions on the island nation in the aftermath of its bloody decades-long civil war.

title: Chillie arrested for assaulting elderly man
content: Singer Chillie also known as Thilanka Vidusha was arrested by the Thalangama Police today for the alleged assault of a 57-year-old man last Thursday.

title: Rs.46 billion loan from Japan to Sri Lanka
content: Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has taken steps to grant Sri Lanka a loan of Rs.46, 622 million or approximately Yen 33,137million, to enable the government to maintain its financial stability, continue its development agenda within the next five years and achieve its development goals.

title: ISIS’ territory has shrunk by 16 percent to the size of Sri Lanka: Research
content: The amount of territory controlled by the Islamist militant group, the so-called Islamic State (ISIS), has shrunk by 16 percent so far this year, according to new research from IHS Markit.

title: USD 10 million investment for drug production in Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka recently signed agreements worth USD 10 million with two companies to produce drugs in Sri Lanka.

title: Colombia’s President Santos donates Nobel money to conflict victims
content: Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos has said he will donate the money from the Nobel Peace prize to help the victims of the 52-year conflict in his country.

title: India planning sub-sea power cable to Lanka
content: The Indian Union Power Ministry is considering laying a sub-sea power cable to transmit power from India to Sri Lanka, said a senior Indian Ministry official.

title: Sri Lanka cricket team attack mastermind killed in Afghanistan
content: A dreaded Pakistani terrorist linked to the 2009 attack on Sri Lankan cricket team in Lahore was killed in a joint operation by Afghan—US special forces in Afghanistan bordering Pakistan, a media report said on Sunday.

title: Brawl involving a top politician’s son at Night Club
content: A group of men reportedly led by a son of VVIP had allegedly assaulted security personnel at a leading night club in Colombo when they were denied entry to the club in the early hours on Saturday, informed sources said.

title: JO busy selecting a name for new party
content: The selection of a name for the new party to be formed under the leadership of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa is to be completed by next week sources close to the joint opposition said.

title: Monetary Fund remains positive of Sri Lanka
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) yesterday said it remains positive of Sri Lanka’s growth prospects.

title: Sri Lanka insists it did not pull out of SAARC summit
content: Sri Lanka did not pull out of the SAARC summit, the country only expressed regret that the prevailing environment in the region was not conducive to hold the event, Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera told the parliament on Friday.

title: Asia will bail out the world, if it is allowed to frame the rules: Sri Lanka PM
content: New Delhi: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today marked out India and China as the only countries that can drive economic growth across the globe, saying manufacturing companies have no other place to go.

title: Sri Lanka to build 100,000 bpd refinery with India
content: Sri Lanka will build a second refinery with a capacity of at least 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) in a tie-up with Indian Oil Corp, a top Sri Lankan official said on Thursday, a move that strengthens New Delhi’s engagement with Colombo.

title: Sri Lanka happy with progress in economic ties with China
content: Sri Lanka on Wednesday said it is happy with the progress in its economic ties with China.

title: UN special rapporteur on minorities to arrive in Sri Lanka next week
content: The United Nations Special Rapporteur on minority issues, Rita Izsák-Ndiaye, will pay an official visit to Sri Lanka from 10 to 20 October 2016 to assess the current situation of national or ethnic, religious and linguistic minorities in the country.

title: Cross border terror must be on Saarc agenda: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe
content: Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has always been a friend of India even at a time when most Sinhala political leaders disliked New Delhi for its support of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam.

title: TPG, BlackRock show early interest in Sri Lankan Airlines stake: sources
content: Private equity firm TPG and fund company BlackRock Inc (BLK.N) are among half a dozen firms which have shown preliminary interest in a 49 percent stake in loss-making SriLankan Airlines Ltd, people familiar with the matter said.

title: No 100 percent tax waivers given to Beer Company
content: A Beer manufacturing company in the country which was fully affected by the recent flood has been provided the opportunity to import beer with taxes and other levies applicable to that of locally produced beer.

title: PM Ranil Wickremesinghe to meet PM Modi today
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi Wednesday and discuss several issues of mutual interest.

title: Grade Five Scholarship Examination 2016: Top scorers revealed
content: The results of the top scorers of the Grade Five Scholarship Examination have been released by the Department of Examinations.

title: Sri Lanka to pay $170 million to AerCap for A350 cancellation: Finance Minister
content: Sri Lanka will pay $170 million to AerCap Holdings NV (AER.N), the world’s largest independent aircraft leasing company, for cancelling a lease signed by the previous government for four A350s, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said on Tuesday.

title: Cigarette prices increased
content: The prices of cigarettes have been increased by Rs 7 per cigarette with effect from midnight yesterday (3), Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: Mihin Lanka to merge with SriLankan Airlines
content: Mihin Lanka is to merge with SriLankan Airlines with effect from the 30th of October.

title: Year 2017 will be a transformational year for building houses – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, recalling that the year 2017 has been declared as the year for alleviation of poverty, says the proposal including the plan for building houses on this regard, will be presented to the Cabinet next Tuesday.

title: MR squandered by ordering airplanes when people needed more buses: Ravi Karunanayake
content: At a time when the country needs more buses to streamline the services of Sri Lanka Transport Board; it has to pay a heavy cost instead for super luxury airbuses that had been ordered by the previous regime, Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: Wigneswaran says he’s unfairly portrayed as a ‘bogeyman’
content: The Chief Minister of Sri Lanka’s Tamil-majority Northern Province on Sunday regretted that people in South Sri Lanka are portraying him as an “undesirable”, a “ghost” or a bogeyman.

title: Tamil Nadu fishermen allege attack by Sri Lankan Navy – PTI
content: More than 2,000 Indian fishermen were on Sunday forced to return from sea without a catch after they were allegedly attacked by Sri Lankan Naval personnel, the PTI reported.

title: Sommaruga to raise migration issue in Sri Lanka
content: Swiss Justice Minister Simonetta Sommaruga will tackle the issue of repatriating Tamil asylum seekers to Sri Lanka when she visits the country next week. Migration will feature prominently on her trip to Sri Lanka and India.

title: There will be consequences, says Basil
content: Those who take revenge will have to face consequences in future as well according to Buddhism as karma, former Minister Basil Rajapaksa has said.

title: Sri Lanka to bring in new anti-terror law: PM Wickremesinghe
content: Sri Lanka would soon bring in a new anti-terrorism law, Prime Minster Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: SAARC Summit postponed indefinitely
content: The SAARC Summit set to be held in Islamabad in November has been postponed indefinitely, the government announced on Friday, after India along with four other member states of the regional grouping decided against attending the meet.

title: New Zealand and Sri Lanka commit to strengthening relationship
content: Prime Minister John Key has today announced New Zealand will establish a diplomatic post in Sri Lanka, and welcomed news that Sri Lanka will establish a post in New Zealand.

title: Sri Lanka pulls out of 19th SAARC Summit in Pakistan
content: In another setback to Pakistan, Sri Lanka today pulled out of 19th SAARC Summit in Islamabad, becoming the fifth country to do so after India expressed its inability to participate in the summit.

title: Don’t hatch Constitution on the sly – Wiggy
content: Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran said yesterday that “hatching a Constitution in secrecy with selected members from the Tamil community would not help the Tamils

title: ‘Wigneswaran attempting to create disunity among Sri Lankans’
content: Transport and Civil Aviation Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva yesterday condemned the conduct of Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran.

title: Sri Lanka to support India’s efforts to curb areca imports
content: The Indian government has got Sri Lanka’s support in its efforts to curb import of arecanut. During her visit to Sri Lanka on September 26-27, Union Minister of State for Commerce Nirmala Sitharaman got an assurance from Sri Lanka in this regard.

title: Sri Lanka targeting five per cent growth and single digit inflation
content: Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy said the government intends to keep the economic growth at five percent and inflation at single digits to maintain economic stability.

title: New dress code for pregnant teachers?
content: The attention of Minister of Education Akila Viraj Kariyawasam has been focused on allowing pregnant teachers to wear a convenient dress to school.

title: Perpetual Treasuries records over Rs.5 Billion profit through capital gains from bond trading
content: Perpetual Treasuries Limited, the controversial primary dealer connected to the family of the former Central Bank Governor, Arjuna Mahendran, has made an after-tax profit of Rs.5.1 billion for the year ended in March 31, 2016

title: India to invest $2 billion in Sri Lanka in next four years – Sitharaman
content: India will invest up to $2 billion in Sri Lanka over the next four years in a range of sectors including real estate, energy and infrastructure, its Commerce and Industry Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday.

title: Ranjan loses temper, hits video camera
content: A heated argument between Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake and a journalist from the electronic media ended up with the former hitting a video camera at a media briefing this evening.

title: PPP to attract more foreign investors for infrastructure development – Finance Minister
content: Proposed Public-Private Partnership (PPP) mechanism will attract more foreign investors especially to the infrastructure development sector thereby easing the government’s current budget constraints, said Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake.

title: Most expensive car imported to Sri Lanka so far
content: Recording the most expensive car imported to Sri Lanka, a leading businessman has imported a Rolls Royce super luxury car, worth over Rs. 158 million, customs sources said.

title: Lanka IOC says diesel tax increase will hit earnings
content: The Sri Lankan government’s decision to increase tax on diesel is likely to hit 2016/17 second-half earnings at fuel retailer Lanka IOC, its managing director said on Monday.

title: Body of Sri Lankan journalist who foresaw his murder to be exhumed
content: The body of a celebrated Sri Lankan journalist gunned down in the final months of the country’s brutal civil war in 2009 will be exhumed on Tuesday as part of a fresh investigation into his death.

title: Getting harassed by IMF: Ravi
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) appears to be hounding Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake in the wake of multiple blunders in attempting to pass the Value Added Tax (VAT) Bill, increasing the taxation rates in recent months.

title: Wimal Weerawansa at FCID over misusing state vehicles
content: National Freedom Front Leader MP Wimal Weerawansa arrived at the Police Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) a short while ago.

title: Aussie women whitewash Sri Lanka in ODIs
content: Australia’s women’s cricketers have completed an emphatic 4-0 clean sweep of their one-day series against Sri Lanka with a crushing 137-run win in Colombo.

title: Son of MP Mahindananda arrested for drunk driving
content: MP Mahindananda Aluthgamage’s son has been arrested by the Kirulapone Police last night on charges of driving under influence of liquor.

title: Mastercard lists Colombo as world’s 4th fastest growing tourist destination
content: Colombo, the capital of Sri Lanka, is the world’s fourth fastest-growing destination for international visitors, according to the 2016 Mastercard Global Destinations Cities Index.

title: Endorsement of our achievements by world leaders is a great incentive and a blessing for Sri Lanka – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that the world leaders have commended Sri Lanka on the achievements of the last 18 months and that is a great incentive, encouragement and a blessing for Sri Lanka.

title: Blames Mathews for axing
content: Dilhara Lokuhettige announced his retirement from Test and ODI cricket at a press conference held at the Moors Sports Club in Braybrooke Place yesterday.

title: IMF waits on VAT
content: An International Monetary Fund (IMG) mission winding up their review of the Sri Lankan economy yesterday warned a second tranche of the $ 1.5 billion Extended Fund Facility (EFF) would be dependent on the implementation of the proposed VAT hike.

title: Sri Lanka to be made a hub supporting naval, air, communication and business operations; PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe has revealed that initial arrangements have been finalized to make Sri Lanka a hub extending necessary support for naval, air, communication and business operations.

title: U.S. President Obama praises positive transformation in Sri Lanka
content: The U.S. President Barack Obama stated that the positive transformation taking place in Sri Lanka at present is exemplary to the world and he assured his fullest support for the development of Sri Lanka.

title: High costs slowing Sri Lanka push toward solar energy
content: An ambitious plan by the Sri Lankan government to outfit 100,000 homes with solar panels, to turn them into power producers for the national grid, may be too expensive for many families to afford, experts warn.

title: Ban Ki-moon commend President’s commitment to good governance & reconciliation
content: The U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon highly appreciated President Maithripala Sirisena’s total commitment to good governance and reconciliation.

title: Speech delivered by President Maithripala Sirisena at the 71st Session of the United Nations General Assembly
content: I am extremely happy to take part in this 71st Session of the United Nations General Assembly. I wish to bring to the notice of Your Excellencies the current situation in my country.

title: President holds bilateral discussions with Australian Prime Minister and Indian Minister
content: President Maithripala Sirisena attended the 71st Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) which commenced yesterday (Sep. 20) at UN Headquarters in New York.

title: Hirunika and 8 others granted bail over abduction case
content: Nine defendants including MP Hirunika Premachandra, who have been charged over the abduction and threatening of an individual, were granted bail by the Colombo High Court.

title: US Millennium Challenge Corporation to assist Sri Lanka
content: The United States Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) has selected Sri Lanka for its Threshold Programme, under which assistance will be provided for selected projects.

title: Sri Lanka, India working on trade pact
content: Sri Lanka and India are working towards signing an Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), and discussions are on for the purpose, a top Sri Lankan official said.

title: MiG deal: Ex-Air Force Commander quizzed by FCID
content: The Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) has questioned former Airforce Chief Air Marshal Roshan Goonetileke.

title: President attends Clinton Global Initiative meeting
content: President Maithripala Sirisena attended the Open Plenary of the Bill Clinton Foundation’s Clinton Global Initiative (CGI) meeting, in which the Plenary Session of the Partnering for Global Prosperity was held yesterday (Sept. 19) at the Sheraton Hotel in New York.

title: A/L cut off marks released, 10% increase in enrolements
content: The University Grants Commission (UGC) today released the cut off marks of the G.C. E. Advanced Level Examination in the year 2015.

title: CPC faces Rs. 2 billion monthly losses after excise duty hike – Minister
content: Sri Lanka’s state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation will incur a loss of about two billion rupees ($13.78 million) per month after the government raised excise duty last month, the petroleum resources minister said on Monday.

title: Nuwan Kulasekara released on bail
content: Fast bowler Nuwan Kulasekara who was arrested following a fatal accident involving his vehicle at Ranmuthugala, Kadawatha was released on bail this evening, Police said.

title: SriLankan Airlines and Mihin Lanka likely to merge?
content: SriLankan Airlines and Mihin Lanka are considering a merger, the Muscat Daily news agency reported.

title: Tony Abbott says Europe is facing ‘peaceful invasion’ of asylum seekers
content: The former Australian prime minister Tony Abbott has urged Europe to adopt harsh Australian-style border protection policies to avoid “losing control” in the face of record numbers of people seeking asylum.

title: After 28 years, Vaiko releases Prabhakaran’s letter to DMK chief?
content: Indian MDMK general secretary Vaiko has released a letter written by LTTE leader V. Prabhakaran to DMK leader M. Karunanidhi

title: President leaves for New York to attend UNGA
content: President Maithripala Sirisena left the country today (Sep. 18) to attend the 71st United Nations General Assembly to be held at the UN Headquarters in New York.

title: Sri Lanka calls to ban fishing methods harming marine eco-systems
content: Sri Lanka on Saturday asked the international community to ban all fishing methods that harm marine eco-systems worldwide.

title: TNA in new battle to save image in Canada
content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) hopes to make representations to the Canadian Government over the ruling of a Federal Court where an application of a TNA member who sought refugee status was dismissed.

title: India ready to help set up LNG-fired power plant in Sri Lanka
content: India has told Sri Lanka that it can help put up a Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG )-fired power plant as desired by Sri Lanka at Sampur or any other location

title: Special commodity levy on imported sugar increased
content: The Special Commodity Levy on imported white sugar has been increased to Rs 2.00 per kilogram and Rs 15 per kilogram on raw sugar with effect from midnight yesterday, the Finance Ministry announced.

title: Sri Lanka has ‘significantly’ benefited by engaging with UN Systems – Ravinatha Aryasinha
content: Sri Lanka told the 33rd session of the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on Thursday, that constructive engagement with the Special Procedures and the UN system as a whole has benefitted Sri Lanka “significantly”, and it looks forward to continuing the engagement.

title: India Signs MoU With Sri Lanka To Support Fishermen And Farmers
content: India on Thursday signed an MoU with Sri Lanka to support livelihood of the fishing and farming communities by providing them equipment worth USD two million in the country’s southern Hambantota district.

title: Mahindananda Aluthgamage arrested by CID
content: Parliamentarian Mahindananda Aluthgamage was arrested by the CID a short while ago, the Police said.

title: Cabinet approves VAT amendments
content: Sri Lanka’s Cabinet of Ministers have approved the new amendments to Value Added Tax (VAT) Bill.

title: Dinesh Priyantha wins Javelin bronze at Rio Paralympics
content: Dinesh Priyantha Herath secured Sri Lanka’s first medal- a bronze in men’s javelin throw F46 final at the Rio Paralympics yesterday.

title: National Standard for plugs and socket outlets
content: Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) will implement a National Standard for plugs and socket outlets in Sri Lanka for non-industrial applications.

title: Sri Lanka stops on-arrival visa for Bangladeshis; Bangladesh retaliates – report
content: Sri Lanka has stopped issuing on-arrival visas for Bangladeshi nationals without informing Dhaka, officials at the Bangladesh foreign ministry said.

title: Coal power joint venture with India dropped – Government
content: The Attorney General yesterday told the Supreme Court that the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy would not go ahead with the proposed joint-venture coal-fired power project with India at Sampur, Trincomalee.

title: Sri Lanka’s 2016 fiscal deficit goal challenging despite H1 success – economists
content: Sri Lanka fiscal deficit goal for 2016 would still be challenging despite a better-than-expected performance in the first half by the coalition government due to possible populist policies ahead of local elections next year, economists said on Tuesday.

title: Well planned programmes will be implemented in next year for Buddhism – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the next year will be planned as a year for implementation of well planned programmes for promotion of Buddhism.

title: War crime suspects including Lankans are living freely in the UK?
content: Scores of suspected war criminals seeking to live in Britain escaped deportation thanks to a series of blunders.

title: Government drafts Constitution according to Al-Hussein’s whims: Wimal
content: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa, yesterday, charged that the government was in a hurry to draft a new Constitution, to satisfy the whims and fancies of UN Human Rights Commissioner Zeid Ra’ad Al-Hussein.

title: Lax security blamed for poor Malaysian response in Sri Lankan envoy assault
content: An appalling lack of security at the airport and a corrupt Malaysian administration are blamed for the brutal assault on the Sri Lankan High Commissioner in Malaysia, Ibrahim Sahib Ansar, by local Indian Tamil radicals at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA), the New Indian Express reported.

title: President’s message for Hajji Festival
content: The festival of Hajj, also known as Eid-ul-Alha symbolizes the noble human values and the ideals of sacrifice that left a deep and significant impression in the historic Muslim legend.

title: Prime Minister’s message for Hajji Festival
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe issuing a message said that Hajj Festival is celebrated in a true spirit of fellowship among Muslims all over the world, gave us great insights into the need for reconciliation and unity.

title: Army to release another 700 acres
content: The Army has agreed to release to civilians 700 more acres of private land occupied by it in the Valikamam North area in Jaffna

title: 8 Army Int officers to be charged with murder
content: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has concluded the investigation into the disappearance of journalist Prageeth Ekneligoda and the final report is expected to be referred to the Attorney General (AG) within two weeks seeking indictment of the suspects.

title: All must unite to create a strong social opinion against drug consumption
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says all must unite to create a strong opinion in the society about preventing drug consumption, which destroys the entire society and increases poverty among the people of the country.

title: Malaysian duo plead not guilty to assaulting Sri Lankan envoy
content: TWO men claimed trial in Malaysia on Friday to charges of rioting and causing injury after they were nabbed over the assault of Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to the country.

title: Sri Lanka targets at least 300,000 Chinese tourists this year
content: Sri Lanka is targeting at least 300,000 Chinese tourists this year as China has now become the largest market for tourist arrivals in the island nation, the Tourism Ministry said on Friday.

title: Two charged with assault on Sri Lankan envoy
content: Two men were charged in the Sepang Sessions Court today with rioting and causing hurt on Sri Lanka High Commissioner in Malaysia Ibrahim Sahib Ansar on Sunday.

title: Duminda, four others sentenced to death
content: Former MP Duminda Silva and four others were sentenced to death by Colombo High Court a short while ago over the killing of Bharatha Lakshman Premachandra.

title: Invasion by Indian jets in 1987 enraged Sri Lankan army officers
content: The brazen invasion of Sri Lankan airspace by Indian Air Force jets and transport aircraft on June 4, 1987, enraged Sri Lankan army officers who were, at that time, doggedly and successfully carrying out “Operation Liberation” against the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) in the Vadamarachchi region of Jaffna peninsula.

title: CID wanted to question me: Astrologer Wijemuni Vijitha
content: Astrologer Wijemuni Vijitha Rohana de Silva said yesterday that the CID wanted to record a statement from him over a video released by him forecasting the future of President Maithripala Sirisena and said an astrologer should have the freedom to carry out his work independently.

title: Modi to visit Sri Lanka in 2017
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Sri Lanka in May 2017, Sri Lankan Health Minister and Cabinet spokesperson Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Second level leadership needed soon – Ranil
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told the United National Party (UNP) that someone from the second level leadership should take over the party before long, party sources said.

title: WHO declares Sri Lanka malaria-free in ‘truly remarkable’ achievement
content: The World Health Organisation (WHO) has declared Sri Lanka free of malaria, hailing it as a “remarkable public health achievement” for the Indian Ocean island, once one of the most affected nations in the world.

title: Higher Education Ministry to set up new faculty at Sri Jayawardenapura University
content: The Ministry of Higher Education is taking steps to establish an Engineering Faculty at the University of Sri Jayawardenepura.

title: Thajudeen case: Canadian experts say CCTV footage unclear
content: The Forensic Video and Surveillance Technology Laboratory – British Columbia Laboratory in Canada has informed the Colombo Magistrate Court that the CCTV footage in connection with the murder of rugger player Mohammed Thajudeen were not clear…

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa says attack on Sri Lankan envoy was against government
content: Former strongman Mahinda Rajapaksa on Monday dubbed as “one against the government” the attack on Sri Lankan envoy in Malaysia who was mobbed by a group of protesters allegedly linked to the LTTE for hosting him.

title: Lankan maid enslaved by bosses in their city apartment: law suit
content: A Malaysian diplomat and his wife treated a Sri Lankan national virtually as a slave, making her work 15-plus hours a day for no more than $1.71 per hour — “when she was paid at all,” according to a new lawsuit.

title: President urges party members and progressive forces to join hands to form a SLFP government in future
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) will contest the upcoming local government polls under the SLFP’s traditional ‘hand’ symbol.

title: Government to introduce salary bonanza: PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday the government was working towards introducing a pay hike to the working class, and also to provide employment opportunities to the youth.

title: Attack on Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner in Malaysia
content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirms reports that Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to Malaysia had been assaulted by a group of persons at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport yesterday, 4 September 2016.

title: Support to increase tax on tobacco products to 90 percent- President requests all Ministers & MPs
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the Cabinet of Ministers should take steps to approve the proposal tabled by him to the Cabinet to increase the tax on tobacco products to 90 percent without taking much time.

title: Buddhist monk assaulted at anti-Rajapaksa protest
content: The chief monk of the Sri Lankan Buddhist temple in Sentul was assaulted by a small group among demonstrators conducting a protest against former Sri Lankan president Mahinda Rajapaksa who is visiting Malaysia.

title: Sri Lanka recalls Upul Tharanga for final ODI vs. Australia
content: Sri Lanka has recalled experienced batsman Upul Tharanga for the fifth one-day international against Australia after captain Angelo Mathews was ruled out of the rest of the tour with a calf injury.

title: Sri Lanka’s Mathews out of remaining limited-overs games vs Australia
content: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews has been ruled out of the remainder of the one-day series against Australia due to a calf muscle injury, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) said on Friday.

title: U.N. chief urges Sri Lanka to redress wrongs of war
content: U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-moon on Friday urged Sri Lanka to do more to redress wrongs committed during 26 years of war with Tamil rebels, including returning land and restoring the accountability of the judiciary and security services.

title: Media should not ridicule the concept of reconciliation – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said the media should not mock or ridicule a noble concept like reconciliation as that would give a wrong interpretation about a positive concept to the younger generation.

title: Website hackers released on bail
content: The two suspects arrested and remanded for hacking the official website of President Maithripala Sirisena have been released on bail.

title: Former LTTE cadre detained with fake Indian passport in Pune
content: A Sri Lankan national who is also a former LTTE cadre was detained at the Pune international airport, India on Thursday morning for allegedly using a fake Indian passport in his bid to fly out of the country to Germany.

title: Sri Lanka nationalists protest against U.N. chief visit
content: Dozens of Sri Lankan nationalists on Thursday protested against a three-day visit by U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon, demanding he leave the island and stop an investigation into alleged abuses at the end of the civil war.

title: Gotabaya and 7 others issued notice over floating armoury
content: The Colombo Chief Magistrate today issued notice on former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa and 7 others to appear before the court in connection with the case filed against them for unlawfully authorizing the establishing of a floating armoury.

title: China ready to pump in over US $ 5bn in FDIs: envoy
content: China’s top diplomat in the country yesterday said that the world’s second largest economy is prepared to commit over US $ 5 billion in foreign direct investments (FDIs) over the medium to long term for special economic zones, if the Sri Lankan government is prepared to authorize them.

title: Vigneswaran manages to get separate meeting with Ban Ki-moon
content: Chief Minister of Northern Province, C.V. Vigneswaran, has managed to get a separate meeting with the visiting UN Secretary General, Ban Ki-moon, after being clubbed together with other leaders of the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) for a full-scale official session with the UN chief when he comes to Jaffna on September 2.

title: UN Secretary-General arrives in here today
content: Secretary-General of the United Nations, Ban Ki-moon, accompanied by Mrs. Ban Soon-taek, will arrive in Sri Lanka today 31 August for an official visit.

title: Solheim gained ‘valuable lessons’ as peace negotiator in Sri Lanka
content: The new head of the United Nations environment agency, Erik Solheim, says that he had gained valuable lessons, including the importance of dialogue and compromise while serving as a negotiator of the peace process in Sri Lanka.

title: Wigneswaran sidelined in itinerary for Ban Ki-moon’s visit
content: The United Nations, the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) and the Sri Lankan government have combined to sideline Sri Lanka’s Northern Province Chief Minister C.V.Wigneswaran in the itinerary drawn up for the visit of UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon to Sri Lanka from August 31 to September 2.

title: As disaster losses mount, Sri Lanka develops tool to track them
content: Sri Lanka is planning to begin testing its first web-based disaster damage and loss reporting system by the end of the year, authorities say.

title: Families of people missing in Sri Lanka’s civil war march in silence
content: Human rights activists and families of missing people rallied in Sri Lanka on Tuesday (August 30) in support of an office recently set up to independently investigate the cases of thousands of people who vanished during the government’s long conflict with Tamil Tiger rebels.

title: Probe disappearance of Tamils: Vaiko
content: India’s MDMK general secretary Vaiko has urged the United Nations Human Right Council (UNHRC) and the Red Cross Society to inquire into the disappearance of Tamils in the last phase of war in Sri Lanka and the alleged poisoning of 107 LTTE cadres.

title: MR too old at 70 to form new party: Rajitha
content: Taking a swipe at moves by the joint opposition to from a new party headed by ex-president Mahinda Rajapaksa, Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday such attempts were not conducive for a person who was 70 years of age.

title: Sri Lanka police arrest teen over hacking president’s website
content: Sri Lanka police on Monday arrested a 17-year old school boy on suspicion of hacking into the president’s official website, demanding that his university entrance examination dates not be changed, officials said on Monday.

title: New draft Constitution could be presented in parliament by November
content: Sri Lanka’s new draft Constitution could be presented in Parliament before the next budget which would be announced by mid-November this year, Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera has said while hoping that it will celebrate the country’s diversity.

title: New model to administer loss making plantation companies
content: The government will introduce a new model to run the plantation companies soon, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: Rs.80 million donations to Health Ministry by WHO
content: World Health Organization (WHO) has donated four mobile hospitals and medical equipments worth Rs.80 million to the Ministry of Health.

title: Pakistan says three accused of 2009 Sri Lanka cricket team attack killed
content: Pakistani police said on Sunday that three Islamists suspected of being behind an attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team in the city of Lahore in 2009 had been killed during a shootout.

title: ‘Dilscoop’ Dilshan to hang up his boots
content: Tillakaratne Dilshan, a formidable Sri Lanka opening cricketer, has announced his retirement from ODIs after the third match against Australia on Sunday.

title: Caution urged over online ads to hire maids; Sri Lankan mission receiving lesser complaints
content: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha has advised employers to be cautious about online advertisements for recruitment of maids and urged them to verify details with the mission.

title: No reason why cricket cannot grow in United States of America, says MS Dhoni
content: India One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 skipper MS Dhoni has given the thumbs up for the growth of cricket in the United States of America (USA), saying there is no reason why the game cannot be successful there.

title: Tamils continue to face racial discrimination in Sri Lanka, says UN Committee post review
content: Tamils continue to face discrimination in Sri Lanka, a UN committee stated recently, and questioned the island-country if Indian Tamils were allowed to get back to their homeland – while reviewing a report on the anti-discrimination efforts undertaken by the country.

title: President instructs AG to investigate into the allegation in Australian website
content: President Maithripala Sirisena drew his personal attention to the report published on Wednesday (Aug 24) in the Australian website Sydney Herald that stated some alleged incident of an employee of his office

title: Ban Ki-moon to arrive in Sri Lanka next week
content: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon will highlight the importance of development and human rights during visits next week to Sri Lanka and Myanmar, two legs of a five-stop Asia tour, his spokesman said Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka wants Indian subcontinent firm involved in $400 million port contract
content: Sri Lanka is seeking a consortium that must include a company from the Indian subcontinent to bid for a $400 million contract to build a port terminal, the ports minister said on Thursday.

title: Vigneswaran sets goals and parameters for development projects
content: Chief Minister of Northern Province, C.V. Vigneswaran, has outlined the economic goals of his largely rural province and set the parameters within which economic development projects should be conceived.

title: Body recovered in Mawanella suspected to be of missing businessman
content: A man’s body believed to be that of the missing businessman, Mohamed Sakeem Sulaiman, was found on the Hemmathagama Road in Rukulagama in Mawanella yesterday evening, police sources said.

title: Sri Lankan reforms aims to simplify tax, increase base, compliance -minister
content: Sri Lanka’s new government is drafting reforms aimed at simplifying taxes, widening the tax base and increasing compliance, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said on Wednesday.

title: Sri Lanka beats Australia by 82 runs in 2nd ODI
content: Spin bowler Amila Aponso and seamer Thisara Perera shared seven wickets to help Sri Lanka to a crushing 82-run win over Australia in their second one-day international on Wednesday.

title: Legislation to establish Megapolis Authority soon
content: The new legislation for the formation of the WP Megapolis Authority, which will remove many obstacles for development, will be brought in soon.

title: Sri Lankan rupee trades steady; dollar selling by foreign investors eases pressure
content: The Sri Lankan rupee held steady for a seventh straight session on Tuesday, with dealers hesitating to trade in the local currency below 145.50 per dollar anticipating central bank intervention to defend the currency, dealers said.

title: Speaker signs Office of Missing Persons Act
content: The Speaker of Parliament Karu Jayasuriya has signed the Bill establishing the Office of Missing Persons, the Speaker’s Office said.

title: MR says anyone has a right to form new party
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday said nobody had a right to prevent the formation of new political parties.

title: US backs out of undertaking to medically examine ex-LTTE cadres
content: The United States has backed out of an undertaking to medically examine former combatants of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) who had allegedly been injected with a poisonous drug when they were in detention or undergoing rehabilitation in camps.

title: UN denies report Sri Lanka temple may lose heritage tag
content: The UN’s cultural agency has denied reports it is considering taking an ancient Sri Lankan cave temple off a list of world heritage sites, as a local conservation official Saturday renewed fears about its status.

title: Sri Lanka President made to wait as driver fails to turn up in time
content: INDIA: Senior officials of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) on Sunday faced embarrassment as the visiting Sri Lanka President Maithripala Sirisena was forced to wait in his car as the driver did not turn up in time.

title: Import tax on Big Onions increased
content: Import tax on Big Onions has been increased from Rs 25 to 40 per kg with immediate effect, the Finance Ministry said.

title: I won’t let those who crowned with fraud & corruption to rule this country again – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena emphasizes that he would not let those who crowned with the fraud, corruption, waste and robbery to rule this country again.

title: ‘Tamil diaspora can help rebuild Sri Lanka’
content: An atmosphere conducive to find a permanent political solution to the Sri Lankan Tamil issue is emerging now and it is the moral responsibility of the Tamil diaspora to join in reconstruction efforts, according to a group of Tamil MPs from the island nation.

title: 55 Sri Lankan Tamil kids face bleak future
content: Chennai: The future of 55 Sri Lankan Tamil children aged between 11 and 18 hangs in balance as the Kancheepuram district administration has launched probe into complaints that they were falsely labelled as refugees and war survivors to get admission in government and private schools at Acharapakkam in the district.

title: 2012 Welikada riot Govt. should investigate delay at Justice Ministry
content: Good governance activists called on the Government to investigate the delay of the Ministry of Justice to inform the relevant authority or authorities of the course of action to be taken with regard to meting out justice for the 27 killed at the Welikada Prison in 2012.

title: Sri Lankan rupee steady; importer demand offsets exporter dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee was steady for a fifth straight session on Friday as dollar sales by exporters and banks were offset by demand for the U.S. currency from importers, dealers said.

title: Dullas resigns
content: UPFA MP Dullas Alahapperuma says he will resign from the Matara District SLFP leadership post. He said this addressing a press conference a short while ago.

title: Northern Governor defends building places of worship
content: The Governor of Sri Lanka’s Northern Province, Reginold Cooray, has defended the building of Buddhist temples in the province saying that it is only part of a boom in the building of places of worship there.

title: State lands for landless war heroes
content: Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal made by the Minister of Defense, President Maithripala Sirisena to grant state lands for landless war heroes revising the shortcomings of the prevailing process.

title: UN voices concern over Dambulla cave temple
content: The UN’s cultural agency expressed concern Wednesday over the poor maintenance of a centuries-old cave temple in Sri Lanka, which risks being struck off the list of world heritage sites.

title: Sri Lanka whitewash Australia after Rangana Herath takes seven wickets
content: Sri Lanka have won a Test series 3-0 against Australia for the first time after beating the tourists by 163 runs in the third Test in Colombo with the spinner Rangana Herath -taking seven wickets in a 13-wicket match haul.

title: Unveiling of national economic policy, incentives to foreign investors soon: PM
content: Sri Lanka’s national economic policy and the attended opportunities and incentives offered to local and foreign investors will be unveiled very soon, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Train kills four baby elephants in Chettikulam
content: Four baby elephants were killed when the Colombo bound Thaleimannar Express train crashed into them near Karadikulam, Chettikulam last night, the Railway Control Room said.

title: People smuggling boat returned to Sri Lanka
content: Australia has returned a group of Sri Lankan nationals to Sri Lanka yesterday after recently intercepting a people smuggling venture.

title: Scot hopes for justice against Malaka Silva two years on
content: A Scots engineer who became an overnight celebrity in Sri Lanka after punching the hated playboy son of a government minister has spoken of his hope to “see justice done” as a long-running investigation into the incident finally comes to court.

title: Sports ground the center for reconciliation – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said the sports ground is the center for reconciliation as it has no distinction between  race, religion, language, caste or colour.

title: ETCA a win-win situation for all – Indian HC
content: The proposed Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) between India and Sri Lanka, which would be an improvement over the existing Free Trade Agreement (FTA), may soon be a reality.

title: Sri Lanka arrests son of former leader Rajapaksa
content: Sri Lankan financial crime police arrested the eldest son of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa on Monday on suspicion of laundering money, his lawyer said, the latest legal difficulty for the once-powerful family.

title: US hails investment friendly environment in Sri Lanka
content: The United State hailed on Friday what it termed as the investment friendly environment has currently been created in Sri Lanka. The US Assistant Secretary for Economic and Business Affairs, Charles H Rivkin said during his meeting with Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake at the Finance Ministry on Saturday.

title: Japanese tourists drugged, robbed by Lankan guide
content: A Japanese woman visiting India to document the Independence Day celebrations was drugged and robbed of her belongings by a man who claimed to be a Sri Lankan tour guide.

title: Ex-LTTE members increasingly taking to writing
content: Former members of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) are increasingly taking to writing to articulate their reflections on the civil war, which came to an end in May 2009.

title: Vijayakala wants wells checked for dead bodies
content: State Minister of Child Affairs Vijayakala Maheswaran says that the closed water wells in the islands off Jaffna should be immediately inspected under court orders.

title: Sri Lanka blocks sale of freehold land in $1.4 billion Chinese deal
content: COLOMBO, Aug 12 Sri Lanka’s government on Friday agreed a new version of its $1.4 billion real estate agreement with China after changing the terms and blocking the outright sale of land – part of a project covering a square mile right next to the capital’s port.

title: Sri Lankan rupee steady as importer dollar demand offsets exporter sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended steady on Friday as dollar sales by foreign investors and exporters were offset by importer demand for the greenback, dealers said.

title: Devolution the only solution – Vigneswaran
content: C.V. Wigneswaran, chief minister of the Northern Province and member of the Tamil National Alliance, says adopting federalism is the only way to assure transitional justice and provide a long-lasting solution to ethnic conflict.

title: Sri Lanka parliament endorses office to trace wartime missing
content: Sri Lanka’s parliament on Thursday passed a law to establish an office to trace people who disappeared during a 26-year war and another insurrection amid protests by former leader Mahinda Rajapaksa’s supporters in the chamber.

title: Thailand willing to invest in cement manufacture
content: Leading Thai cement manufacturing company, Siyam City has expressed their interest for more investments in Sri Lanka in Puttlam and Galle cement factories.

title: Previous government hid debts of at least Rs. 1.36 trillion – PM
content: Sri Lanka’s previous government hid debts of at least 1.36 trillion rupees on the books of some state and semi-government institutions, aggravating the debt crisis, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Wednesday.

title: Foreigners who bring a large amount of money to get residency visa
content: The Cabinet nod has been given to draft the proposed Special Deposit Account Act which can grant the residency visa to foreign individuals who bring a large amount of foreign exchange into the country.

title: Steps to resurrect failed projects
content: Government is taking steps to resurrect the failed projects and strengthen the national economy said, National Policies and Economic Affairs State Minister Niroshan Perera.

title: Shooter Samarakoon blames federation for poor show

title: Seven Sri Lankan women caught smuggling 2 kg gold
content: Seven Sri Lankans were caught at Kempegowda International Airport in Bangalore while attempting to smuggle in over 2 kg of gold valued at over Rs. 65.70 lakh.

title: Indo-Lanka talks on ETCA today
content: Sri Lanka and India is reported to hold official level talks on the proposed Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) today in Colombo.

title: 79 trafficked Nepali workers rescued from B’desh, Sri Lanka
content: At least 79 migrant workers were rescued by Nepali authorities over the past few weeks, according to Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA).
