title: 13 SLFP CC members sacked
content: Hot on the heels of the general election which ended at 4.00 p.m. President Maitripala Sisrisena, in a further attempt to wrest control of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) party, is reported to have expelled 13 of its Central Committee (CC) members and replaced them by a new set of members.

title: General Election 2015 concludes peacefully
content: Polling for Sri Lanka’s General Election 2015 ended peacefully today with over 70% turnout recorded in most electoral districts.

title: Sri Lankans go to polls in ‘referendum’ on Rajapaksa comeback
content: Sri Lankans went to the polls on Monday to elect a new parliament in what amounts to a referendum on ex-president Mahinda Rajapaksa’s comeback bid, with the reformist alliance that swept him from power seeking a stronger mandate.

title: Vote early – EC
content: Elections Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya urged all voters to visit polling stations as early as possible today (17) to cast their vote with a valid ID.

title: Sri Lanka Deploys Thousands of Police on Election Eve
content: Sri Lanka deployed thousands of police today in stepped up security on the eve of a general election after the campaign was hit by sporadic violence that claimed four lives.

title: Galle gives emotional farewell to Sangakkara
content: The Sri Lankan supporters and players present at the Galle International stadium gave a fitting farewell to Kumar Sangakkara playing his penultimate Test match at the very venue he made his debut 15 years ago.

title: Ranil sure of GSP+ restoration
content: A United National Front (UNF) Government will ensure that Sri Lanka receives the GSP+ concession again, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: Whatever Sri Lanka’s election result, China’s back in business
content: Work on a landmark Chinese-backed waterfront development in Colombo could resume after next Monday’s general election in Sri Lanka, even if Beijing’s preferred candidate for prime minister, ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa, is defeated.

title: Susil, Anura expelled from SLFP
content: Susil Premajayantha and Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, who were removed from their respective general secretary posts of the SLFP and UPFA, had also been expelled from the membership of the SLFP.

title: President sacks Anura and Susil; appoints Duminda and Vishwa
content: The Colombo District Court today issued an enjoining order preventing Anura Priyadharshana Yapa and Susil Premajayantha from acting and discharging duties as the General Secretaries of the SLFP and UPFA respectively until August 28, 2015.

title: Rajapaksa sends reply to President Sirisena
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa today responded to the letter from President Maithripala Sirisena, with a letter of his own.

title: Central bank switches to public bond auctions after scandal
content: Sri Lanka’s central bank has formally announced that it will issue all treasury bonds by public auction, and no longer by direct placement, responding days before a parliamentary election to criticism of a controversial offering in February.

title: Court lifts Gota’s travel ban
content: Three persons including former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who had been banned by Court from travelling abroad due to investigations being carried out in connection with the floating armoury in the Galle Harbour, were yesterday allowed permission

title: Maithri sends hard-hitting letter to Mahinda Rajapaksa
content: In a hard-hitting letter to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, President Maithripala Sirisena said that even if the UPFA wins the general election, Mahinda Rajapaksa won’t be appointed Prime Minister

title: Vote for any animal but not betel leaf: CBK
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike said the people could vote for any animal and not for the betel leaf symbol or the hand symbol at the forthcoming general elections if they wanted to save the country from corrupt individuals.

title: MRIA to be used as a paddy store?
content: Sri Lanka’s second international airport, a pet project of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his hometown built at a cost of USD 210 million, could be used as a temporary paddy storage facility, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Chandrika batting for UNP has no effect – UPFA
content: UPFA General Secretary Susil Premajayantha yesterday accused former President and ex- Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Leader Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga of working for the UNP.

title: I could not even get Matara Post Office painted – Sanath
content: As the Deputy Minister of Post in the Mahinda Rajapaksa government, I could not even get the buildings of the Matara Post Office painted

title: Tony Blair, family arrives in Sri Lanka
content: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair has arrived in Sri Lanka at 1.30 p.m. from Katunayake Bandaranayake International Airport (KBIA) on board an Emirates flight, a source said.

title: Murder probe casts shadow over comeback bid by Sri Lanka’s Rajapaksa
content: The exhumation of the remains of a star rugby player whose death is now the target of a murder investigation has cast a shadow over former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s comeback bid at Sri Lanka’s general election next week.

title: This election will decide the fate of our nation – Mahinda Rajapaksa
content: If anybody can be described as the ‘face’ of this parliamentary election, it is former president Mahinda Rajapaksa. Not only is his likeness displayed on the posters pamphlets and other election material of the candidates of the UPFA, the UNP and the JVP also direct all their attacks at him.

title: Sri Lanka expects to win EU trade concession ‘within months’
content: Sri Lanka is likely to regain a lucrative European Union trade concession for garments exports, the government said on Tuesday, five years after the South Asian island nation lost the discount over its failure to address human rights concerns.

title: Seven detained over death of Lankan thief
content: Malaysian Police have arrested seven men for investigation into the death of a Sri Lankan man who was allegedly assaulted while attempting to break into an apartment at Kota Kemuning in Shah Alam.

title: Sri Lanka releases 40 fishermen
content: Forty Indian fishermen, who were in the custody of Sri Lankan authorities since June, have been released following orders of courts in Point Pedro and Mannar, both in the Northern Province.

title: Sri Lankan economy strong, inflation below expectations – Finnance Minister
content: Sri Lanka’s economy should grow by 7 percent this year, up from 4.5 percent last year, while inflation will end the year far below market expectations, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said on Monday.

title: FCID summons Namal
content: Former parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said today he had been summoned by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) on August 12.

title: Thajudeen’s body exhumed
content: Ruggerite Wasim Thajudeen’s body was exhumed a short while ago at Jummah Mosque Cemetery, Dehiwala as per the order of Colombo Additional Magistrate Nishantha Peiris.

title: Wasim Thajudeen’s murder: Former DIG, several PSD officers to be questioned
content: Retired Senior DIG Anura Senanayake and several officers who were previously attached to the Presidential Security Division (PSD) are likely to be questioned in connection with Rugby Player Wasim Thajudeen’s death.

title: Mahinda confident of comfortable win
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday addressed newspaper editors and other media personnel at the Hilton Residencies.

title: Sri Lanka billed over half million rupees for ex-PM’s 5-star laundering
content: Sri Lanka’s new administration has been billed over half a million rupees for washing clothes of the Prime Minister of the ousted Rajapaksa regime during the last quarter of 2014, Deputy Economic Policy Minister Harsha de Silva said.

title: No alliance with UNP or UPFA – Anura Kumara Dissanayake
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that none of the two major political parties can get a majority in Parliament at the general election, but the JVP will not ally with either party to form a government.

title: Investigations deliberate attempts to suppress UPFA politicians – Mahindananda Aluthgamage
content: Former Sports Minister and UPFA Kandy District Candidate Mahindananda Aluthgamage said that despite the big hue and cry made by the government to bring crooks to book as early as possible, the government over the past six months has failed to find anybody guilty over the alleged financial frauds and other charges levelled against some UPFA politicians.

title: Sri Lanka’s ex-strongman in tough battle for return to power
content: Mahinda Rajapaksa, once poised to be Sri Lanka’s president for life, is a desperate man these days. At stake is not just his own political future, but that of an entire dynasty and a network of supporters he founded at every level.

title: US citizens in Sri Lanka advised on possible political violence
content: The United States has issued a security message to its citizens living or traveling in Sri Lanka, in view of the forthcoming parliamentary polls in the island.

title: Eknaligoda disappearance: CID nabs two tiger suspects
content: The CID yesterday took into custody two former LTTE cadres for questioning over the disappearance of senior journalist Prageeth Ekneligoda who went missing since 2010.

title: JVP has only social motives – Handunnetti
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) has no personal motives,but, only social motives, said former MP Sunil Handunnetti.

title: Ranatunga slams SLFP, says party full of corrupt people
content: Chandrika Kumaratunga will never support the Sri Lanka Freedom Party as long as there are corrupt and unwanted people in it, said Minister of Ports Shipping and Aviation Arjuna Ranatunga.

title: Rajapaksa wants govt to probe Lasantha, Eknaligoda cases
content: Sri Lanka’s former president Mahinda Rajapaksa has vowed to win an outright majority in parliamentary elections due on 17 August.

title: Sri Lanka’s Mahinda Rajapaksa vows to win general election
content: Sri Lanka’s former president Mahinda Rajapaksa has vowed to win an outright majority in parliamentary elections due on 17 August.

title: I have never supported Eelam cause – Vijayakala Maheswaran
content: Deputy Women’s Affairs Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran while insisting that her vehicle did not carry a poster exhibiting the Tamil Eelam map yesterday said that she has never supported the call for Tamil Eelam.

title: Sri Lanka rupee ends lower after state bank raises dollar peg
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended weaker on Thursday as a state-run bank, through which the central bank usually directs the market, raised the currency’s peg against the dollar by 25 cents to let the exchange rate depreciate to 133.75, dealers said.

title: ‘We want to beat India for Sangakkara’ – Mathews
content: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews said Wednesday his team is eager to send off the retiring Kumar Sangakkara by winning the test series against India that starts next week.

title: Instant noodles safe for human consumption – Dr. Mahipala
content: The Director General of Health Services, Dr. Palitha Mahipala stated that the Sri Lankan instant noodles is safe for the human consumption which was declared as not safe early.

title: Malaysia confirms wing part washed up on beach is from missing MH370
content: A piece of a wing that washed up on an Indian Ocean island beach last week was part of the wreckage of Malaysian Airlines flight MH370, Malaysia said on Thursday, confirming the discovery of the first trace of the plane since it vanished last year.

title: Protect ‘Jan. 08 mandate’ – CBK
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, in a special statement issued yesterday, urged the nation to defeat the elements trying to reverse the “January 08” mandate and vote for honest and respectable candidates.

title: Sri Lankan shares gain to over 6-month high on stability hopes
content: Sri Lankan shares jumped to their highest in more than six months on Wednesday on hopes of political stability after the Aug. 17 parliamentary elections and better earnings in the April-June quarter, brokers said.

title: Another murder in Kotahena
content: A 33 year old man has been stabbed to death at Jampettah Street, Kotahena by a group of four unidentified assailants who arrived in a three-wheeler.

title: Mahela Jayawardene set for England role
content: Mahela Jayawardene is set to be appointed as a batting consultant by England for their series away to Pakistan in the United Arab Emirates later this year after officials confirmed they arein talks with the Sri Lanka great.

title: US$ 50 billion export income achievable – PM
content: It is hard to achieve a significant sustainable economic development without focusing on the development of the export sector, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Australian Federal Police accused of supporting CID
content: The Australian Federal Police (AFP) has been providing equipment and assistance to Sri Lanka’s Criminal Investigation Department (CID), which has been accused of kidnapping and torture, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation reported.

title: 21 injured in bus crash
content: Twenty one passengers were hospitalized after two buses had collided head-on at Radawadunna in Nittambuwa on the Colombo-Kurunegala main road this morning, police said.

title: UPFA Manifesto is like Fairy Tale – Liberal Party
content: Secretary General of the Liberal Party Kamal Nissanka addressing a meeting at Bishop Lauxman Wickremesinghe Hall in Kurunegala said that the UPFA election manifesto resembles’ Santa Claus is coming to town’ and therefore it is like a Christmas hamper or a food basket

title: Sri Lanka will have it tough against India: Jayasuriya
content: After losing some of its big stars, Sri Lankan cricket is going through a tough period. The signals coming from the island nation are not very promising either.

title: ‘Give us autonomy and 90 per cent of problems will be solved’: TNA
content: The road blocks and military checkpoints are gone, and the restrictions on foreign tourists and journalists visiting the area have been lifted.

title: Kotahena shooting: Another dies
content: Another person injured during the shooting incident at Kotahena last Friday has succumbed to his injuries. The injured person was receiving treatment at the National hospital at the time of his demise.

title: Lakshman Wasantha Perera arrested
content: Fomer MP Lakshman Wasantha Perera has been arrested after he surrendered to police over an alleged assault, Police spokesman told media.

title: UPFA fears for MR’s safety, calls for enhanced security
content: SLFP spokesman Dilan Perera yesterday said that two UNP candidates, Srinath Perera, PC and Deputy Justice Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe had confirmed that Friday’s attack near St. Benedict’s College, Kotahena involved two underworld gangs jousting for dominance.

title: Zero-Based Budgeting for 2016 and beyond!
content: Undeterred by the upcoming election, a confident Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake has declared that the 2016 fiscal program will be presented under the more effective ‘Zero-Based Budgeting’, claiming that past practices had been imprudent.

title: Colombo – Kandy Expressway: PM to launch first stage of work today
content: Construction work on the first stage of the Colombo – Kandy Expressway from Kadawatha to Meerigama will be launched by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today.

title: Fuel prices may be reduced again within three months
content: Fuel prices are likely to be reduced further within the next three months with world prices going down and Sri Lanka now being able to buy oil directly from Iran, following the lifting of sanctions by the United States, a top official said yesterday.

title: Ministerial house on fire
content: A fire had erupted in a three-story house belonged to Minister C.B. Rathnayaka, police said.

title: Three women dead, 16 injured in lorry accident
content: Three persons were killed while another 16 suffered injuries following an accident involving a small lorry in Udawalawa this morning.

title: SriLankan claims Rs. 114 m from Presidential Secretariat
content: SriLankan Airlines has written to the Presidential Secretariat claiming nearly 114 million rupees accrued as expenses for Presidential voyages since 2011.

title: Elections Chief to probe Expressway ceremony
content: Elections Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya said he would probe whether a request issued by the Prime Minister’s office requesting media coverage for the foundation stone laying ceremony for the Central Expressway was a violation of election laws.

title: Aksha Sudhari’s bank accounts frozen
content: The bank accounts of tele-actress Aksha Sudhari be frozen following an order given by Colombo Additional Magistrate Nishanta Peiris.

title: Shots fired at Ravi’s supporters; 1 dead and 11 injured
content: One person has been confirmed dead while at least 11 supporters of UNP Colombo District candidate Ravi Karunanayake have been hospitalized with injuries following a shooting incident at Bloemendhal Road, Colombo.

title: Investigators probe plane wreckage for link to missing MH370
content: A mysterious piece of plane debris washed up on the French Indian Ocean island of La Reunion on Wednesday, prompting teams of international investigators to examine whether it could be part of the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370.

title: MR likely to be questioned over RADA allegations!
content: Former President and UPFA Kurunegala District candidate Mahinda Rajapaksa is likely to be questioned in connection with alleged financial misappropriations involving Reconstruction and Development Agency (RADA), highly placed police sources told the “Daily News” yesterday.

title: BOI signs an investment agreemtn to build tallest building in Sri Lanka
content: One of India’s biggest Real Estate Development Groups Shreepati Edifice (Pvt) Ltd has signed an agreement with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka to invest US$ 330 Million to construct a Mixed Development Hybrid project of 1996 Iconic Tower.

title: China to give kidney hospital, US$ 250 million in grants to Sri Lanka
content: China will build a 100 million dollar specialized hospital to treat a mysterious kidney disease that is striking mainly rice farmers in Sri Lanka and also give another 250 million dollars in grant aid, Ambassador Yi Xianliang said.

title: Mastermind of 2009 Sri Lankan cricket team attack killed
content: The alleged mastermind of the attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team in 2009 in Lahore was killed in an attempted breakout from police late on Tuesday, along with his sons and 11 others, Pakistani media have reported.

title: Another batch of Sri Lankan Tamils return home
content: A fresh batch of 45 Sri Lankan Tamil refugees headed back to their homeland from the international airport yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka’s ex-leader blames others for anti-Muslim attacks
content: Sri Lanka’s former strongman leader on Tuesday blamed unnamed conspirators for carrying out anti-Muslim attacks during his tenure as he tries to woo estranged minority communities in his comeback bid in next month’s parliamentary elections.

title: President cancels SLFP memberships of four including Rajitha, Hirunika
content: The President has ordered to cancel the SLFP memberships of Rajitha Senaratne, S.B. Navinna, M.K.D.S. Gunawardene, Arjuna Ranatunga and Hirunika Premachandra, the President Media Unit said in a statement today (28).

title: New Constitution needed – TNA
content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA), a coalition of Tamil political parties in Sri Lanka, has demanded that the country frame a new Constitution to address a host of issues it’s grappling with, including the Tamil question.

title: FCID investigations continuing – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that investigations into financial crimes by the special police unit, Financial Crimes Investigations Division (FCID) is continuing and the FCID was currently carrying out extensive probes on about 20 high profile cases.

title: Youth will defeat MR’s PM aspirations – UNP
content: A large number of youth had voted against Mahinda Rajapaksa at the last presidential Election and more would do so at the August 17 general election, the UNP said on Sunday.

title: Former President of India APJ Abdul Kalam Dies at 83
content: Former President of India APJ Abdul Kalam died on Monday at a hospital in Meghalaya, where he had gone to deliver a lecture at the Indian Institute of Management in Shillong, reports Press Trust of India. He was 83.

title: Australia may return Sri Lankan asylum seekers
content: Sri Lankan asylum-seekers intercepted at sea could be handed back to their home countries if a Labor government assessed they were not owed refugee protection, Leader of the Australian Labor Party Bill Shorten has said.

title: Sri Lanka to manufacture ships and cars – Ranil
content: Sri Lanka will manufacture ships and cars in some years time with the help of foreign investors, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday.

title: MR: No factions in SLFP, UNP will be defeated
content: Former President and UPFA Prime Ministerial Candidate Mahinda Rajapaksa said yesterday that there were no factions in the SLFP and the party would go ahead as one entity to defeat the common enemy, the UNP.

title: Mirihana white van came for President – M.K.D.S
content: The white van, in which three army personnel were travelling with a pistol, came for President Maithripala Sirisena, United National Front National List candidate M.K.D.S. Gunawardena said.

title: Kusal ton sets up consolation SL victory
content: Kusal Perera sent Pakistan on the run with his most substantial innings to date, then Sri Lanka’s middle order ran the opposition down and mauled them in a frenzied finish, to found a 165-run victory in the final ODI. Sri Lanka plundered 368 for 4

title: ‘Ukkuwa’ shot dead
content: A 38-year-old underworld kingpin Jayaweera Patabendige Indika Nilusha alias Ukkuwa has been killed by an unidentified group of people in Tangalle, this morning (26), the police said.

title: We want to defeat the Rajapaksa political culture – Vijitha Herath
content: JVP which launched its manifesto last week has committed itseld to an ideological struggle to bring about political changes in the country. In an interview with the Sunday Observer, former MP and JVP Propaganda Secretary Vijitha Herath said the party aims at taking ‘controlling power’ of the next Parliament to work for the people.

title: Army says it has only ‘limited’ role in north
content: The Sri Lankan Army has maintained that its involvement in the Northern Province is limited “only to demining, construction works and infrastructure development in connection with the resettlement of people.”

title: Litro Gas will not be privatised: Minister
content: In an emphatic response to UPFA MP Bandula Gunawardena, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said there was no attempt at all to privatize Litro Gas Lanka Ltd.

title: Rajapaksa comeback bid checked by Sri Lanka bribery probe
content: Sri Lanka is investigating a Chinese firm on suspicion of offering a bribe to Mahinda Rajapaksa’s failed presidential re-election campaign, a source close to the investigation said, weeks before he seeks to pull off a comeback in a general election.

title: Minister Janaka Bandara quits
content: Provincial Councils and Regional Development Minister Janaka Bandara Tennakoon has sent his resignation letter to President Maithripala Sirisena today.

title: Navy assists Indian fishing trawler in distress
content: Sri Lanka Navy has rendered assistance to an Indian fishing trawler with 4 fishermen in distress in Sri Lankan waters on 23rd July 2015.

title: MR noticed to appear in court in FR case
content: Seven persons including former President Mahinda Rajapaksa have been noticed to appear before the Supreme Court on July 24 to show cause as respondents in a fundamental rights case filed against them by R. H. Senaka Perera, a candidate of the Nava Sama Samaja Party contesting the general election from the party’s National List.

title: Sri Lanka to harness wasted rainwater for crops, power
content: Sri Lanka plans to store and use a billion cubic meters of rainwater per year, which would otherwise drain into the sea, in an ambitious effort to boost irrigation and power production.

title: Enjoining Order against COPE report dissolved
content: The enjoining order that prevented the publication or circulation of the COPE subcommittee draft report on the sale of Central Bank bonds has been dissolved by Colombo district court following a request made by the petitioner Sujeewa Senasinghe.

title: Govt to pay the Golden Key depositors from Friday
content: The government is to begin the disbursement of payment to the deposit holders of the defunct Golden Key Credit Card Company Ltd (GK) from Friday (July 24).

title: Sri Lanka rupee ends steady on state bank dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended steady on Wednesday in dull trade as a state-owned bank maintained its dollar-selling rate at 133.70, dealers said.

title: ‘Executing under pressure concerns us’ – Atapattu
content: Sri Lanka coach Marvan Atapattu said Lasith Malinga’s lack of penetration, and the bowlers’ failure to execute plans has paved their path to decline, though the plans themselves remain robust.

title: Lankan detained in India was close aide of Prabhakaran – police
content: One of the two Sri Lankan Tamils arrested last night along with communication gadgets and cyanide in the district of Ramanathapuram has been identified as Krishnakumar, a close associate of slain LTTE supremo V Prabhakaran, Tamil Nadu police said today.

title: Gota claims his life is at risk
content: There were many who were corrupt in the former president’s government which resulted in his defeat earlier this year, said the former defence secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa.

title: MR says Ranil holding PM post illegally
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that Premier Ranil Wickremesinghe had been illegally holding the post of Prime Minister for over six months by manipulating the mandate given by the people at the recent Presidential Election.

title: Arrest of soldiers in white van at Mirihana; UPFA demands impartial probe
content: Former External Affiars Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris yesterday urged the government to inquire into circumstances under which three army personnel had been arrested in the Mirihana Police area, while travelling in a white van bearing a forged number plates.

title: Sri Lanka bans alcohol for Pakistan ODI after riot
content: Sri Lanka’s cricket authorities announced a ban on alcohol during Wednesday’s fourth one-day international between Pakistan and the hosts following a drunken riot at the venue on Sunday.

title: Sri Lanka becoming a key transportation hub for South Asia: ex-US Director of National Intelligence
content: Election outcome in Sri Lanka is important for the region and the world, Dennis Cutler Blair, the former United States Director of National Intelligence and former US Navy admiral has said.

title: President makes a sudden visit to Maligawatte Kidney Hospital
content: President Maithreepala Sirisena made a sudden observation visit to the Kidney Hospital in Maligawatte on Monday afternoon. His visit  the hospital to find out about complaints with regard to suspension of operations at the Kidney Hospital in Maligawatte.

title: TNA says to push for political solution to Tamil issues
content: Sri Lanka’s main minority Tamil political party, the Tamil National Alliance (TNA), on Monday said it will push for a permanent political solution to issues faced by the Tamils, following the August 17 parliamentary election.

title: Mahinda says no to national govt.
content: Former President and UPFA candidate for the Kurunegala District Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday rejected the idea of forming a national government post-election, vowing that the fractured alliance would obtain 117 seats and rule alone.

title: Champika: MR should have stayed at home without troubling Maithri
content: Power and Energy Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka on Sunday said that those who had left the former government to usher in good governance had proved that they were not power hungry.

title: Gold prices drop to record lows
content: Gold prices have dropped to a record low in global markets. Foreign media reported that this marks the lowest price recorded for gold in five years.

title: No poll ticket for Rajiv attacker: BJP
content: The radical Sinhalese-Buddhist party, the Bodu Jana Permuna (BJP), has refused to give an election ticket to Wijemuni Vijitha Rohana de Silva, who had hit Rajiv Gandhi with his rifle butt when the then Indian Prime Minister was reviewing a Guard of Honuor at Colombo on July 30, 1987

title: Sajin back in Prison ward Skin disease found to be bogus
content: Former Parliamen-tarian Sajin de Vaas Gunawardena who is currently in remand custody for the misuse of 16 State owned vehicles was ordered to be removed from Prison Hospital and relocated into a normal prison ward by the Colombo High Court Justice Ranawaka Gunatileke.

title: More land to be released in Sri Lanka’s North
content: The government is in the process of identifying and releasing more private land from the High Security Zones in the Northern Province, according to a top official of the Defence Ministry.

title: Prabhakaran’s distant relative to contest against Mahinda at polls
content: A relative of LTTE supremo Velupillai Prabhakaran has entered the fray for Sri Lanka’s parliamentary election to be held in August 17 to challenge former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: “Private sector has a major role to play”
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the party will build a regime which will be a force in the government which the people will elect on August 17.

title: FIRST SRI LANKAN ISIS MILITANT KILLED IN SYRIA
content: A karate master from Galewela, Kandy who has been reportedly killed in Syria in an air strike last week is said to be the first Sri Lankan member of the ISIS, international and social media reports said.

title: “UPFA nomination lists replete with names of undesirables”
content: Drug dealers, ethanol dealers, bar owners, thugs and various other miscreants involved in anti-social activities have been included in the UPFA nomination list, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Sri Lanka shares at six-week high on hopes of political stability
content: Sri Lankan shares hit a six-week high on Friday, heading for a seventh straight session of gains, on hopes of political stability after the Aug. 17 parliamentary elections.

title: India wanted Sri Lanka to stop Colombo Port City – Gotabaya
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa says that India’s National Security Advisor had requested the former Sri Lankan government to stop the Chinese-funded Colombo Port City project as it would pose a threat to that country’s security.

title: Cabinet approval granted for export of Wallapatta
content: The cabinet approval was granted to the proposal made by President Maithripala Sirisena as the Mahaweli Development and Environment Minister to promote the exportation of Gyrinopswalla (Wallapatta) plant and cultivate the plant based on its commercial value, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday

title: UNP obtains order halting publicising COPE report on bond issue
content: Additional District Judge of Colombo Sumith Perera yesterday issued an enjoining order, restraining the defendants, D. E. W. Gunasekera, Dr. Rajitha Senaratne, Rosy Senanayake, Lasantha Alagiyawanne, Arjuna Ranatunga, Susil Premajayantha and a few others, from publicising the report published by the Committee on Public Enterprises on the investigation into the Treasury Bond issue of the Central bank.

title: Sudarshani, Lasantha, Erick resign
content: Dr Sudarshani Fernandopulle, Lasantha Alagiyawanna and Eric Prasanna Weerawardena of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party have decided to resign from their respective Deputy Ministerial portfolios.

title: JVP refuses to buy President Sirisena’s story
content: President Maithripala Sirisena’s claim that he was opposed to giving nominations to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa to contest upcoming polls is not acceptable, the JVP says.

title: Planned economic zones will bring development to village
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, yesterday said his government would establish 45 economic development zones throughout the country and such a zone too would be established in Raigama, covering a part of Homagama, Eheliyagoda, Bandaragama, Horana and Avissawella electorates.

title: Kusal Perera hits second fastest ODI fifty as Sri Lanka win
content: Sri Lanka opener Kusal Perera blasted the second fastest one-day fifty in their series-levelling two-wicket victory against Pakistan in the second ODI at Pallekele on Wednesday.

title: Court halts SLFP CC meetings
content: The Colombo District Court today issued an enjoining order preventing the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Central Committee from holding meetings without the permission of Party Leader President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Special UPFA meeting; Mahinda arrives at SLFP HQ
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa arrived at the SLFP Headquarters a short while ago for a special meeting of the UPFA Executive Committee meeting. All leaders of the major constituent parties of the UPFA along with President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to be present at the meeting.

title: Is Sri Lanka’s Rajapaksa making a comeback?
content: Sri Lanka’s former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will stand in parliamentary elections on 17 August as a candidate for the governing coalition, the Election Commission confirmed this week.

title: There’s a mastermind behind bond issue ‘fraud’: Cabraal
content: Former governor of the Central Bank Ajith Nivard Cabraal yesterday told the media in Colombo that CB Governor Arjun Mahendran was only partly responsible for the controversial Bond-Issue scam and that there was a ‘mastermind ‘behind the scenes.

title: EU to observe Parliamentary Elections in Sri Lanka
content: Following an invitation from the Sri Lanka authorities, the European Union has today started the deployment of an Election Observation Mission (EOM) to Sri Lanka to observe the Parliamentary Elections scheduled for 17 August 2015.

title: Top politicos recruiting gangs
content: Senior DIG Gamini Navaratne said Police had discovered plans by several powerful politicians contesting the forthcoming parliamentary elections to deploy underworld gangs to ensure their election victories.

title: Sri Lanka president opposes Rajapaksa comeback, PM bid
content: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Tuesday criticized a comeback bid by Mahinda Rajapaksa, the rival he beat in elections last January, and his own allies for backing him to become prime minister.

title: Mahinda will lose again: Maithripala
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that he was totally against the granting of nominations to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and said that Mr. Rajapaksa would lose the upcoming general elections similar to his loss on January 8.

title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 04 Indian nationals with 165 kilograms of “Kerala Ganja”
content: Naval craft of the North Central Naval Command which were on routine patrol arrested four Indian nationals with 165 kilograms of Cannabis (Kerala Ganja) in the seas north-west of the Thalai-mannar in the early hours of 14th July 2015.

title: Prasanna Ranatunga and wife granted bail
content: The Fort Magistrate on Tuesday (14) granted bail to the Chief Minister of the Western Province, Prasanna Ranatunga, and his wife in connection with a case filed against them over an irregular land deal.

title: Sri Lanka rupee ends weaker as state bank lowers exchange rate
content: The Sri Lankan rupee ended weaker on Monday after a state-owned bank pegged the currency’s exchange rate to the dollar at 133.80, 20 cents lower than its previous close, dealers said, amid demand for the greenback from importers.

title: Former Sri Lanka leader Mahinda Rajapaksa to run for prime minister in August elections
content: A coalition led by Sri Lanka’s president has nominated war-time leader Mahinda Rajapaksa to run in elections next month, official documents showed on Monday, with allies saying he will stand for the post of prime minister.

title: UPFA and UNP national list announced
content: The National Lists of the United National Party (UNP) and the United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) have been announced for the forthcoming General Election.

title: UPFA, UNP and JVP Colombo District nominations announced
content: The nominations lists (Colombo) of the United National Party (UNP) and the United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) have been announced for the forthcoming General Election.

title: Susil Premjayantha hospitalized
content: General Secretary of the UPFA Susil Premajayantha has been admitted to Hospital due to a sudden illness last night (12).

title: Gas and Rice prices down from July 15
content: The price of LP gas will be reduced by Rs 100 per 12.5 kg domestic cylinder, Samba rice to Rs. 69 and Nadu rice to Rs 60 per kilogram with effect from July 15, Finance Minister announced.

title: Rajitha, Hirunika, Arjuna, Champika sign from UNFGG
content: JHU General Secretary Champika Ranawaka, Rajitha Senaratne, Arjuna Ranatunga and Hirunika Premachandra have signed their nomination papers for the forthcoming General Elections from the newly formed United National Front for Good Governance, sources said.

title: United National Front for Good Governance formed
content: The Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to form the United National Good-Governance Front has been signed by the United National Party (UNP), Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) and some other members of SLFP breakaway faction at Temple Trees this morning.

title: A Nation Betrayed Looks At Maithri’s Next Move
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, in his effort to prevent a split in the SLFP led by him, has inadvertently weakened the party like never before. Not to mention the severe blow dealt to the foundation of good governance, a policy he preached in the run up to the Presidential election.

title: Hirunika to contest under ‘elephant’ symbol
content: UPFA Western Provincial Council member Hirunika Premachandra has reportedly signed nominations to contest the upcoming parliamentary election from the United National Front for Good Governance, the UNP-led political alliance.

title: Sri Lanka rupee steady for 6th session in dull trade
content: The Sri Lankan rupee was steady for a sixth straight session on Friday in thin trade as demand for more dollars by importers was offset by selling of the greenback at 133.60 by a state-run bank, dealers said.

title: Sri Lanka’s defeated Rajapaksa to contest August 17 poll
content: Sri Lanka’s war-time president, Mahinda Rajapaksa, has signed nomination papers to fight an Aug. 17 election as part of a coalition led by President Maithripala Sirisena, Rajapaksa’s spokesman said on Friday.

title: Sri Lanka JHU monks party joins coalition with UNP
content: Sri Lanka’s main party of Buddhists monks is set to join the United National Party (UNP) in forming a new coalition to contest upcoming parliamentary election, political sources said a short while ago.

title: Sajin to contest from ind. group?
content: The former monitoring MP of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Sajin De Vass Gunawardena and a group are reported to have decided to contest the general elections from the Galle District as independent candidates.

title: ‘If Putin can, why can’t Rajapaksa?’ – Gammanpila
content: “If Vladimir Putin can become Prime Minister after serving as President of Russia, why not Mahinda Rajapaksa?”

title: No control over nominations: President tells civil society reps
content: President Maithripala Sirisena who met civil society leaders that strongly backed his presidential bid in January at his residence on Wednesday night, said the final decision on granting nominations to his predecessor Mahinda Rajapaksa was not in his hands.

title: US to restore GSP Plus facility, refund duty paid
content: The United States has decided to restore the GSP Plus facility and has also agreed to return the duty paid by Sri Lanka during the period it did not enjoy this facility.

title: Fonseka’s Democratic Party hands over nominations
content: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has handed over nominations for General Elections, a short while ago.

title: Mahinda signs nominations to contest from Kurunegala
content: Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa has signed nominations to contest the upcoming general election from the Kurunegala district today, former MP Wimal Weerawansa said.

title: Many Rajapaksa loyalists face the axe
content: Western Province Chief Minister Prasanna Ranatunga, who has played a major role to nominate former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as the UPFA Prime Ministerial candidate, would not get nominations to contest the general election from the Gampaha District, UPFA sources said.

title: We will defeat Mahinda – Ajith P. Perera
content: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ajith P. Perera says that the United National Party (UNP) will defeat former President Mahinda Rajapaksa once again at the general election: “We would like to explain reality to him.”

title: Finance Minister orders probe into tsunami relief vehicles
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake has initiated an inquiry into the importation of high-value vehicles for tsunami relief and subsequently given to third parties without paying due taxes and depriving the state of billions of rupees.

title: No nominations for Duminda, Mervyn, Sajin and Sarana
content: The nomination boards of the SLFP and the UPFA have agreed not to give nominations to former MPs Duminda Silva, Mervyn Silva, Sajin de Vass Gunawardena and Sarana Gunawardena to contest the forthcoming general Election, political sources said.

title: Lankan youth dies in Surrey after being hit by cricket ball
content: A British Tamil League cricketer has died after being struck in the chest by a ball during a club match in Surrey.

title: Conditional nominations for MR
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, after lengthy negotiations with different stakeholders of the UPFA, has agreed to offer conditional nominations for former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: UPFA MP Thenuka Vidanagamage remanded
content: UPFA MP Thenuka Widanagamage was remanded till July 14 by the Mahiyanganaya Magistrate today over an election violation.

title: Sanath retires from politics
content: Cricketer turned politician Sanath Jayasuriya has decided to quit politics. It is learnt that he had informed President Maithripala Sirisena of his decision to resign from politics.

title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests TN fishermen for smuggling cannabis
content: The Sri Lankan navy has arrested four fishermen from Tamil Nadu for allegedly smuggling cannabis.

title: Shantha threatens litigation – Crossover speculation vehemently denied
content: Former Deputy Minister of Mass Media and Communication Shantha Bandara denied news reports that he will be leaving the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) to join the United National Party (UNP).

title: Sri Lanka polls timed ahead of U.N. war crimes report to foil Rajapaksa comeback
content: Sri Lanka’s August elections have been timed to stop a comeback by war-time president Mahinda Rajapaksa, who remarkably may see his popularity rise in coming months if criticized for war crimes in a U.N report, said government sources.

title: Election Laws effective from today
content: The Elections Secretariat has decided to apply the election laws from today. The relevant regulations have been informed to the political parties and independent groups.

title: Democracy was upheld during CBK’s term – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said yesterday that the Bandaranaike family did everything for the country without corruption and fraud.

title: They want to bury us for saving the country – MR
content: Addressing a gathering of people at Moragahamula Dhammapala Buddhist Centre in Kandy recently, the former President said Prime Minister Wickremesinghe went about saying that the Rajapaksas should be buried.

title: President to stay neutral at polls
content: President Maithripala Sirisena’s decision to allow his predecessor Mahinda Rajapaksa to contest the August 17 parliamentary elections on the United People’s Freedom Alliance ticket has caused ripples within his own ‘rainbow’ coalition.

title: Maithri and Mahinda have betrayed their voters: JVP
content: JVP central committee member Sunil Handunnetti said they were not surprised by the decision taken to give nominations to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa under the United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA).

title: Mahinda to contest on UPFA ticket
content: The UPFA yesterday announced that it had decided to field former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the forthcoming general election.

title: COPE report on bond scam: DEW to go public today
content: The on-going controversy over the investigation carried out by a special 13-member committee into alleged Central Bank bond scam has taken a new turn with former Chairman of the parliamentary Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) Dew Gunasekera deciding to go public today.

title: PM to pay for bullet proof vehicle
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe had asked the Election Commissioner to inform him of the government’s expense for the bullet proof vehicle used by him until the election is held.

title: Maithri rejects MR
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has apparently rejected to give nominations to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, sources said.

title: Saudi prince to donate $32bn fortune to charity
content: Saudi Arabian billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal has said he will donate his entire $32bn  fortune to charity.

title: Indian Ocean cannot be backyard of India – China
content: China recognises India’s special role in stabilising the strategic Indian Ocean region but the perception that it is India’s “backyard” may result in clashes, Chinese military officials and experts have cautioned.

title: ‘Govt has not halted development projects’
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said recently that the new government under President Maithripala Sirisena has neither halted nor terminated any development projects.

title: I am not coming – Chandrika
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga yesterday denied reports that she too would contest the election if former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was to do so.

title: Sri Lanka’s Rajapaksa to stand for Prime Minister in Aug. 17 polls
content: Former Sri Lankan president Mahinda Rajapaksa said he would run for prime minister during next month’s parliamentary elections, a move that is likely to infuriate rights groups as he is accused of war crimes in a civil war.

title: Mahinda has not been named as PM candidate
content: There are no arrangements in place to name a Prime Ministerial candidate from the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) thus far, the President’s Media Unit said on Tuesday.

title: UPFA agrees to nominate MR
content: The United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) has finally agreed to nominate former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as a candidate at the August 17 general election under the betel symbol, a party leader said.

title: No Prime Ministerial candidate for SLFP before election : PMD
content: Issuing a special release the President’s media unit says that no candidate fielded by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party has been named as a prime ministerial candidate.

title: No intention of grabbing power again – Former President Chandrika
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga says she has no intention of grabbing power  again unlike others.

title: Government expects increase per capita income to 6000 US$, within next 5 years – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the Government expects to increase per capita income to 6000 American Dollars, within next five years.

title: UN closes down humanitarian office in Sri Lanka
content: The United Nations is downsizing its humanitarian staff in some Asian countries where governments have stepped up with funds and manpower after a decade of massive floods, storms and earthquakes.

title: SLFP nominations for Mahinda: TALKS INCONCLUSIVE
content: Talks between President Maithripala Sirisena and SLFP stalwarts over accommodating former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in the SLFP nomination list at the next election ended without a conclusion last night.

title: Sri Lanka shares recover after election announcement
content: Sri Lankan shares recovered on Monday from a near 2-1/2 month low hit in the previous session after President Maithripala Sirisena dissolved parliament and announced elections, but trading volume slumped due to the political uncertainty.

title: Sri Lanka ranked 114 in Global Peace Index
content: Sri Lanka ranked 114th on the global peace index conducted by an Australian-based Institute for Economics and Peace which measured national peacefulness in 162 countries.

title: Sri Lanka beat Pakistan by seven wickets to level series
content: Sri Lanka needed a little over 26 overs to chase down a 153-run victory target for a series-levelling seven-wicket victory in the second test against Pakistan on Monday.

title: Stop maids running away from sponsors – Saudi tells Lanka
content: The Saudi Labor Minister Mufrej Al-Haqabani has asked the Sri Lankan government to stop maids running away from their Saudi sponsors soon after their arrival in the Kingdom.

title: Eran wants minutes of COPE Sub Committee sittings on Treasury Bond issue be published
content: The minutes of the COPE Sub Committee sittings on the Central Bank Treasury Bond issue should be publicized, Highways and Investment Promotion Deputy Minister Eran Wickremaratne said.

title: BBS to be reborn as BJP
content: The controversial Buddhist outfit, Bodu Bala Sena(BBS) will be reborn as the Bodu Jana Peramuna (BJP), to field lay candidates at the forthcoming parliamentary elections, BBS Executive Committee member, Dilantha Withanage said.

title: NRFC fraud through fake emails: Banks lose Rs. 1 billion
content: Fake emails have led to banks holding Non-Resident Foreign Currency (NRFC) accounts suffering losses of more than one billion rupees, a Criminal Investigation Department investigation has revealed.

title: ICC asks Sri Lanka to hold elections before October
content: The ICC has urged Sri Lanka’s sports ministry to hold Sri Lanka Cricket elections before the next ICC board meeting in October, suggesting “further action” may be taken against SLC “in the event of further non-compliance”.

title: Port city project to start soon: Arjuna
content: Work on the Colombo Port City project will begin soon as it has not been cancelled, Ports and Shipping Minister Arjuna Ranatunga informed Parliament yesterday.

title: Parliament dissolved
content: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has been dissolved with effect from midnight today (June 26) by President Maithripala Sirisena, Government sources told Media.

title: Former President accorded maximum security – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe has emphasized in Parliament that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is being accorded maximum security and facilities. He further told Parliament that even KP alias Kumaran Pathmanathan a former LTTE Leader has been accorded security.

title: Emirates plane makes emergency landing at BIA
content: Emirates flight A380 bound to Dubai made an emergency landing at Bandaranaike International Airport, today (26) at around 3.47a.m.

title: MR says will contest only from SLFP
content: “I will contest the next election only from the UPFA led by the SLFP”, stated former President Mahinda Rajapaksa to the committee which was now attempting to unite the SLFP, sources said.

title: ‘President will be forced to dissolve Parliament if 20A drags on’
content: Demanding President Maithripala Sirisena to dissolve Parliament early is unacceptable when he is determined to fulfill his promises given to the people, Deputy Media Minister Shantha Bandara said.

title: Parliament dissolution within next two days
content: Parliament is likely to be dissolved either tonight to tomorrow night to enable General Elections to be conducted by the middle of August, informed sources said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka attempts to weaken funding networks of LTTE
content: The Sri Lankan government on Wednesday said it was in the process of strengthening diplomatic ties with countries that have worked with Sri Lanka in the past to weaken the financial and support networks of the Tamil Tiger rebels.

title: Hakeem drops a bombshell
content: Urban Development Minister Rauff Hakeem yesterday said in Parliament that there was a dictatorship of a small group within the Cabinet of Ministers that prevails against minor and minority parties.

title: SC to proceed with the applications against the FCID
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday (24) granted leave to proceed in applications filed challenging the establishment of the Financial Crime Investigation Division.

title: Sri Lankan Navy asked not to open fire on fishermen: India
content: The Indian Ministry of External Affairs on Tuesday informed the Madras High Court Bench in Madurai that it has impressed upon the Sri Lankan Navy “to act with restraint, not to fire on [Indian] fishermen and to treat [Indian] fishermen in a humane manner.”

title: Pavement hawkers granted permission on cross streets
content: There are mixed reactions over the decision to allow pavement hawkers to conduct business on the streets of Colombo. The Rajapaksa regime under the Colombo City Beautification Programme prohibited them from doing business on the pavements, which resulted in a great loss to them.

title: Sri Lankan rupee steady on state bank’s dollar sales
content: The Sri Lankan spot rupee traded steady on Tuesday, as a state bank, through which the central bank usually directs the market, sold dollars at a flat rate of 133.90, but trading was dull amid political uncertainty, dealers said.

title: One killed as police open fire at lorry
content: Police have fired fired shots at a lorry which did not heed to police orders at the Aranthalawa police post early Tuesday morning.

title: UNHRC says not funding diaspora festival
content: The UNHRC on Monday dismissed reports of having allocated funds for the proposed ‘Diaspora Festival’ organised by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs by the end of this year.

title: UPFA never demanded MR be PM candidate
content: The UPFA never demanded or asked anyone to name former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as the next Prime Ministerial candidate, give him nominations or anything else. It is a section of the SLFP which are making these demands, National Freedom Front leader MP Wimal Weerawansa said.

title: Sri Lankan shares edge up; political woes hurt sentiment
content: Sri Lankan shares inched up on Monday, recovering from a two-month low hit in the previous session, led by large caps, but trading was choppy as political woes ahead of an announcement on parliamentary election date weighed on sentiment.

title: Sri Lanka condemns attack on Afghan Parliament
content: President Maithripala Sirisena condemned the terrorist attack on Afghanistan Parliament.

title: Jaya seeks PM Modi’ s intervention for release of fishermen by Sri Lanka
content: Following the latest instance of arrest of Indian fishermen by Sri Lanka, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa sought Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s intervention for the release of 31 such people along with their boats.

title: There cannot be two leaders in a country – President
content: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday said there cannot be two leaders in a country.

title: “How can UPFA nominate MR as prime ministerial candidate?,” asks Maithri
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, breaking his silence for the first time, has told SLFP seniors that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa cannot be nominated as the UPFA’s prime ministerial candidate because he had been rejected by the people for running  a lawless and corrupt government.

title: SLFP committee decides on MR for PM post
content: The six-member committee appointed by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has unanimously decided to nominate former president Mahinda Rajapaksa as the party’s prime ministerial candidate no matter what President Maitripala Sirinsena’s views are on this matter, informed sources said.

title: Ragama ‘Ranaviru Sevana’ Inmates Get a Surprise Visitor
content: Lieutenant General Crishanthe De Silva, Commander of the Army taking time off his hectic schedule paid a surprise visit to the Ragama Ranaviru Sevana on Friday (19) afternoon…

title: Sri Lanka to dilute dependence on China – Mangala
content: Sri Lanka’s foreign minister says the country will review its China-dependent foreign policy and boost ties with other nations.

title: NO nomination National List slot PM candidacy FOR MR
content: President Maithripala Sirisena’s stand was that ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa would not be made the Prime Ministerial candidate, nor be appointed as a National list MP nor be given nomination, Cabinet Spokesman, Health and Indigenous Medicine Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Turbulence on SriLankan flight; 5 crew members injured
content: At least five crew members were injured this morning when a SriLankan flight, flying from Paris to Colombo encountered severe turbulence, a Spokesman for the airline said.

title: Govt agrees to grant 41% Golden Key deposits
content: The Attorney General today informed the Supreme Court that the Cabinet has taken a decision to repay 41% of golden key depositors’ money.

title: JVP on protest march today
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) will be having a protest march today (18) demanding that the government respect the people’s mandate by fulfilling the many promises made to the masses, which they have presently put on the backburner.

title: Maithri says Mahinda won’t be UPFA’s PM candidate
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will never field former President Mahinda Rajapakasa as the UPFA’s prime ministerial candidate, according to highly placed SLFP sources.

title: Dhal prices reduced
content: The special commodity levy on imported Dhal has been reduced from Rs 5 to 25 cents per Kg while levy on oils – except coconut oil – has been increased from Rs 90 to 110 per kg from today.

title: No bail for Sajin
content: Parliamentarian Sajin De Vass Gunawardena and former Puttalam District Co-ordinating Secretary for the Jathika Saviya Programme attached to the Presidential Secretariat were produced before Fort Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage and have been further remanded till June 24.

title: Obama here by year end?
content: Plantation Industries Minister Lakshman Kiriella yesterday said that US President Barack Obama is to pay an official visit to Sri Lanka at the end of this year. He said the US President has promised to visit Sri Lanka at end of this year.

title: Sri Lanka forms task force to combat cyber harassment
content: Sri Lanka on Tuesday said it has formed a task force to combat cyber harassment. The Sri Lanka National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) said it has appointed the task force to combat the growing threat to children and young persons…

title: Vass Gunawardena granted bail
content: Former DIG Vaas Gunawardena and four others have been released on bail by Colombo High Courts, today (16).

title: Sri Lanka’s economic growth steady at 6.4% in 1Q 2015
content: Sri Lanka’s economy grew at an annual rate of 6.4 percent during the first quarter of this year, same rate as the last quarter of 2014, the Census and Statistics Department said on Monday.

title: Tony Ranasinghe passes away
content: Veteran actor Tony Ranasinghe has passed away at the age of 77 at a private hospital in Colombo.

title: Basil Released on Bail
content: MP Basil Rajapaksa has been granted bail by the Colombo High Court a short while ago.

title: New Air Force Chief appointed
content: Air Vice Marshal Gagan Bulathsinhala has been appointed as Commander of the Sri Lanka Air Force, the Air Force Spokesman said.

title: I will not enter active politics – Gota
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa said he would not enter active politics in the future.

title: No Cabinet approval for Port City – Ravi K.
content: The State-owned Chinese company that initiated the Colombo Port City Project worth US $ 1.4 billion has failed to produce the Cabinet approval and the vital environmental clearance certificate on the feasibility of the project, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: Mahinda ready to be PM candidate
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday said that he would accept the people’s invitation to contest the next general election as the prime ministerial candidate.

title: Chandrika slams ‘concocted’ CB reports
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga (CBK) rubbished claims yesterday that the country’s economy had grown 8 per cent during the tenure of the previous government.

title: Prageeth Ekneligoda’s wife thanks CID
content: Wife of missing journalist Prageeth Ekneligoda, Sandya Ekneligoda paid a short visit to Lake House yesterday. Ekneligoda who was unable to talk at length said she appreciates the work done by the Criinal Investigations Division (CID) in trying to find her husband.

title: Cabinet approves 20A with 237 parliamentary seats
content: Sri Lanka’s Cabinet of Ministers today approved a proposal to increase the number of seats in Parliament to 237, through the 20th amendment to the constitution.

title: Malaysia Airlines flight MH148 makes emergency landing at Melbourne airport
content: A Malaysia airlines Airbus A330 made an emergency landing at Melbourne’s Tullamarine airport on Friday after the failure of its starboard engine shortly after take-off.

title: Namal Rajapaksa questioned by CID
content: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has arrived at CID (Criminal Investigation Department) a short while ago, to record a statement, reliable sources reported.

title: JVP must end – Somawansa
content: Former JVP Leader Somawansa Amarasinghe addressing the media yesterday said the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) must come to an end because it is today a misguided political movement.

title: Sri Lanka to raise up to $2 bn in foreign borrowings
content: Sri Lanka’s new government plans to borrow up to $2.0 billion from overseas, the finance minister said Thursday, just two weeks after raising a billion through its first international bond issue.

title: Ex-PMs appointed as senior advisors to President
content: Former Prime Ministers, Ratnasiri Wickremanayake and D. M. Jayaratne were appointed as Senior Political Advisors to the President.

title: Australia denies officials paid refugee smugglers
content: Australian Foreign Minister Julie Bishop has denied claims by Indonesian police that Australian Customs officials paid thousands of dollars to people smugglers to take asylum seekers back to Indonesia, ABC News reported.

title: Ranil tells Opposition to pick no confidence motion or polls
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday urged the Opposition to select between a no confidence motion or general election rather than pursuing both and constantly criticising the Government for exceeding its 100-day mandate.

title: Four new Deputy Ministers sworn in
content: Four more MPs were sworn in as deputy ministers before President Maithripala Sirisena on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Education Policy should be further developed – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that we must further develop our education policy with a comprehensive understanding about national and international requirements.

title: Basil further remanded
content: Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and three other officials, who were arrested on charges of misappropriation of Divi Neguma funds, have been further remanded until June 18 by the Kaduwala Magistrate’s Court.

title: Australia ‘paid to turn back boat’ with Lankans
content: Australian officials had allegedly paid tens of thousands of dollars to people smugglers to turn a boat full of asylum seekers including Sri Lankan refugees back to Indonesia, Fairfax reported on Wednesday.

title: Revenue increased by 21 percent in first five months – Harsha
content: Internal revenue increased during the first five months this year by 21 percent in comparison to the corresponding period last year, Economic Affairs and Policy Planning Deputy Minister Harsha de Silva said yesterday.

title: We will survive no-confidence vote – Ravi
content: Sri Lanka’s finance minister has defended the pace of the country’s economic recovery, as a bruising vote of no confidence in the government looms.

title: China wants “stable” military ties with Sri Lanka

title: I will leave through the front door when I retire – PM

title: CID summons Namal Rajapaksa
content: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa, elder son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been issued notice to appear at the CID on 12 June.

title: 20th Amendment draft bill to be presented to cabinet

title: FCID illegal, therefore whole process not lawful, say counsel
content: Continuing submissions in the fundamental rights applications filed by former Economic Development Minister Basil Rajapaksa and three others, counsel for the petitioners argued that since the setting up of the Financial Crimes Investigation Department (FCID) has been illegal

title: Govt. reduces taxes on potatoes, big onion imports

title: Speaker suggests dissolving Parliament

title: Sajin further remanded
content: UPFA MP Sajin de Vass Gunawardane was further remanded till June 17 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage for allegedly misusing 23 vehicles belonging to the Presidential Secretariat.

title: President Sirisena has moved country away from divisive politics – US

title: Jaya writes Modi on arrest of Indian fishermen

title: Ex- CJ’s son slams Namal

title: ‘Maithri-Ranil reluctants to punish Rajapakshe family’

title: MR regime placed Rs. 2.7 trillion of Bonds privately for cronies benefit: PM

title: New Parliament by September – President

content: Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakkoday yesterday instructed authorities to ensure MP Sajin de Vaas Gunawardana is able to attend Parliamentary sittings and be provided with the necessary medical care….

content: Minister of Labour S.B. Nawinna announced that he has proposed to increase the wages of private sector employees from May 01.

title: TNA takes up four major issues with Kerry
content: Talks with U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry yesterday was mainly based on four major issues, Tamil National Alliance (TNA) Parliamentarian Suresh Premachandran said.

title: Armed soldier at President’s event arrested
content: The soldier who had allegedly had a weapon to the President’s meeting last month had been remanded till May 12, the Police said.

title: Let us build a righteous society with spiritual purification – PM
content: Let us fill our lives with morals, loving kindness and wisdom in this month of Vesak where the entire environment looks fresh and serene to celebrate thrice blessed day for Buddhists as it commemorates the birth of Buddha, his attaining Enlightenment and his passing away into Nirvana.

title: Getting closer to Dharma will help build a society of maithriya, goodwill – President
content: It is with the much tranquility of devotion that I send this message on the occasion of the Triple Festival of Vesak, which comes with the Buddha’s message of compassion to all beings, President Maithripala Sirisena stated in a message to mark Vesak.

title: John Kerry praises Sri Lanka on reforms and pledges renewed ties with US
content: Secretary of State John Kerry on Saturday championed the new Sri Lankan government’s push for democratic reform and promised closer ties with the strategically located Indian Ocean nation.

title: ​Kerry in Sri Lanka
content: US Secretary of State John Kerry arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago. It is the first time in a decade that a US secretary of state has visited Sri Lanka.

title: Give another chance to the people – Anura Kumara
content: JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake today urged President Maithripala Sirisena to dissolve parliament soon and give another chance for the people to elect suitable parliamentarians, while requesting the president not to listen to those who opposed him earlier including present Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala.

title: Five jailed in The Hague for supporting LTTE
content: Five Dutch nationals of Sri Lankan origin have been jailed for between 19 months and six years three months for raising money for the Tamil Tigers (LTTE), Dutch News reported yesterday.

title: President’s May Day Message
content: I am pleased to send this message on the occasion of May Day – International Workers Day, expressing the solidarity of the working people of Sri Lanka with workers throughout the world.

title: May Day Message of the Prime Minister
content: We must line-up to build our country, through a sustainable development process and to make the lives of our people prosperous. Workers are the pioneers of that process. We all are well aware of the truth that, their labour is decisive in making the future of a country, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe issuing the May Day message.

title: Sri Lanka economy grows 7.4% in 2014: CB Report
content: Sri Lanka’s economy grew by 7.4% (Agriculture 0.3%, Industry 11.4%, service 6.5%) last year, according to the Annual Report of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka for the year 2014 which was launched today.

title: Sigiriya girl released
content: S. Udaya Sri the girl serving a two year prison sentence for scribbling on the Sigiriya Mirror wall who received a Presidential pardon has been released a short while ago.

title: Rathgama PS Chairman murder weapon found
content: Rathgama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Manoj Pushpakumara Mendis was shot dead in a hotel in the Wewala area in Hikkaduwa on 23 March midnight, whilst two other individuals were critically injured in the incident.

title: Kerry hopes to reset US relations with Sri Lanka
content: A senior U.S. State Department official said Wednesday that Secretary of State John Kerry was traveling to Sri Lanka to show that the U.S. “applauds the vision” of that country’s new government.

title: Namal votes himself out of Sri Lanka 2021 presidential race
content: Former president’s eldest son and the Rajapaksa clan’s heir apparent, MP Namal may have voted himself out of the 2021 presidential election by supporting the 19th amendment to the constitution.

title: 19A shuts out Gota
content: The 19th Amendment to the Constitution, which was passed in Parliament on Tuesday with an overwhelming majority, has barred former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa from contesting Parliamentary elections.

title: Jacqueline demands Rs. 4 crore to dance at a wedding
content: Sri Lanka’s Jacqueline Fernandez has accepted an offer to perform at a high-profile wedding in London and has quoted Rs. 4 crore to shake a leg.

title: Hambantota Mayor arrested
content: Hambantota Mayor Eraj Fernando arrested for allegedly attempting to assault a suspect in police custody in March, 2014, Police spokesman told media.

title: Thank You Everyone for Contributing towards Passing 19A – President
content: The adoption of the 19th amendment to the constitution with two-thirds majority is a historic victory of Sri Lankan society says President Maithripala Sirisena. This victory is the result of a 37-year long struggle of all active citizens of Sri Lanka.

title: All contributed for 19A – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that all in the parliament contributed to the historic 19th Amendment that made the executive president responsible to the Parliament through the Cabinet following the passage of the Amendment.

title: 19th Amendment passed with a vast majority
content: The 19th Amendment to the Constitution was passed with a vast majority in Parliament, a short while ago on Tuesday (28), with the government gaining 211 votes in favor of the amendment while 01 voted against it, 01 member abstained from voting. 10 members were absent.

title: Second reading of 19th Amendment passed in Parliament
content: The second reading of the 19th Amendment to Constitution was passed in Parliament with a majority of 214 votes, a short while ago, with 215 members voting for and a single vote against.

title: DG Kumarage elected as Kataragama Basnayake Nilame
content: Kandy businessman D.G Kumarage was elected uncontested as the 11th Basnayaka Nilame of the Ruhunu Kataragama Maha Devalaya this morning.

title: Basil granted 3 months leave
content: Parliament has approved three(03) months leave for MP Basil Rajapaksa commencing from today (28). The approval was granted on a proposal made by Opposition leader Nimal Siripala De Silva.

title: Another committee to probe cricket
content: Sports Minister Navin Dissanayake felt confident that Sri Lanka’s present issues with International Cricket Council (ICC) could easily be resolved through dialogue and reiterated that ICC must understand and accept the real situation in Sri Lanka.

title: Kerry to make historic trips to Sri Lanka, Kenya, Djibouti
content: US Secretary of State John Kerry will make historic first official visits to Sri Lanka, Kenya and Djibouti in the coming days.

title: Militant involved in Sri Lanka cricket team attack in Lahore killed
content: Three wanted Taliban terrorists, including one militant involved in the attack on Sri Lankan Cricket team in Lahore, were killed today by the Pakistan security forces during an operation near Lahore, officials said.

title: Historic moment where modern-day slavery will be abolished – Wijedasa
content: The next two days will be a historic moment for all Sri Lankans, Justice Minister Wijedasa Rajapaksa said in parliament today. He added that with the 19th amendment to the constitution Sri Lankans will finally be rid of modern-day slavery.

title: Don’t bypass historic opportunity: President on 19A
content: In his address to Parliament prior to the debate on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution, President Maithripala Sirisena said he was the only President who had been so flexible and committed to reducing or curtailing the absolute powers of the executive presidency.

title: Sri Lankan rescue team leaves for Nepal
content: A Sri Lankan team left for Nepal from Colombo on Sunday to assist in rescue and relief operations, following the earthquake on Saturday that left over 2,000 people dead and 5,000 others injured.

title: Ven. Sobhitha’s satyagraha today – In support of 19 A
content: The Convener of the National Movement for Social Justice, Ven. Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera will commence a satyagraha today at the Independence Square demanding political parties to pass the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.

title: Popular actor Daya Alwis passes away
content: Popular actor Daya Alwis who was being treated at hospital following an accident last week passed away this morning, Director of the Jayawardenapura hospital told media. He was aged 72 at the time of demise.

title: End of executive presidency?
content: The parliamentary debate on the country’s most- awaited piece of legislation in decades, the 19th Amendment to the Constitution, begins tomorrow morning with the nation holding its breath as to the outcome.

title: Kerry here Saturday; will open Vesak pandal
content: United States Secretary of State John Kerry is to arrive in Sri Lanka on Saturday for a 24-hour visit, Foreign Ministry officials said.  It is the first official visit to Sri Lanka by a US Secretary of State since the visit of William Pierce Rogers in July 1972.

title: Rohit praises Malinga for match-winning performance
content: Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma on Saturday heaped praise on pacer Lasith Malinga for keeping things simple enroute his match-winning performance against Sunrisers Hyderabad in their Indian Premier League (IPL) encounter.

title: Nepal seeks help, death toll seen rising after devastating quake
content: Nepal urged countries to send aid to help it cope with the aftermath of a devastating earthquake that killed nearly 1,400 people, a toll predicted to rise as rescuers used their hands to dig for survivors among the rubble on Sunday.

title: Import tax on potatoes and big onions increased
content: The import tax on potatoes has been increased from Rs 40 to Rs 55 per kilogram and big onions increased from Rs 10 to Rs 30 per kilogram with effect from today, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: 10 UPFA MPs noticed by Colombo Magistrate
content: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today issued notice on 27 persons including 10 UPFA Parliamentarians to appear before the court on May 8 on contempt of court charges, after they violated a court order and staged a protest opposite the bribery commission.

title: Bribery DG won’t be replaced – Justice Minister
content: Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe, PC, yesterday said that Mrs Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe, Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) wouldn’t be removed.

title: Sri Lanka central bank head resumes duty after bond probe report
content: Sri Lanka’s central bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran has resumed his duties after a more than five-week voluntary leave of absence after being cleared by a panel investigating a controversial government bond auction.

title: Wigneswaran seeks release of 3 Indians in Premananda case
content: CHENNAI: Chief minister of Sri Lanka’s Tamil-majority Northern Province C V Wigneswaran has requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to release three life convicts in the sensational Swamy Premananda case.

title: ‘My aim was to avoid exercising excessive powers’
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, addressing the nation last night, said his intention was not to use unlimited executive powers that are vested in his position.

title: SLFP to support 19th ammendment
content: The SLFP Central Committee has unanimously decided to vote in favor of the 19th amendment to the Constitution a short while ago, Minister Rajitha Senaratne told media.

title: Cabinet approves draft bills on Right to Information and National Audit
content: The draft bills on ‘Right to Information’ and ‘National Audit’ have been approved by the cabinet on ministers, Cabinet Spokesman Rajith Senaratne said.

title: Sri Lanka Government marks completion of 100 days today
content: The Government of Sri Lanka led by President Maithripala Sirisena marks the completion of 100 days, today (23).

title: Gotabaya Rajapaksa at Bribery Commission
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrived at the Bribery Commission this morning as he was summoned to record statements over various allegations.

title: Basil remanded along with Ministry Secretary and DG Divineguma
