content: The election of Sri Lanka Freedom Party’s (SLFP) renegade Maithripala Sirisena as the 6th Executive President of the Sri Lanka and the formation of a government under the moderate Political leader, Ranil Wickramasinghe of the United National Party (UNP) as the 17th Prime Minister augers well for the country

title: Susil reveals country’s next Premier
content: Newly appointed national organizer of the SLFP Susil Premajayantha who assumed duties in his post today said the SLFP will not remain in the Opposition following the forthcoming General Election.

title: Australia returns four boat arrivals
content: Four Sri Lankan nationals have been returned home after being intercepted by an Australian border protection vessel off the Cocos (Keeling) Islands.

title: CID allowed to detain Wele Suda till March 23
content: The Colombo High Court today granted permission to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) to interrogate notorious drug baron Samantha Kumara alias ‘Wele Suda’ under detention orders till March 23.

title: Supereme Court issues notice on former President
content: A Supreme Court bench presided over by Chief Justice K. Sripavan yesterday issued notice on former President Mahinda Rajapaksa returnable on March 31.

title: Sri Lanka says China “port city” broke rules
content: Sri Lanka’s prime minister said on Wednesday a $1.5 billion luxury real estate deal with China was signed without cabinet approval and without following procedures, and launched a new investigation to uncover any corruption.

title: Basil gets three months leave
content: Former minister and UPFA Parliamentarian Basil Rajapaksa was permitted to not attend Parliament for the next three months.

title: Thewarapperuma released on bail
content: Remanded UNP parliamentarian Palitha Thewarapperuma was released on bail by the Matugama Magistrate’s Court today.

title: US welcomes civil nuclear pact between India and Sri Lanka
content: The United States has welcomed the signing of civil nuclear cooperation agreement between India and Sri Lanka, saying it is consistent with IAEA safeguards and other international standards and practices.

title: Sri Lankan murder suspect eligible for protection visa in Australia
content: A Sri Lankan man who came to Australia by boat has been found to be eligible for a protection visa, although he is suspected of murder in his home country.

title: Petrol consumption doubles, economic activity accelerates
content: A Ceylon Petroleum Corporation think-tank is in constant deliberation to continue fuel supplies countrywide without interruption after petrol consumption doubled with the recent price reduction, a top official said.

title: Happy to see friendly ties between India and Sri Lanka: China
content: China today reacted guardedly to new Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena’s India visit, saying it is “happy to see” close and friendly relations between them and emphasised that sound ties among the three nations will be conducive to the entire region.

title: Mangala to make first China visit post election
content: Sri Lanka’s foreign minister will visit China next week in the highest-level trip to Beijing by a member of the new government, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday, as China seeks to ensure the safety of its investments there.

title: Former Presidential Transport Director arrested
content: Former director of the Transport division of the Presidential Secretariat, Keerthi Samarakoon has been arrested by the Police in connection with the missing of three luxury vehicles of the Presidential Secretariat.

title: ‘Spirit of Maha Shivarathri will add more strength in quest for unity’ – President
content: The Hindus of Sri Lanka, who have a long tradition of friendship and harmony with all other communities in Sri Lanka will gain more strength in their search for unity through reconciliation and understanding with the spirit of Maha Shivarathri festival, President Maithripala Sirisena issuing a message to mark the festival said.

title: Gota not a VIP anymore – Ravi
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said that former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa cannot be given equal treatment during CID interrogation because he is now an ordinary citizen and not a VIP anymore.

title: UN rights chief requests ‘one time only’ deferral of key report on Sri Lanka conflict
content: At the request of the top United Nations rights official, the Geneva-based UN Human Rights Council today agreed to temporarily hold off its consideration of a long-awaited report into alleged rights violations during the conflict in Sri Lanka for six months, until September 2015.

title: Chinese tourists to Sri Lanka grow 8.9% in Jan
content: Chinese tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka kicked off the new year positively, growing by 8.9 percent in January, latest data showed Monday.

title: Piliyandala bank robbed by men in full face helmets
content: A private bank in Piliyandala has been robbed by two unidentified individuals, this afternoon, the police said.

title: 26 tractors used to smuggle in heroin apprehended
content: 26 tractors that were allegedly used to smuggle in heroin to Sri Lanka by Wele Suda were found in a warehouse in the Sinharamulla area in Kelaniya in a raid carried out by the Police Narcotic Bureau.

title: Sri Lanka President meets PM Narendra Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met visiting Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena at the Hyderabad House, this morning. Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj earlier called on the visiting dignitary.

title: Pope Francis returns donation, requests local church to help poor
content: A gift of a cash donation of more than Rs. 8.7 million given by the Catholic Bishops was given back to Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith by the Pontiff, the Archdiocesan Monthly Bulletin ‘Koinonia’ reported.

title: India, Sri Lanka may sign nuclear agreement
content: NEW DELHI: India and Sri Lanka will seek to open a new chapter in ties on Monday with a meeting between PM Narendra Modi and Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena who has chosen India for his maiden visit abroad as president. In a likely big takeaway from the visit, India and Sri Lanka will sign a civil nuclear cooperation agreement.

title: Not even SLFP can stop Rajapaksa becoming PM – NFF
content: The National Freedom Front (NFF) yesterday said the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) cannot halt its strategy, of fielding former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as the Prime Ministerial candidate, at the General Election, to defeat the United National Party (UNP).

title: Sri Lanka president arrives in India on first foreign trip
content: Sri Lanka’s new president arrived in India Sunday on his first foreign trip in office, trying to rebuild ties hit by tensions over growing Chinese influence on the strategically located island.

title: President Sirisena leaves on official visit
content: Making the first overseas visit as the President of Sri Lanka, President Maithripala Sirisena left for India a short while ago for three-day official visit, the President’s Office said.

title: Anura meets vehicle importers
content: No monopoly should be allowed to be developed in the country states the JVP leader Anura Dissanayake. He states an economy should allow an economic procedure that ensures stable profits instead of extensive profits for the entrepreneurs.

title: Muslims Want Panel to Probe Hate Campaign
content: Faiszer Musthapha, MP of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) and Azath Sally, Member of the Central Provincial Council, has asked President Maithripala Sirisena to appoint a commission to inquire into the “hate campaign and violence” against Muslims in the last four years and take appropriate measures to ensure that all Sri Lankans are protected.

title: Only PM Can Speak On Port City
content: The National Executive Committee has decided that only Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe can make statements on the controversial Colombo Port City project.

title: Questioning “Final Days of War” “”…” British and American accountability for Dresden and Hiroshima bombings
content: “Final days of war” and accountability is the hot topic in the diplomatic and international arena. Let us ask the Germans and the Japanese what they thought of when the Allied Troops flattened Dresden the night prior to Valentine’s Day in 1945 in a 2 night blanket bombing using 3,300 tons of high explosive and 1,500 tons of incendiary bombs that had no strategic goals except to murder 35,000 (some argue it is far more) German civilians

title: Kabir was wrong to order UGC head to resign – Rajiva
content: State Minister of Higher Education Prof. Rajiva Wijesinghe today said that it is “completely wrong” to bow down to pressure from groups and remove the UGC Chairperson, without even probing the allegations against her.

title: Cricket World Cup begins with New Zealand, Australian wins
content: Australia and New Zealand easily won the opening matches at the Cricket World Cup on Saturday in an ideal start for the tournament co-hosts. Still to come: 47 more games and six weeks of competition before the title is decided.

title: Susil appointed as national organizer of SLFP
content: The Executive Committee of Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has appointed MP Susil Premajayantha as the National Organizer of the party.

title: President orders reinstatement of 10 army officers
content: President Maithripala Sirisena ordered to reinstate 10 military officers including a Major General who were sent on compulsory retirement after the 2010 presidential elections, military spokesman Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera said.

title: “Delhi must push Colombo on devolution” – Sampanthan
content: New Delhi must continue pushing Colombo towards the implementation of the 13th Amendment, senior Tamil leader R. Sampanthan said.

title: Sri Lanka minister meets U.N. chief, urges war crimes report delay
content: Sri Lanka’s foreign minister met with U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Friday, and U.N. diplomatic sources said he pressed his government’s desire to delay the release of a U.N. report on alleged war crimes during his country’s civil war.

title: Sri Lanka v New Zealand: first game of Cricket World Cup at Hagley Oval in Christchurch
content: The wait is finally over, with co-hosts New Zealand taking on Sri Lanka in the first match of the 2015 World Cup. The Black Caps go into the tournament with an unusually large amount of expectation on their shoulders following a superb run of performances over the past few months.

title: Sri Lanka in a new direction towards peace and prosperity – John Kerry
content: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera Thursday met Secretary of State John Kerry at the Department of State for an hour-long discussion.

title: Government to release 1,000 acres of lands in North
content: The government has decided to release lands extending to 1,000 acres in the Northern high security zones (HSZs) in several stages to civilians.

title: CID records statement from Gotabhaya
content: The CID has recorded a statement from former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa today about the armouires maintained by Avant-Garde Security Services Limited and also the activities of Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Ltd.

title: FM challenges former Defence Secretary to declare his assets
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake on Thursday (12) challenged former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa to submit the latter’s statement of assets and liabilities by Friday (13) morning.

title: Fire at Karapitiya Hospital
content: A fire broke out in a building of Karapitiya teaching Hospital last night at around 11 p.m. and police said no casualties reported. Police says the building where the fire broke out is the canteen of the hospital.

title: Returning Malinga wants to close out New Zealand
content: New Zealand need only refer to their most recent match at a Cricket World Cup to realise the threat posed by Sri Lankan pace bowler Lasith Malinga.

title: TNA divided over Wigneswaran’s call for genocide probe
content: The Illankai Thamil Arasu Kadchi (ITAK) led Tamil National Alliance (TNA) run Northern Provincial Council (NPC) has reiterated its call for a UN investigation into what it calls genocide committed by successive Sri Lankan governments since 1948, in spite of Mavai S. Senathirajah, General Secretary of both organisations, ruling out a wider UN role here.

title: MP Duminda Silva to be questioned for third day
content: CID has summoned MP Duminda Silva to appear at the CID for the third day for further questioning, Police said.

title: China official says Colombo Port City project going ahead
content: The China-funded port city project in Colombo was going ahead, a top Chinese official from the company executing it said Wednesday, days after the new Sri Lankan government claimed the deal was still being assessed.

title: Sri Lanka orders release of fishing boats ahead of President Sirisena’s visit to India
content: RAMESWARAM: The Tamil Nadu fishermen breathed a sigh of relief on Wednesday evening when they received news that the Sri Lankan government has ordered the release of all the Indian fishing boats.

title: JVP approves no-faith motion
content: Despite not being consulted with regards to the no-faith motion brought against Minister of Public Security, John Amaratunga, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) yesterday said the party approved of the move.

title: President should dissolve Northern Provincial Council on Genocide Claim
content: It cannot be a coincidence that immediately following the visits to the North by US and British officials that the Northern Provincial Council has passed a Resolution claiming genocide by Sri Lanka. What needs to be reiterated is that the common enemy of Sri Lanka and its people was the LTTE which was militarily vanquished by the Armed Forces in May 2009.

title: Five including a child killed in an accident
content: Five people were killed when a bus and a three wheeler collided in Udamalala, Hambantota. A small child is also among the victims.

title: Can’t call it ‘genocide’: Rajitha
content: Terming the resolution an ‘extremist position,’ Health Minister and Cabinet spokesman Rajitha Senaratne said President Maithripala Sirisena had promised to initiate an internationally approved, domestic inquiry process into alleged war crimes committed by Sri Lankan Army and the LTTE.

title: President Sirisena ushers new chapter of hope for Sri Lanka – NY Times
content: It was just one month ago that Sri Lanka surprised the world by electing opposition candidate Maithripala Sirisena as president, rejecting the authoritarianism, corruption and dynastic politics of the administration of the incumbent, Mahinda Rajapaksa. President Sirisena has moved swiftly to usher in a new chapter of hope for Sri Lanka.

title: Tissa Attanatake released on bail
content: Parliamentarian Tissa Attanayake released on bail by Fort  Magistrate short while ago. Attanayake was remanded for his alleged involvement in creating forged documents.

title: Sarana Gunawardena released on bail
content: UPFA MP Sarana Gunawardena was released on Rs.150,000 cash bail with a surety of Rs. 60 million by the Colombo Chief Magistrate today in the case where he had allegedly been involved in 107 frauds including Rs.36 million fraud while he was the National Lotteries Board Chairman.

title: CID to interrogate MP Duminda Silva again
content: UPFA Parliamentarian R. Duminda Silva is to be summoned to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) today for further questioning on money laundering charges.

title: Sri Lanka announces pension scheme for expat workers
content: The Sri Lankan government is set to provide a pension scheme to its overseas workers, if the workers complete two years of foreign employment.

title: Susanthika gets order blocking movie about her
content: The Colombo District Court issued a permanent injunction preventing the producer and director of the film called “Susima” from producing, screening and taking any further steps whatever in connection with the film which purportedly depicts the life story of Sri Lankan sprint champion Susanthika Jayasinghe.

title: Unofficial armories in Hambantota – Sajith
content: Samurdhi and Housing Minister, Sajith Premadasa, yesterday in Parliament requested the Minister of Defence to investigate two unofficial armouries allegedly being operated at Beliatta and Weeraketiya.

title: CID records statements from Dayasiri and Anura Yapa
content: Statements have been recorded from SLFP General Secretary and former minister Anura Priyadharshana Yapa by the CID over alleged  forged document case of UNP’s former General Secrretary Tissa Attanayake.

title: $58.3 Million held in Swiss accounts by 92 Sri Lankans
content: Ninety-two Sri Lankan citizens hold a total of $58.3 million in 129 Swiss bank accounts, according to data released by the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ) and leaked by an HSBC whistleblower.

title: Sudharman further remanded
content: Colombo Additional Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage today ordered former ITN News Director Sudarman Radaliyagoda to be remanded till February 24.

title: Duminda Silva grilled by CID for 6 hours
content: Police said 60 percent of 82 accounts of MP Duminda Silva has been investigated so far. SSP Ajith Rohana said MP Silva was questioned by the CID for over six hours this morning.

title: New national policy for tourism industry
content: Plans are under way to prepare a new national policy for the tourism industry in Sri Lanka, Tourism and Sports Minister Navin Dissanayake said.

title: Sri Lanka call up fast bowler Chameera for World Cup
content: Sri Lanka have called fast bowler Dushmantha Chameera into their World Cup squad as replacement for the injured Dhammika Prasad, Cricinfo reported on Monday.

title: President to appoint probe corruption
content: President Maithripala Sirisena expressed his dismay at the delay in taking legal action against those who embezzled public money. Speaking at a rally held in Aralaganwila yesterday, he added that he will use his powers and appoint a special presidential commission to investigate alleged corruption.

title: 4 killed, 13 injured after a lorry topples in Mannar
content: Four people were killed and thirteen injured when a lorry toppled at the Ehelagahawanguwa on the Medawachchiya — Vavuniya road this evening, police said.

title: Mahinda Kahanda Gamage arrested
content: Self-Employed Persons Federation’s President Mahinda Kahanda Gamage has been arrested by the Fraud Investigation Unit of the Wellawatte police, this afternoon.

title: Parliament dissolution this week?
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday that Parliament would be dissolved straightaway if the government failed to defeat the no-confidence motion against Public Order, Disaster Management and Christian Affairs Minister John Amaratunga.

title: Northern expressway: Rs 245 Billion brought down by Rs 60 Billion
content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake, in a startling revelation, said that the Northern expressway, for which the bids from the five contractors had been estimated at Rs 245 Billion, during the previous regime had overnight reduced by Rs 60 Billion!

title: Former BBC producer to make film promoting reconciliation in Sri Lanka
content: A former BBC television producer is raising money to fund a film promoting reconciliation in Sri Lanka after decades of civil war. Chris Langdon, who lives in Lambolle Road, Belsize Park, recently returned from Sri Lanka having shot a trailer for Healing The Wounds, a film exploring the relationships between the country’s different communities since the war ended in 2009.

title: Sri Lanka Marxist party calls on new government to cancel Colombo Port City project
content: Sri Lanka’s Marxist party, Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) vows to continue pushing the new government to permanently halt the controversial Chinese funded Colombo Port City project.

title: ‘Sri Lanka’s bowling attack not solely dependant on Malinga’
content: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews Sunday dismissed the notion that Sri Lanka were a one-man bowling attack, relying on pacer Lasith Malinga to carry his team’s bowling hopes.

title: Malik Samarawickrama new UNP Chairman
content: Malik Samarawickrama, a onetime General Secretary of the UNP has been appointed as the new Chairman of the party today.

title: Lasith Malinga to face New Zealand in World Cup opener
content: Lasith Malinga is not 100 per cent fit but says he will play in the Cricket World Cup opener against New Zealand today.

title: Bypassing Cabinet, Rajapaksa paid Rs. 1.39b to US firms and middleman
content: The Presidential Secretariat, under the previous UPFA Government, paid a staggering Rs. 1.39 billion to a middleman and two public relations agencies in the United States to promote Sri Lanka and lobby on behalf of the former Government.

title: Opposition Leader against hasty electoral reforms
content: Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala De Silva said his party would not support any hasty electoral reforms before the next parliamentary elections as there was barely any time to effect comprehensive changes to ensure fair representation in Parliament, electorate-wise.

title: Hybrid vehicle tax unfair by individuals – AKD
content: Democratic National Alliance Leader, MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake alleged in Parliament yesterday that the newly imposed Hybrid vehicle tax was unfair on individuals buying Hybrid vehicles for personal use through small scale car dealers.

title: Interim Budget 2015 passed
content: Second Reading of the Budget 2015 was passed with a majority of 163 votes with only one member voting against it.

title: President invites China to invest more in Sri Lanka
content: While expressing hope that China would assist Sri Lanka in its development endeavors in the future too, President Maithripala Sirisena invited Chinese government as well as private companies to increase investment in Sri Lanka when the Chinese President’s Special Envoy and Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mr. Liu Jianchao called on the President yesterday (06).

title: Two VAT scam absconders caught in Malaysia
content: Two Sri Lankans convicted over a major VAT scam case have been brought from Malaysia to Sri Lanka last night, the Police said.

title: Sri Lankan Parliamentarians cannot be politicians and practicing lawyers
content: For the good governance mantra to have any effect it must be practiced in its truest form. Sri Lanka’s Parliament has an abundance of qualified lawyers both in the Opposition and Government and a majority of them are practicing law.

title: US security adviser Rice pledges help for Sri Lanka ‘transition’
content: The United States pledged on Friday to assist Sri Lanka’s new government in creating a more open and democratic society.

title: An Open Letter To President Sirisena
content: I thank you, Mr. President for your bold attempt and resolve to bring back rule of law, good governance, minimize corruption and bring to book perpetrators of vices that were lacking in our country for the last decade.

title: Foreign Minister Samaraweera to speak on Sri Lanka – US relations in Washington
content: Sri Lanka’s new Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera will discuss Sri Lanka – U.S. relations at a special briefing and reception on Thursday, February 12th from 6:30 – 7:30 pm at the National Press Club in Washington.

title: Two Police officers suspended
content: A sub inspector and sergeant attached to the Thambuttegema Police have been suspended from duty following the escape of a 15 year old suspect from Police custody on Wednesday (4).

title: Sri Lanka nixes Strauss-Kahn deal after paying $750,000
content: Sri Lanka’s new government Thursday said it was cutting ties with sex scandal plagued ex-IMF chief Dominique Strauss-Kahn after paying him $750,000 for being an advisor to attract foreign investment.

title: $1 Million bonus on offer for Sri Lanka
content: Sri Lanka’s cricket squad will receive a bonus of almost $1 million from the Government if they win the 50-over World Cup in Australia and New Zealand that starts next week.

title: National Drug Policy gets cabinet approval
content: The Cabinet approval has been granted for the proposed new National Medicinal Drug, Devises and Cosmetic Authority draft bill and it will be presented to the Parliament within next few days, Health and Indigenous Medicine Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: ‘All must unite to create a drug-free Sri Lanka’ – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena stressed that all the people must unite with commitment to face the challenge of creating a drug-free Sri Lanka which destroyed our society for long.

title: Travel ban on KP
content: Court of Appeal has issued an order preventing Kumaran Pathmanathan alias KP from leaving the country.

title: Upul Jayasuriya new BOI chairman
content: Top lawyer and outgoing Bar Association President Upul Jayasuriya has been appointed as the Chairman of the Board of Investments of Sri Lanka.

title: US may postpone UNHRC resolution against Sri Lanka
content: Keeping in view the delicate political situation in Sri Lanka, the United States may ask the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) to postpone the taking up of a resolution against it at its March session, informed sources in the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) told Express here on Wednesday.

title: Sri Lanka’s new president to visit India, steers away from China
content: Sri Lanka’s President Maithripala Sirisena will visit India on Feb. 16, his first state visit abroad, a government official said on Wednesday, part of efforts to repair relations with New Delhi which soured under the previous government.

title: Ragama train accident claims four lives
content: At least four people including a child were killed when a jeep collided with a train travelling from Matara to Vavuniya at the Batuwatte Railway Crossing in Ragama, a short while ago.

title: Veteran singer Sisira Senaratne passes away
content: Veteran singer and musician Sisira Senaratne has passed away today at the age of 79. He passed away at the Colombo National Hospital this morning, according to family members.

title: Queen wishes for National Day
content: Britain’s Queen Elizabeth today extended her wishes to President Maithripala Sirisena and Sri Lankans in view of the country’s 67th Independence Day.

title: Indian PM Modi greets people of Sri Lanka on their 67th Independence Day
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended greetings to the people of Sri Lanka, on their 67th Independence Day.

title: TransAsia crash: Twelve dead as plane crashes into Taiwan river
content: At least 12 people have died after a TransAsia Airways plane clipped a bridge and crashed into a river near the Taiwanese capital, Taipei.

title: EU ban suspended for six months
content: Fisheries State Minister Dilip Wedaarachchi said yesterday the European Union’s ban on the export of fisheries products from Sri Lanka had been suspended for six months.

title: China, Sri Lanka traditionally friendly neighbours: Xi
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to his Sri Lanka counterpart Maithripala Sirisena to mark the 67th anniversary of the founding of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.

title: A special significance is the launch of a new era of good governance – President
content: The celebration of this 67th anniversary of our Independence is of special significance as it sees the launch of a new era of Good Governance in the country, President Maithripala Sirisena said in a message to mark Independence Day.

title: Our aim – a just and prosperous society – Ranil Wickremasinghe, PM
content: Today we are celebrating the 67th anniversary of Independence while a civilised political culture is being created in our beloved motherland, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in a message to mark Independence Day.

title: Indian President Mukherjee extends wishes to Sri Lanka on its Independence Day
content: Indian President Pranab Mukherjee on Tuesday extended his wishes to Sri Lanka on the eve of the island nation’s 67th Independence Day celebrations.

title: Omanthai closed
content: The Omanthai checkpoint which was open for several years after the end of the war has been officially closed today, according to our sources.

title: Hard earned freedom is at a risk – NFF
content: This country’s hard earned freedom is at an undeniable risk due to the current government’s 100 day program, says Leader of the National Freedom Front (NFF) Wimal Weerawansa.

title: US Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia Called on the President
content: US Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia, Mrs. Nisha Biswal, called on President Maithripala Sirisena Monday (02) afternoon at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: US says Sri Lanka faces difficult challenges ahead
content: The United States while congratulating the new Maithirpala Sirisena government on having accomplished much in a short space of time, yesterday cautioned that it faced difficult challenges ahead.

title: TISSA IN THE SLAMMER – REMANDED
content: Colombo Fort Acting Magistrate Jayantha Dias Nanayakkara yesterday remanded UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake until February 11, 2015.

title: Modi to visit Jaffna during Sri Lanka trip
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will travel to Sri Lanka in March, the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister to the island nation in over 25 years. During the visit, Mr. Modi is likely to travel to Jaffna in the Tamil-majority Northern Province, official sources in New Delhi told The Hindu.

title: No confidence motion against John Amaratunge
content: Opposition is to bring a no confidence motion against Minister of Public Order John Amaratunge stating he has failed to execute his duties properly in maintain law and order in the country.

title: Tissa Attanayake arrested
content: Former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, Police Spokesperson SSP Ajith Rohana said.

title: Sarana’s passport impounded
content: The passport of former Deputy Minister Sarana Gunawardena was impounded on a directive issued by the Colombo Chief Magistrate on a request made by the Bribery Commission.

title: President Sirisena has given hope to Tamils: Velayutham
content: The election of Maithripala Sirisena as the Sri Lankan President has offered a hope to the Tamils in Sri Lanka and they are able to move freely without the Army’s interruption, said K. Velayutham, Sri Lankan Minister of State for Plantation and Industry.

title: PLEASE, NO H.E FOR ME – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena on Saturday requested that the honorary title Athi Garu (His Excellency) or Uthumanan (Your Highness) which were commonly used over the past years to address Presidents, not be used with reference to him.

title: Faizer Mustapha flies to Singapore again!
content: It is reported that the State Minister of Aviation Faizer Mustapha has left to Singapore by flight number UL 308 of SriLankan Airlines yesterday (1st) evening.

title: US Assistant Secretary to arrive in Sri Lanka
content: The United States Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia Nisha Desai Biswal is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka on an official tour. She will arrive in the island on Sunday (February 01).

title: “I have not retired, resigned or vacated office:” Mohan Peiris
content: I have not retired, resigned or vacated my office of Chief Justice, but, due to exertions by external forces reinforced by an extra judicial chain of events, find myself displaced from office by an unconstitutional process having functioned continuously in my appointment for over two years.

title: Sri Lankan Airlines cabin crew member dies, 3 injured in Doha
content: A Sri Lankan Airlines female cabin crew member succumbed to injuries while 3 others were wounded when a vehicle on desert safari met with an accident in Doha, Qatar.

title: Canada welcomes reinstatement of Sri Lankan Chief Justice
content: The Canadian Government today welcomed the reinstatement of Shirani Bandaranayake as Chief Justice of the Sri Lankan Supreme Court while also expressing hope that President Maithripala Sirisena fulfills the mandate given to him by the people to foster a transparent, responsive and pluralistic government.

title: James Packer’s Crown pulls plug on $400m Sri Lanka casino plan after Colombo scraps tax concessions
content: James Packer’s Crown Group says it will not go ahead with a proposed plan to develop a $400 million luxury hotel and resort in Sri Lanka, following a decision by the government in Colombo to scrap tax concessions for the project.

title: IMPEACHMENT PROCEDURALLY FATAL – PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday stated that as there was a serious defect in the process of impeachment moved in Parliament against Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranaike, her removal by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was totally illegal.

title: Even Ravi Karunanayake has to pay Mansion Tax: JVP
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) said today Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayke should be aware that he too would have to pay the newly imposed ‘Mansion Tax’ of Rs.1 million.

title: EU to consider lifting fish import ban on Sri Lanka
content: The European Commission has offered Sri Lanka assistance to meet the regulatory requirements that would enable an early lifting of ban on fish exports from Sri Lanka to the EU, the Sri Lankan External Affairs Ministry said on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka hikes company taxes, says economy in ‘sad state’
content: Sri Lanka’s new government Thursday announced hefty taxes on top companies in a bid to raise revenue, accusing the previous regime of fudging the figures and leaving the economy in a “sad state”.

title: Removal of Mohan Peiris: PM to make special statement in Parliament
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in Parliament yesterday that the need to remove Mohan Peiris from the post of Chief Justice did not arise as he was not duly appointed. The Prime Minister said he would make a full statement in this connection in Parliament today.

title: Budget at a glance
content: Salaries of Government servant will be increased by Rs.10,000.  Rs.5000 will be given in February while the balance will be given in June.

title: MR’s sons no longer rugby team captains
content: Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa’s sons Yoshitha and Rohitha are to be removed from the captaincy of the Rugby teams of the Navy and Army respectively, on the instructions of a highly placed official, informed sources said yesterday.

title: MR, Namal should take legal action if falsely accused – More revelations pending – JVP
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and his son MP Namal Rajapaksa should take legal action if they can prove that they are being wrongfully accused of corruption, Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Western Provincial Councillor, Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Sri Lanka wins toss, bats in 7th ODI vs. New Zealand
content: WELLINGTON, New Zealand — Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bat Thursday in the seventh limited-overs cricket international against New Zealand, which holds an unbeatable 4-1 lead in the seven-match series.

title: All Ranks, Privileges & Pension Restored for General (Retd) Sarath Fonseka
content: Entitlement to wearing of all decorations of General Sarath Fonseka, former Chief of Defence Staff and Commander of the Army, has been restored, following the full Presidential amnesty granted by President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Shirani assumes duties as CJ; will retire tomorrow
content: The Government has removed all obstacles for Chief Justice Dr. Shirani Bandaranayaka to hold her position as the 43rd Chief Justice of Sri Lanka, Bar Association President Upul Jayasuriya said. She has assumed duites and will retire from her post tomorrow, Jayasuriya added.

title: UK Minister Hugo Swire to visit Sri Lanka
content: The UK Minister of State at the Foreign and Commonwealth Office Hugo Swire is paying a second visit to Sri Lanka from 28-30 January, shortly after the formation of a new government, the UK High Commission in Colombo said in a release today.

title: Peshala Jayaratne sworn in as NCP Chief Minister
content: Peshala Jayaratne was sworn in as the Chief Minister of the North Central Province before the North Central Provincial Governor P.B. Dissanayaka, a short-while ago.

title: 157 Sri Lankan asylum seekers legally detained at sea
content: A group of 157 Sri Lankan asylum seekers were legally detained at sea by Australian authorities last year, the High Court finds.

title: Obama sees new hope in Sri Lanka
content: The President of the United States, Barack Obama, notes that there is new hope for democracy in Sri Lanka and that India can help countries like Sri Lanka forge a better future.

title: Sobhitha thera tells CJ to quit
content: The National Movement for Social Justice (NMSJ) yesterday requested Chief Justice (CJ) Mohan Peiris to step down from his post with dignity.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa speaks out
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday alleged that a concerted effort was being made to tarnish his image and that of his family as well as the previous UPFA government.

title: Court orders probe on bank accounts of Duminda Silva
content: Police have obtained a court order to investigate financial accounts of Colombo District Parliamentarian Duminda Silva.

title: Bus fares to be reduced by 8 – 10%
content: Bus fares will be reduced by 8-10% from February 1, the Minister of Internal Transport Ranjith Maddumabandara announced a short while ago. Maddumabandara added that the minimum fare has been reduced from Rs. 9 to Rs. 8.

title: Facebook and Instagram are Down
content: Facebook and Instagram, the image sharing platform owned by Facebook, went down around 11:50AM IST on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka to limit the term of Presidency to 5 years – President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena  said that the term of office of the President of Sri Lanka will be reduced to five years from the original six when the new amendments to the Constitutions are proposed.

title: Shashi Weerawansa’s passport under CID probe
content: The CID has launched an inquiry into the controversial diplomatic passport alleged to have been obtained by former minister Wimal Weerawansa’s wife Shashi Weerawansa by producing false information.

title: Modi is Very Interested in Lanka, Says Ranil
content: COLOMBO: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said here on Monday, that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is ‘very interested’ in Sri Lanka and the region, and that this augurs well for Sri Lanka which is in the threshold of a new era.

title: Sri Lanka Central Bank keeps policy rates steady at record lows
content: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank kept key policy rates steady at record lows for an 12th straight month on Tuesday, as expected, and said inflation was expected to ease further….

title: 3 month travel ban for Mahindananda
content: The Bribery Commission has ordered the Department of Immigration and Emigration to impound the passport of former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage….

title: Vass’s wife complains against Shiranthi
content: Former DIG Vass Gunawardena’s wife, Shyamali Priyadarshani Perera, today alleged that her husband was arrested under “false charges” due to him spearheading an investigation into a conspiracy to sell 100kg of gold belonging to the treasury and its direct links to the former First lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa.

title: JVP committee to probe ‘Rajapaksa’ atrocities
content: A committee to probe those who have been penalized and subjected to unfair treatment by Rajapaksa regime’ has been established by the JVP to collect data regarding those who have been penalized and subjected to unfair treatment during the tenure of Rajapaksa regime..

title: Six Senior DIGs shuffled
content: Senior DIG in charge of Western Province Anura Senanayake has been transferred to serve as the Senior DIG of Police Headquarters while Northern Province Senior DIG Pujitha Jayasundara has been appointed as Western Province Senior DIG….

title: PM to submit report on how to counter UNHRC allegations
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was planning to submit a comprehensive Cabinet paper on how the government should counter allegations against Sri Lanka in the report of an investigation conducted by Office of High Commissioner for Human Rights to be presented for the consideration of UN Human Rights Council..

title: Modi, Obama walk the talk on nuke deal
content: INDIA: A hotline that will now connect Prime Minister Narendra Modi and U.S. President Obama, a declaration of friendship, a renewed ten-year defence partnership, and the much anticipated nuclear breakthrough marked the second summit between the two leaders..

title: Dissolution of Parliament would prevent implementation of promises – President
content: President Maithripala Sirsena yesterday said he can dissolve Parliament at any time after discussions with the United National Party and other parties which helped elect him President, adding that such a dissolution would prevent the implementation of what he promised to the people at the last Presidential election.

title: Fonseka To Contest Next Polls
content: Former army commander Sarath Fonseka says he will contest the next general election having been acquitted of all charges filed against him under the previous government and has been granted complete amnesty by President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: I will contest at the next General Election- Dayasiri
content: Chief Minister of the North Western Province Dayasiri Jayasekara said that he has decided to contest at the next General Election under the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) ticket.

title: Mega projects to be re-assessed
content: All mega projects launched by the previous Government under concessionary loan schemes will be re-evaluated, re-assessed and re-prioritised following a decision by the Cabinet of Ministers on Wednesday….

title: Ajith Dias appointed Chairman of SriLankan Airlines
content: Former Chairman of Sri Lanka Apparel, Ajith Dias, has been appointed as the new Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, sources said….

title: Statements obtained from Prof Peiris and Gammanpila over alleged coup attempt: Police
content: Police headquarters state that they have statements from both former minister Professor G.L Peiris and former Provincial Minister Udaya Gammanpila regarding the alleged coup attempt said to have taken place on the night of the presidential election.

title: CID records statement from CJ
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) has recorded a statement from Chief Justice Mohan Peiris regarding the regarding a coup attempt, which was allegedly hatched at Temple Trees while election results were being announced on January 9 morning.

title: Govt to increase public sector wages
content: Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake today said that the salaries of government sector employees will be increased by Rs 5,000 from the interim budget on January 29.

title: Seychelles is ‘open to assist’ Sri Lanka with Rajapaksa money-laundering investigation
content: The government of Seychelles has said it will assist with all formal requests for an investigation into the assets of Sri Lanka’s former president.

title: 24 Hour water cut in Colombo
content: A 24-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in Colombo and its suburbs from 8 a.m. Saturday (24) to 8 a.m. Sunday (25).

title: 53 VIP vehicles found in Kotte vehicle yard
content: A suspicious vehicle yard in Pitakotte area in Sri Jayewardenepura was raided yesterday following a tip off received by the Mirihana police.

title: Sri Lanka to probe hidden foreign assets after Rajapaksa defeat
content: Sri Lanka’s new government is to investigate black money transferred overseas by powerful figures in the administration of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa, a cabinet spokesman said on Thursday.

title: President raps Basnayake for endorsing Gotabhaya’s action
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has asked new Defence Secretary B.M.U.D. Basnayake to explain why the latter endorsed predecessor Gotabhaya Rajapaksa’s actions pertaining to a bank account and a floating armoury.

title: Saudi King Abdullah dies, new ruler is Salman
content: Saudi Arabia’s King Abdullah died early on Friday and his brother Salman became king, the royal court in the world’s top oil exporter and birthplace of Islam said in a statement carried by state television.

title: Gemunu promises 7% cut in bus fares
content: With the recent price reduction of fuel, private bus fares will also be reduced by 6 to 7 per cent soon, said the President of the Private Bus Owner’s Association, Gemunu Wijeratne.

title: Sri Lanka rupee forwards recover after state bank dollar sales
content: Sri Lankan rupee forwards ended a tad firmer on Thursday, snapping a four-session losing streak as a state bank sold dollars to prevent further depreciation after the currency fell on importer dollar demand in early trade, dealers said.

title: Hotline for Complaints on Fuel Prices
content: Addressing the Cabinet Press Briefing held a short while ago, Minister of Power and Energy Patali Champika Ranawaka requested the public to forward any complaints if  fuel stations refuses to pump fuel at the new prices or if they charge higher prices for fuel to the following telephone numbers:

title: Cabraal’s and Sajin’s passports seized
content: Passports of UPFA MP Sajin De Vass Gunawardene and former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal were ordered to be seized by the Bribery Commission, state media reported….

title: As Obama visits, signs that India is pushing back against China
content: When Sri Lanka unexpectedly turfed out President Mahinda Rajapaksa in an election this month, it was the biggest setback in decades for China’s expansion into South Asia – and a remarkable diplomatic victory for India.

title: National Executive Council mulls banning crossovers
content: JVP leader and MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday revealed that among far reaching constitutional reforms that had been discussed by the National Executive Council were restricting a single parliamentary term to five years from present six and Parliament could be dissolved only after the completion of four and half years subject to approval by a two-thirds majority in the House.

title: Fuel prices reduced from midnight
content: Fuel prices have been reduced with effect from midnight today, the Government Information Department said.

title: All charges dropped against Sarath Fonseka
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, issuing a special order, has made a directive to drop all charges against former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka and restore all his civic rights, Army titles with immediate effect.

title: CJ to resign soon: Rajitha
content: The Government hopes that Chief Justice Mohan Pieris will resign from his post soon after he met Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and assured he would do as soon as possible, Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne said today….

title: Former PM’s son Anuradha Jayaratne surrenders
content: Anuradha Jayaratne, son of former Prime Minister D. M. Jayaratne, and three other persons were enlarged on bail by the Gampola Magistrate’s Court, this morning.

title: Thewarapperuma arrested
content: Ruling party Parliamentarian Palitha Thewarapperuma has been arrested by the Colombo Crime Division (CCD), a short while ago, Police Spokesperson SSP Ajith Rohana said.

title: Buses deployed for election rallies – SLTB waiting for payment
content: Minister of Internal Transport Ranjith Maddumabandara says that it has been revealed that the SLTB is yet to receive money for the buses they provided for rallies of the UPFA during the presidential election.

title: We will arrest Thewarapperuma – SSP
